original: rgyu mtshan yin no zhes na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yin no zhes na /
translated: If you say that is the reason,

original: gal te spyi rang dang 'brel pas khyad par rnams kyi bdag nyid khyad par gzhan dag las mi 'dra bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te spyi rang dang 'brel pas khyad par rnams kyi bdag nyid khyad par gzhan dag las mi 'dra bar byed na /
translated: then if the specific attributes are differentiated from other attributes due to their relation to the universal,

original: 'o na ni khra bo la sogs pa rnams kyi ngang pa la sogs pa las mi mthun pa nyid phan tshun mi mthun pa khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir spyi tha dad par rtogs pas chog ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni khra bo la sogs pa rnams kyi ngang pa la sogs pa las mi mthun pa nyid phan tshun mi mthun pa khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir spyi tha dad par rtogs pas chog ste /
translated: then it is sufficient to understand that the universal is distinct because the variegated and so on are differentiated from the goose and so on, since they are included in the specific attributes that are mutually incompatible.

original: rnam pa de 'dra ba'i mi 'dra ba dang ldan pa 'di dag rang gi rgyu dag kho na las skye bar 'gyur mod //
analyzed: rnam pa de 'dra ba'i mi 'dra ba dang ldan pa 'di dag rang gi rgyu dag kho na las skye bar 'gyur mod //
translated: These that possess such a form of incompatibility are indeed generated from their own causes alone.

original: 'di ltar spyi dang 'brel pas byas pa'i 'di dag gi mi mtshungs pa'i bdag nyid gal te spyi nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi dang 'brel pas byas pa'i 'di dag gi mi mtshungs pa'i bdag nyid gal te spyi nyid yin na /
translated: In that case, if the specific nature of these that is produced by their relation to the universal is the universal itself,üîΩthen the universal would be distinct from the specific attributes.

original: 'o na ni nang gi bdag nyid la ngang pa la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba yod pa'i phyir de la mi srid pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di ba lang rnams kyi nus pa yin zhes bstan /
analyzed: 'o na ni nang gi bdag nyid la ngang pa la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba yod pa'i phyir de la mi srid pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di ba lang rnams kyi nus pa yin zhes bstan /
translated: But since the inner self is not similar to the geese, etc., it is not possible for it to be the cause of the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: gal te ba lang zhes khyad par nyid de bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ba lang zhes khyad par nyid de bstan pa yin na /
translated: If the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is taught to be a specific quality,

original: khyad par can gyi bdag nyid thun mong ma yin pas na /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi bdag nyid thun mong ma yin pas na /
translated: then since the specific quality is not common to the self,

original: de dag rta zhes brjod pa'i khyad par gzhan dag la de dag khyad par du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag kho na'i nus pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin /
analyzed: de dag rta zhes brjod pa'i khyad par gzhan dag la de dag khyad par du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag kho na'i nus pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin /
translated: how could it be the cause of the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù?

original: 'on te spyi nyid yin na khyad par nus pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on te spyi nyid yin na khyad par nus pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: But if the universal is the cause, then the specific quality is not the cause.

original: 'on te khyad par gyi bdag nyid thun mong ma yin yang /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par gyi bdag nyid thun mong ma yin yang /
translated: But if the specific quality is not common to the self,

original: gcig po de dang 'brel pa la khyad par du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gcig po de dang 'brel pa la khyad par du 'gyur na /
translated: and if the specific quality is related to the self,üîΩthen the specific quality is not the cause of the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: de gzhan la med pa de'i bdag nyid rjes su zhugs pas khyad par phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba khyad par thams cad la srid pa ma yin pa gsal pa nyung zad la brten pa yin pa'i phyir de dag de ltar sgrub par nus pa'i rang gi
analyzed: de gzhan la med pa de'i bdag nyid rjes su zhugs pas khyad par phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba khyad par thams cad la srid pa ma yin pa gsal pa nyung zad la brten pa yin pa'i phyir de dag de ltar sgrub par nus pa'i rang gi
translated: Since the particularities of other things do not exist in it, it is not possible for all the different particularities of different characteristics to exist in it.

original: rgyu dag kho na la de ltar skye la rag mod /
analyzed: rgyu dag kho na la de ltar skye la rag mod /
translated: Therefore, it is established that only those causes that are capable of producing those effects produce them.

original: de dag la spyis ci bya /
analyzed: de dag la spyis ci bya /
translated: What use are the universals?

original: des na gsal ba rnams so so'i bdag nyid kho na gsal ba gzhan dag dang mi 'dra ba yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: des na gsal ba rnams so so'i bdag nyid kho na gsal ba gzhan dag dang mi 'dra ba yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the individual essences of the particulars are not similar to other particulars.üîΩIn the same way, even though the eye and so on are not similar in aspect, they are the nature of the absence of each other, and the single eye consciousness is their activity.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid ma yin yang mig la sogs pa phan tshun med pa'i rang bzhin rnams la mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig byed pa nyid yod pa kho na tha dad par khyad par med kyang rna ba la sogs pa ni ma
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid ma yin yang mig la sogs pa phan tshun med pa'i rang bzhin rnams la mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig byed pa nyid yod pa kho na tha dad par khyad par med kyang rna ba la sogs pa ni ma
translated: Even though they are not different, the ear and so on are not like that.

original: yin no // gal te gcig tu rtogs pa yang 'dir ci'i ched du bgrang zhe na /
analyzed: yin no // gal te gcig tu rtogs pa yang 'dir ci'i ched du bgrang zhe na /
translated: If it is asked why it is counted here, it is as follows.

original: don rnams rang gi ngo bos kyang de ltar 'khrul @237b pa skyed par gyur par bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: don rnams rang gi ngo bos kyang de ltar 'khrul @237b pa skyed par gyur par bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is taught that the object itself also generates that error.

original: mig la sogs pa la mi srid par log par rtogs pa med pas na dper bstan to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la mi srid par log par rtogs pa med pas na dper bstan to //
translated: Since there is no erroneous conception that it is impossible for the eye and so on, it is given as an example.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
translated: As for just as, and so on, it is a commentary.

original: dbang po dang yul dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams sam /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams sam /
translated: The faculties, objects, light, and attention,

original: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don dang / de rnams phrad pa la ni mtshungs pa yeng pa ma yin na /
analyzed: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don dang / de rnams phrad pa la ni mtshungs pa yeng pa ma yin na /
translated: or the self, faculties, mind, object, and their contact, are not the same in not being distracted.

original: bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan du grags pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan du grags pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: As for the self, and so on, it is dependent on what is known elsewhere.

original: dbang la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba bshad nas /
analyzed: dbang la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba bshad nas /
translated: Having explained like the faculties and so on,

original: gcig rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the realization of one, and so on,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says in the same way, and so on.

original: gzhan zhes bya bas ni sogs pa'i sgra'i don bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya bas ni sogs pa'i sgra'i don bshad do //
translated: By other, the meaning of the plural particle is explained.

original: kha cig ces brjod pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: kha cig ces brjod pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: As for the explanation of some,

original: tha dad par khyad par med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad par khyad par med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though they are not different‚Äù means that even though they are not different, they are not the same.

original: dper na shing sha pa dang seng ldeng la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba med kyang tshogs pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba gcig skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: dper na shing sha pa dang seng ldeng la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba med kyang tshogs pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba gcig skyed par byed kyi /
translated: For example, even though the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ and the k·π£ƒ´ra tree, etc., are not different, they produce the same effect, such as a collection, etc.,

original: chu la sogs pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: but not water, etc.

original: de dag kyang shing sha pa la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang shing sha pa la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not different from the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ, etc.

original: de bshad pa ni tha dad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //üîΩdper na gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du rna ba la sogs pa ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni tha dad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no // dper na gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du rna ba la sogs pa ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚ÄúEven though they are not different, etc.‚ÄùüîΩFor example, the ear, etc., are not the cause of the consciousness of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba la ni rna ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skyed par byed pa'i bya ba med pa ji lta bar ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba la ni rna ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skyed par byed pa'i bya ba med pa ji lta bar ro //
translated: Just as the ear, etc., do not have the function of producing the arising of the consciousness of form, etc.,

original: tha dad kyang mig la sogs pas gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: tha dad kyang mig la sogs pas gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed kyi /
translated: even though they are different, the eye, etc., produce the consciousness of form, etc.

original: rna ba la sogs pas ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pas ma yin no //
translated: not by the ear, etc.

original: dper na sman kha cig ces bya ba ni dpe gzhan dgod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sman kha cig ces bya ba ni dpe gzhan dgod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, some medicines‚Äù is the statement of another example.

original: dper na sman kha cig tha dad kyang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba sman gzhan dang lhan cig pas sam /
analyzed: dper na sman kha cig tha dad kyang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba sman gzhan dang lhan cig pas sam /
translated: For example, some medicines, although different, are called ‚Äúco-existent‚Äù because they are co-existent with other medicines,

original: so so yis zhes bya ba phan tshun ltos pa med par rims la sogs pa zhi bar byed par mthong gi spyis ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: so so yis zhes bya ba phan tshun ltos pa med par rims la sogs pa zhi bar byed par mthong gi spyis ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: or ‚Äúindividual‚Äù because they are seen to cure fevers, etc., without mutual dependence, but not by their generality.

original: sha rib dang kha rab la sogs pa ni lhan cig pas kyang rims sel bar byed la /
analyzed: sha rib dang kha rab la sogs pa ni lhan cig pas kyang rims sel bar byed la /
translated: The flesh, leaves, etc. cure fevers when co-existent,

original: re res kyang ngo //
analyzed: re res kyang ngo //
translated: and also individually.

original: 'di dag spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But their generality does not exist.

original: spyi med kyang gzhan ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi med kyang gzhan ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Even without a generality, it is not so for others.

original: yang ci'i phyir dpe gzhan bstan zhen /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dpe gzhan bstan zhen /
translated: Again, why is another example taught?

original: smras pa mig la sogs pa la spyi srid pa ni sa bon med pa can kho na'o //
analyzed: smras pa mig la sogs pa la spyi srid pa ni sa bon med pa can kho na'o //
translated: It is said: The existence of a generality in the eye, etc. is only without a seed.

original: 'di dag la ni sman nyid spyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di dag la ni sman nyid spyir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the mere medicine is the generality.

original: des na de ltar @238a * //
analyzed: des na de ltar @238a * //
translated: Therefore, it is like that.

original: phyogs snga ma'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'di ltar bkod de /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'di ltar bkod de /
translated: This is set forth in this way in order to make a distinction between the two sides.

original: spyi gcig dang ldan pas 'di dag la 'bras bu gcig yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: spyi gcig dang ldan pas 'di dag la 'bras bu gcig yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning is that they do not have a single effect because they do not have a single universal.

original: yang na dper zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dper zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
translated: Or, the example, etc., is the commentary.

original: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba 'di ni skabs rnyed de rtsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba 'di ni skabs rnyed de rtsod par byed pa'o //
translated: If you think, etc., is the opponent‚Äôs objection.

original: 'bras bu gcig byed pa de lta bu de dag las gang las de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams la 'bras bu gcig mi srid pa gang yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig byed pa de lta bu de dag las gang las de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams la 'bras bu gcig mi srid pa gang yin /
translated: From among those that perform a single effect, from which is the effect of that? Because of that, the manifestation of a single effect is impossible.

original: sngar bshad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba sman nyid la sogs pa'i spyi cung zad cig yod do zhe na /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba sman nyid la sogs pa'i spyi cung zad cig yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is some universal, such as the universal of medicine, etc., then the previously explained fault arises.

original: dgag pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: In order to refute that, he says, That is not correct.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa la /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa la /
translated: Because there is no difference, it is said.

original: gang zhes bya ba la ltos pa na spyi yis ma yin zhes brjod pa dang 'grel pa ston par byed pa na 'grel pa las spyi zhes smos te /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba la ltos pa na spyi yis ma yin zhes brjod pa dang 'grel pa ston par byed pa na 'grel pa las spyi zhes smos te /
translated: When the word what is used, it is said not by the universal, and when the commentary is being taught, the commentary states universal, and

original: spyi'i ma yin no zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma'i cha dang 'brel pas ston pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i ma yin no zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma'i cha dang 'brel pas ston pa'o //
translated: it is taught that not by the universal is connected with the first part of the verse.

original: 'bras bu de byed pa zhes bya ba ni rims la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i sman mthong ba'i phyir de dag 'bras bu de brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu de byed pa zhes bya ba ni rims la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i sman mthong ba'i phyir de dag 'bras bu de brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase that effect is produced by it is stated because medicine that cures fevers and so on is seen.

original: de la khyad par med pa'i phyir spyis rims la sogs pa zhi bar mthong ba zhes bya ba dang 'brel pas na /
analyzed: de la khyad par med pa'i phyir spyis rims la sogs pa zhi bar mthong ba zhes bya ba dang 'brel pas na /
translated: Since there is no difference in that, it is connected with the phrase the universal is seen to cure fevers and so on, and

original: spyis 'bras bu byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: spyis 'bras bu byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: it is stated that the universal does not produce the effect.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩ It is said:

original: de dag zhing sogs tha dad kyang //
analyzed: de dag zhing sogs tha dad kyang //
translated: Although the fields and so on are different,

original: khyad par med par thal 'gyur phyir //üîΩzhes smras so //
analyzed: khyad par med par thal 'gyur phyir // zhes smras so //
translated: it follows that there is no difference.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang zhig yod na gang 'byung ba de ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yod na gang 'byung ba de ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: When one exists, if another arises, then the latter is the effect.

original: rims la sogs zhi ba yang sman rnams yod na 'byung ba'i chos can yin pa na /üîΩgal te yang 'di gsal ba yod pa 'byung ba yin nam /
analyzed: rims la sogs zhi ba yang sman rnams yod na 'byung ba'i chos can yin pa na / gal te yang 'di gsal ba yod pa 'byung ba yin nam /
translated: Also, the pacification of contagious diseases and so on occurs when medicine is present.

original: spyis yin zhes khyad par du rjes su 'gro ldog rtogs pa med pa de lta na yang rnam pa gzhan gyis spyi'i 'bras bu nyid bsal nas de gsal ba'i 'bras bu kho nar nges par byed do //
analyzed: spyis yin zhes khyad par du rjes su 'gro ldog rtogs pa med pa de lta na yang rnam pa gzhan gyis spyi'i 'bras bu nyid bsal nas de gsal ba'i 'bras bu kho nar nges par byed do //
translated: If one does not understand the pervasion and counter-pervasion of a specific property by a general property, then even though one does not know the pervasion and counter-pervasion of the specific property, one can still ascertain that the specific property is the effect of the general property by eliminating the general property as the effect.

original: 'di ltar rgyu khyad par med kyang 'bras bu khyad par du 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu khyad par med kyang 'bras bu khyad par du 'gyur ba na /
translated: Thus, even though the cause is not specific, the effect is specific.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu yod pa na rgyu med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu yod pa na rgyu med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the effect exists when the cause does not,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med pa de nyid yin no //
translated: the specific property does not follow the pervasion and counter-pervasion of the general property.

original: spyi la ni khyad par 'ga' yang srid pa ma yin pa des na /üîΩde'i 'bras bu yin na sman rnams zhing la sogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa la /
analyzed: spyi la ni khyad par 'ga' yang srid pa ma yin pa des na / de'i 'bras bu yin na sman rnams zhing la sogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa la /
translated: Since the general property is not possible as a specific property,

original: rims la sogs pa zhi ba de khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rims la sogs pa zhi ba de khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: if it is the effect of the specific property, then the pacification of contagious diseases and so on would not be specific, because the medicine and so on are different.

original: khyad par yang yod de /
analyzed: khyad par yang yod de /
translated: There is a difference.

original: zhing 'ga' zhig @238b las sle tres la sogs pa rnams nus pa gang na nyid kyis myur du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: zhing 'ga' zhig @238b las sle tres la sogs pa rnams nus pa gang na nyid kyis myur du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because in some fields, such as sesame, etc., the general is not quickly produced by its own power,

original: gzhan las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: but in others it is.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: If, etc. is explained as follows.

original: 'on te zhing la sogs pa tha dad pas spyi khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes smos so //üîΩgal te zhing tha dad pas kyang spyi khyad par du 'gyur na der gsal ba tha dad pa rnams la tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rtogs pa tha mi dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te zhing la sogs pa tha dad pas spyi khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes smos so // gal te zhing tha dad pas kyang spyi khyad par du 'gyur na der gsal ba tha dad pa rnams la tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rtogs pa tha mi dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the general is not distinguished by the difference of field, etc., then it is said that it is not distinguished.

original: de tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the general is distinguished by the difference of field, then the different manifestations would not be distinguished by the reason of difference, because they are distinguished by that.

original: des na rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it follows that their own nature is impaired.

original: sun dbyung ba gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sun dbyung ba gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
translated: Another refutation is stated:

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ltos pa na skabs su bab pa'i spyi nyid dang 'brel pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ltos pa na skabs su bab pa'i spyi nyid dang 'brel pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: When it is said ‚Äúwhat,‚Äù it shows that the general itself is related to the context.

original: spyi zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is called a universal.

original: gtan tshigs de bas na phan 'dogs med phyir yang spyi ni rtag pa yin pa des na 'gyur yang phan 'dogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de bas na phan 'dogs med phyir yang spyi ni rtag pa yin pa des na 'gyur yang phan 'dogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason is that since the universal is permanent, it does not assist.

original: des na gsal ba rnams bzhin du spyi yod na yang 'bras bu 'byung ba yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: des na gsal ba rnams bzhin du spyi yod na yang 'bras bu 'byung ba yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, even if the universal exists, as the particulars do, it cannot be said that the effect arises.

original: spyi 'bras bu med pa nyid gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi 'bras bu med pa nyid gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal is without effect, it is damaged.

original: phan 'dogs pa med pa nyid ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa med pa nyid ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: The absence of assistance is established by the text beginning with ‚ÄúIf the universal . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te spyis 'bras bu byed na lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir cig car thams cad mngon bar sgrub par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gal te spyis 'bras bu byed na lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir cig car thams cad mngon bar sgrub par 'gyur ro ;
translated: If the universal produces an effect, then it would produce all effects simultaneously, because it does not depend on cooperating conditions.

original: /'di yang mngon du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'di yang mngon du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is also demonstrated.

original: gal te spyi bzhin du gsal ba yang skad cig ma nyid ma yin pas na /
analyzed: gal te spyi bzhin du gsal ba yang skad cig ma nyid ma yin pas na /
translated: If, like the universal, the particulars also were not momentary,

original: 'ga' la yang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'ga' la yang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: then because they would not assist anything,üîΩ.

original: de ltar spyi la bton pas khyad par du 'phags pa zhig brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar spyi la bton pas khyad par du 'phags pa zhig brjod ce na /
translated: If it is asked how it is superior by being applied to the general,

original: ji ltar khyad par du 'phags pa med /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par du 'phags pa med /
translated: it is superior because it is not different.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba skad cig ma ma yin pas nye bar mi sbyor na skad cig nyid kyis phan dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba skad cig ma ma yin pas nye bar mi sbyor na skad cig nyid kyis phan dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a clear appearance is not applied because it is not momentary, it is beneficial through momentariness.

original: spyi ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: spyi ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin na /
translated: If a generality is not momentary,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur go //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur go //
translated: it would not exist in its own entity.

original: dpe ni de ltar spyi khyad par med pa'i phyir dang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bsgrubs nas gsal ba khyad par dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i
analyzed: dpe ni de ltar spyi khyad par med pa'i phyir dang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bsgrubs nas gsal ba khyad par dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i
translated: Having proven that because a generality is not different and does not benefit, it is not the cause of the difference of the result, in order to explain that because a clear appearance has a difference, it is the one that follows its difference,

original: phyir / gsal ba dus dang yul zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir / gsal ba dus dang yul zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he said, ‚ÄúThe clear appearance is time and place.‚Äù

original: rgyu'i khyad par las khyad par sgrub pas 'bras bu'i khyad par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par las khyad par sgrub pas 'bras bu'i khyad par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since a difference is established from the difference of the cause, it becomes the cause of the difference of the result.

original: 'di yang skad cig ma nyid du yang mdun @239a * //
analyzed: 'di yang skad cig ma nyid du yang mdun @239a * //
translated: This is also the case for momentariness.

original: nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be the teacher of barley.

original: des na de ltar /
analyzed: des na de ltar /
translated: Therefore, in that way,

original: dper na sman kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa //
analyzed: dper na sman kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa //
translated: for example, some medicine, etc.

original: zhes bya ba gzhung 'jugs  pa brjod nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gzhung 'jugs  pa brjod nas /
translated: Having stated the text,

original: gcig rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub par ston pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub par ston pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the statement of the proof beginning with one realization is in the same way.

original: des na de dag de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las kyang khyad par med par tha dad par grub po zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: des na de dag de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las kyang khyad par med par tha dad par grub po zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement that they are established as different even from those that are not their effects is

original: de dag byed pa na de mi byed pa can dag las tha dad pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag byed pa na de mi byed pa can dag las tha dad pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because when they are produced, they are different from those that do not produce them, they are said to be non-different.

original: de rgyu can ma yin pa dag las kyang tha dad pa'i phyir de dag tha mi dad par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de rgyu can ma yin pa dag las kyang tha dad pa'i phyir de dag tha mi dad par bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation that they are non-different even from those that are not their causes is

original: gcig gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because of the one, etc.

original: de de ltar bsam pa la ltos na spyi khas blangs pa dang / rnam par rtogs pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa dang / spyi zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes gnas pa na /
analyzed: de de ltar bsam pa la ltos na spyi khas blangs pa dang / rnam par rtogs pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa dang / spyi zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes gnas pa na /
translated: When he is thus reflecting, he is in a state of mind in which he has accepted the universal, and he is not yet aware that the conceptual thought does not have a real entity for its object, and that there is no such thing as a universal.

original: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa dag gis kyang blo la ltos pa'i spyi la don rnam par gnas pa 'grub pa de bstan pa'i phyir rtsod pa slong bar byed pa ni yang ci zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa dag gis kyang blo la ltos pa'i spyi la don rnam par gnas pa 'grub pa de bstan pa'i phyir rtsod pa slong bar byed pa ni yang ci zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show how the universal, which is dependent on the intellect, is established as the referent of conceptual thoughts, even though the latter do not have real entities for their objects, he raises the objection: ‚ÄúBut how can there be a universal?‚Äù

original: gnyi ga ltar yang nyes pa ci yod ces rtsod par byed pa la 'dri pa na /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang nyes pa ci yod ces rtsod par byed pa la 'dri pa na /
translated: He raises the objection: ‚ÄúWhat is wrong with both?‚Äù

original: de la ces 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la ces 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He asks: ‚ÄúWhat is wrong with that?‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul du mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul du mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is impossible for a specific property to be the object of a conceptual thought,

original: gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi rang gi mtshan nyid phyi rol gyi dngos po mtshungs pa zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi rang gi mtshan nyid phyi rol gyi dngos po mtshungs pa zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: he understands that the universal, which is defined as the exclusion of other, is the specific property of an external thing.

original: yang na gzhan phyi rol gyi dngos po ma yin pas ji ltar don byed /
analyzed: yang na gzhan phyi rol gyi dngos po ma yin pas ji ltar don byed /
translated: Or else, since it is not an external object, how can it be causally effective?

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir gal te 'di lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi spyis rang gi mtshan nyid mtshungs so zhes rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin gzhan kho na
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir gal te 'di lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi spyis rang gi mtshan nyid mtshungs so zhes rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin gzhan kho na
translated: This is what is being said: since conceptual thoughts do not have real objects, if one thinks, ‚ÄúThe universal is the same as the particular in terms of its own nature,‚Äù it is not an object of knowledge. However, the nature of a real thing is something else.

original: yin no // 'o na ji ltar du bas me rjes su dpog pas 'jug pa mes bsgrub par bya ba 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: yin no // 'o na ji ltar du bas me rjes su dpog pas 'jug pa mes bsgrub par bya ba 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: Well then, how is it that one infers fire from smoke and thereby achieves the goal to be accomplished by fire?

original: rnam par rtog pa de me'i yul can yin no zhes me ma yin pa rig pas zhugs pas mes bsgrub par bya ba'i don grub pa ni ma yin //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de me'i yul can yin no zhes me ma yin pa rig pas zhugs pas mes bsgrub par bya ba'i don grub pa ni ma yin //
translated: That conceptual thought is the object of fire is not established by the cognition that is not fire. Therefore, the goal to be accomplished by fire is not established.

original: de ltar ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na /
translated: If that were not so,

original: smig rgyu la chur shes pa na yang chus bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur shes pa na yang chus bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then when one cognizes a mirage as water, the goal to be accomplished by water would be established.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i pa'i yul la de mi byed pa las tha dad pa yang rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i pa'i yul la de mi byed pa las tha dad pa yang rnyed par dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to find a universal that is different from the nonperformance of that with respect to the object of a conceptual cognition.

original: des na ji ltar 'di de byed pa nyid kyi de mi byed pa dag @239b las tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi mtshungs so bya bar nges par bya /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'di de byed pa nyid kyi de mi byed pa dag @239b las tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi mtshungs so bya bar nges par bya /
translated: Therefore, just as this is the performance of that, one should ascertain that the universal is the characteristic that is different from the nonperformance of that.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
translated: Another fault is stated:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Also, with respect to the particular characteristic.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyis rnam par rtog pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa'i phyir gal te byas pa nyid las sgra mi rtag par rjes su dpog pa na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyis rnam par rtog pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa'i phyir gal te byas pa nyid las sgra mi rtag par rjes su dpog pa na /
translated: Because conceptual cognitions do not have as their object the universal of impermanence, if one infers that sound is impermanent from the fact that it is produced,

original: sgra mi rtogs na ni don mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra mi rtogs na ni don mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if one does not understand sound, then the meaning is not understood to be impermanent.

original: de bzhin du bdag med pa nyid la sogs par rjes su dpag pa gzhan yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag med pa nyid la sogs par rjes su dpag pa gzhan yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, other inferences such as the inference of selflessness would not exist.

original: gzhan yang rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i yul can yin pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa de lta bur gyur pa dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no zhes grub na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i yul can yin pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa de lta bur gyur pa dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no zhes grub na /
translated: Moreover, if it were established that impermanence, selflessness, etc. are the nature of things because they are objects of inference,

original: cha med pa'i don mngon sum gyis bzung ba na de dag bzung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: cha med pa'i don mngon sum gyis bzung ba na de dag bzung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then when partless objects are apprehended by perception, those [impermanence, etc.] would also be apprehended.

original: rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin na ni 'di dag rnam par rtog pa'i snang pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin na ni 'di dag rnam par rtog pa'i snang pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: But if inference is not the object of things, then these are only appearances of conceptualization,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo ni ma yin no ;
translated: and not the nature of things.

original: ; de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ; de bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ste mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ste mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Those also, i.e., impermanence, etc.

original: de dag ni dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: They are not the nature of things,

original: brtags pa'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtags pa'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because they abide in the nature of conceptualization.üîΩBut isn't it said that they are objects of meaning in dependence on special adherence? That is true,

original: lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas don gyi yul can du brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na bden mod kyi ;
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas don gyi yul can du brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na bden mod kyi ;
translated: but that is not the case here.

original: 'on kyang gal te mi rtag pa nyid rig pa ma yin pa nyid yin na de lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gi sa /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te mi rtag pa nyid rig pa ma yin pa nyid yin na de lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gi sa /
translated: But if it is not the awareness of impermanence, then it is not the awareness of impermanence.üîΩ

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi yul can du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi yul can du mi 'thad do //
translated: But if it is not the cognition of impermanence, then it is not tenable that it has impermanence as its object, because of the power of adherence.

original: rig pa las ma gtogs par ni yul gyi don 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: rig pa las ma gtogs par ni yul gyi don 'ga' yang med do //
translated: And apart from cognition, there is no object of the object.

original: des na mir rtag pa nyid mi shes pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i yul can du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mir rtag pa nyid mi shes pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i yul can du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as one does not know impermanence, consciousness does not have impermanence as its object.

original: de ste mi rtag pa nyid rig pa kho na yin na ni rig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i yul can yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ste mi rtag pa nyid rig pa kho na yin na ni rig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i yul can yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is the cognition of impermanence, then it has impermanence as its object because of cognition itself, not because of adherence.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po'i yul can ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'di bsal ba'i phyir nyes pa de ni med de zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po'i yul can ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'di bsal ba'i phyir nyes pa de ni med de zhes smos so //
translated: So how can it be that conceptual thoughts do not have real things as their objects? To clear this up, he says, ‚ÄúThere is no fault here.‚ÄùüîΩHe says that it is not the case that the object is just like the object of conceptual thought, but that it is like the object of non-conceptual cognition.

original: de ltar mtshungs so zhes rtogs par bya ba ni gzhan yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar mtshungs so zhes rtogs par bya ba ni gzhan yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show that it is not the case that the object is just like the object of conceptual thought, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúThe object of conceptual thought is not real.‚Äù

original: shes pa la snang ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shes pa la snang ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is called the appearance in consciousness.

original: gzhan thun pa la sogs pa yang 'di kho nar yin no //
analyzed: gzhan thun pa la sogs pa yang 'di kho nar yin no //
translated: The same is true of the other conditions, such as the sense faculties.

original: rnam par shes pa de ji lta bur gyur pa dang / don yang ji lta bur gyur pa dang / de @240a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ji lta bur gyur pa dang / don yang ji lta bur gyur pa dang / de @240a * //
translated: How is consciousness? How is the object?

original: zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Anticipating this question, he says:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is asked,

original: de ni bdag tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag tu smra ba'o //
translated: This is the doctrine of self.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, means because of the abandonment of the apprehension of self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dor ba na ni 'jug pa'i yan lag med pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dor ba na ni 'jug pa'i yan lag med pa yin te /
translated: When the apprehension of self is abandoned, there is no basis for engaging in cyclic existence.

original: 'di ltar de yod na snga ma dang / phyi mar gcig pa sdug bsngal ba'i bdag sgro btags nas di la zhen pas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de yod na snga ma dang / phyi mar gcig pa sdug bsngal ba'i bdag sgro btags nas di la zhen pas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when it exists, one engages in cyclic existence by superimposing a self that is the same in the past and future and is the experiencer of suffering.

original: bdag rig pa skad cig ma'i med pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin pa kho na'o zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag rig pa skad cig ma'i med pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin pa kho na'o zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The nonexistence of a self that is a unitary, permanent entity is not a basis for engaging in cyclic existence.üîΩThe reply is:

original: gal te 'di la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is asked,

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa ma bzlog na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa ma bzlog na'o //
translated: Otherwise, means if the apprehension of self is not eliminated.

original: bdag sdug bsngal la brten par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag sdug bsngal la brten par 'gyur na /
translated: If I were to be dependent on suffering,üîΩthen I would engage in the aim of abandoning that.

original: de'i phyir de spangs pa'i don du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de spangs pa'i don du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the doubt.

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid du mi 'dod na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid du mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept that it is suffering,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa ci ltar 'dor zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa ci ltar 'dor zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: how can you abandon the conception of self?üîΩThe reply is:

original: de de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is so.‚Äù

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa med par gzhan gyi don la 'jug na /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa med par gzhan gyi don la 'jug na /
translated: If one engages in the aim of others without the conception of self,üîΩthen the assertion of self is meaningless.

original: bdag tu smra ba don med do zhes brjod pa ni /üîΩgal te gzhan don med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba don med do zhes brjod pa ni / gal te gzhan don med ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in:üîΩ‚ÄúIf there is no aim of others.‚Äù

original: med pa nyid yin mod ni skabs kyis gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: med pa nyid yin mod ni skabs kyis gzhan gyi don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is so‚Äù refers to the aim of others in the context.üîΩIf there is no permanent self, how can one perform the aim of others?

original: bdag rtag pa med na ci ltar gzhan gyi don byed ces bya bar dogs pa nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa med na ci ltar gzhan gyi don byed ces bya bar dogs pa nas brjod pa ni /
translated: The reply is:

original: bdag ni skad cig ces bya ba'o //üîΩde nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gang la gzhan gyi 'dod pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni skad cig ces bya ba'o // de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gang la gzhan gyi 'dod pa yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe self is momentary.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúBy that alone‚Äù refers to where there is the assertion of others.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phan tshun gnod par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phan tshun gnod par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the mutual harm.

original: yun ring du bde zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par ni kun dga' ba tsam bdag gi rang bzhin rtag tu mngon par gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: yun ring du bde zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par ni kun dga' ba tsam bdag gi rang bzhin rtag tu mngon par gsal ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúHappiness for a long time‚Äù means that the nature of the self is always manifest in nirvana, which is mere joy.

original: des na 'bras bu nyid kyis bdag gi ba'i bde ba mi rtag pa yongs su 'dor pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu nyid kyis bdag gi ba'i bde ba mi rtag pa yongs su 'dor pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, by the result itself, one abandons the impermanent happiness that belongs to the self.

original: yun ring bde ba zhes bya ba ni lan no //üîΩmthong ba dag la ni myong ba'i mthu 'dren pa las mngon par mngon par 'dod pas 'khor ba pa rnams 'jug pa yin gyi ci skad brjod pa'i rang bzhin can yun ring po'i bde ba la ni nam yang mthong ba med de des na gang gis don du
analyzed: yun ring bde ba zhes bya ba ni lan no // mthong ba dag la ni myong ba'i mthu 'dren pa las mngon par mngon par 'dod pas 'khor ba pa rnams 'jug pa yin gyi ci skad brjod pa'i rang bzhin can yun ring po'i bde ba la ni nam yang mthong ba med de des na gang gis don du
translated: ‚ÄúHappiness for a long time‚Äù is the reply.

original: gnyer pa 'jug pa de la 'dod par ci ltar 'gyur /üîΩgal te brgya la yun ring por bde par 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: gnyer pa 'jug pa de la 'dod par ci ltar 'gyur / gal te brgya la yun ring por bde par 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
translated: Since those who are in cyclic existence are engaged in the pursuit of the power to experience what is seen, they are not at all interested in the nature of what is said, i.e., happiness for a long time. Therefore, how could they be interested in that which is the object of their pursuit?

original: 'jug par brjod na /
analyzed: 'jug par brjod na /
translated: If one were to say that one is engaged in the pursuit of happiness for a long time,

original: de'i tshe med par yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba la the tshom ni @240b dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe med par yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba la the tshom ni @240b dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, there would be no doubt, because doubt does not engage the side of non-existence due to the commonality of existence and non-existence.

original: med pa'i phyogs nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: med pa'i phyogs nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement about the side of non-existence:

original: brgyal bde ba de mi 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: brgyal bde ba de mi 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: It would not be unconscious bliss.

original: des na spre'u zla ba zhas bya ba zla 'od chung zad pa'o //
analyzed: des na spre'u zla ba zhas bya ba zla 'od chung zad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the so-called monkey-moon is the slight moon-light.

original: brgya la yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba the tshom gyi mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni stor ba min no //
analyzed: brgya la yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba the tshom gyi mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni stor ba min no //
translated: The reason for engaging the characteristic of doubt, saying it might exist, is not lost.

original: yang na bdag gi yul la sbyor ba nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na bdag gi yul la sbyor ba nyams pa yin no //
translated: Or, the application to one's own object is impaired.

original: 'on te rnal 'byor pas yun ring po'i bde ba nyams su myong ba nyid yin pa des na /
analyzed: 'on te rnal 'byor pas yun ring po'i bde ba nyams su myong ba nyid yin pa des na /
translated: But if the yogi experiences long-lasting bliss, then

original: yun ring po'i bde ba ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub po snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rnal 'byor gnas skabs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yun ring po'i bde ba ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub po snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rnal 'byor gnas skabs zhes gsungs so //
translated: the reason because long-lasting bliss is not seen is not established, thinking this, the doubt is anticipated and the yogi's state is stated.

original: phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa las kyang 'jug pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni //
analyzed: phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa las kyang 'jug pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni //
translated: He does not engage in it because of the fault of mutual dependence.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus,

original: de'i phyir de ltar bdag tu lta ba can bdag gi ba la zhen pa bzlog pa'i don du 'bag pa dang ldan pa yin yang de bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bdag tu lta ba can bdag gi ba la zhen pa bzlog pa'i don du 'bag pa dang ldan pa yin yang de bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, even though the one who has the view of self is endowed with the conceit of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù in order to stop the conceit of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù he does not stop it.

original: yon tan gyi cha mthong bas de'i nyes pa mthong ba sgrib pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yon tan gyi cha mthong bas de'i nyes pa mthong ba sgrib pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Because he sees the good qualities, he sees the faults as obscured.

original: brtson yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtson yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus,

original: chags pa dang bral ba la brtson yang 'jug pa dang ldan pa ni chags pa dang bral ba'i gegs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba la brtson yang 'jug pa dang ldan pa ni chags pa dang bral ba'i gegs byed pa yin no //
translated: Even though he strives to be free from attachment, he is endowed with engagement and he creates an obstacle to being free from attachment.

original: ci'i phyir snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam na /
translated: Why is this?

original: yon tan cha ston phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yon tan cha ston phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because he shows the aspect of good qualities.

original: gal te bdag kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i rnag bzhin dang de 'am 'bras bu yongs su spyod pa'i rnag bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yul yin pas spang bya nyid ma yin nam snyam du dog spa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i rnag bzhin dang de 'am 'bras bu yongs su spyod pa'i rnag bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yul yin pas spang bya nyid ma yin nam snyam du dog spa bsu ba ni /
translated: If the self is an object of detachment, because of the nature of the one who produces pleasure and pain, and the nature of the one who experiences the result, then is it not to be abandoned?

original: gal te bdag la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this qualm is:

original: rang bzhin gang gis bdag spang bya yin pa de bzhin 'di'i rang bzhin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis bdag spang bya yin pa de bzhin 'di'i rang bzhin gyi /
translated: If the self is an object of detachment,

original: rang bzhin ni med de des na bdag blang bya ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni med de des na bdag blang bya ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa na /
translated: then it is not the self‚Äôs nature to be abandoned.üîΩThe response to this is:

original: da ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now,üîΩin what way,

original: ci ltar rnam pa gang gis rjod ba ni /
analyzed: ci ltar rnam pa gang gis rjod ba ni /
translated: by what means,üîΩis the self to be abandoned?üîΩThe response to this is:üîΩThere is no other way than the one by which the self is abandoned,

original: bdag 'dor zhing spang byar byed pa chags pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'i blang bya de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa yang med pa'i yin no //
analyzed: bdag 'dor zhing spang byar byed pa chags pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'i blang bya de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa yang med pa'i yin no //
translated: by which the self is an object of detachment.

original: gtan tshigs des na sdug bsngal bsgoms pa'i nye bar bstan pa don med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na sdug bsngal bsgoms pa'i nye bar bstan pa don med do //
translated: Therefore, the teaching on the contemplation of suffering is pointless.

original: 'ang gi sgra 'chad pa ni 'di snyam du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra 'chad pa ni 'di snyam du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: ci ltar bdag mi 'dod snyam ma /
analyzed: ci ltar bdag mi 'dod snyam ma /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is explained as follows: ‚ÄúHow could it be that I do not want this?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhes @241a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes @241a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù is stated.

original: med kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: med kyang zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though‚Äù is stated.

original: don de rnams bdag nyid kyis med kyang lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi blos spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i rang bzhin de ltar ston pa'i phyir tha snyad 'di ni de kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: don de rnams bdag nyid kyis med kyang lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi blos spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i rang bzhin de ltar ston pa'i phyir tha snyad 'di ni de kho na ma yin no //
translated: Even though those objects do not exist by themselves, the mind that has the nature of excessive attachment shows them in that way, as having the nature of universals and common loci. Therefore, this convention is not reality.

original: des ni de ltar mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de bstan nas /
analyzed: des ni de ltar mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de bstan nas /
translated: Having taught that, he says, ‚ÄúThat is how it should be understood as being the same.‚Äù

original: yang na ni gzhan gyis ji ltar don byed ces dngos po med pa'i yul can nyid la /üîΩsun 'byin pa brjod pa gang yin pa de spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na ni gzhan gyis ji ltar don byed ces dngos po med pa'i yul can nyid la / sun 'byin pa brjod pa gang yin pa de spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Or else, ‚ÄúHow could another perform an object‚Äôs function?‚Äù is a refutation of the claim that the object is nonexistent.

original: 'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to eliminate that, he says, ‚ÄúAll of this . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bsam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam pa yin te /
translated: The idea is as follows.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyi rtsa ba can nyid kyis na rnam par rtog pa ni gdon mi za bar mthong ba'i don gyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyi rtsa ba can nyid kyis na rnam par rtog pa ni gdon mi za bar mthong ba'i don gyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: Since it is rooted in the latent impressions of experience, conceptual thought must follow the object that is seen.

original: des yul du byas pa las gzhan 'dzin na ni /
analyzed: des yul du byas pa las gzhan 'dzin na ni /
translated: If it apprehends something other than what is experienced,

original: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags la brten pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags la brten pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be rooted in the latent impressions of experience.

original: de la gang la nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta bur gyur pa kho na de'i 'du byed pas bskyed pa'i blo la snang ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de la gang la nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta bur gyur pa kho na de'i 'du byed pas bskyed pa'i blo la snang ba yin na ni /
translated: If the form that is experienced appears in the cognition produced by its formative force,

original: rnam par rtog pa 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then conceptual thought would not be mistaken.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa de'i 'du byed pas bskyed pa nyid yin yang de'i 'du byed pas bskyed pa nyid kyis de yongs su spangs te gzhan rjes su rtogs par mi nus la rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa de'i 'du byed pas bskyed pa nyid yin yang de'i 'du byed pas bskyed pa nyid kyis de yongs su spangs te gzhan rjes su rtogs par mi nus la rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba
translated: Even though conceptual thought is produced by the formative force of that , it cannot abandon that and understand something else by virtue of being produced by that formative force. But because of its conceptual nature, it cannot understand something else that is not experienced.

original: bzhin rtogs par nus pa dang bral bas snang ba tha dad pas nye bar mtshon pa de'i rang bzhin gzhan du gyur pa la don du lhag par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba de'i tshe 'di 'khrul pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhin rtogs par nus pa dang bral bas snang ba tha dad pas nye bar mtshon pa de'i rang bzhin gzhan du gyur pa la don du lhag par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba de'i tshe 'di 'khrul pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Since it is devoid of the ability to realize the nature of the object, the conceptualization that conceives the nature of the object to be different from the appearance arises. At that time, it is called ‚Äúerror.‚Äù

original: mi 'dra ba tsam gyi ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba tsam gyi ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: [The object] becomes different merely through being dissimilar.

original: 'khrul par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul par ni ma yin no //
translated: [The object] is not erroneous.

original: 'khrul pa nyid ni mi 'dra ba la yang de nyid du zhen pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid ni mi 'dra ba la yang de nyid du zhen pas byas pa yin no //
translated: Error is produced by conceiving that which is dissimilar to be the same.

original: de'i 'du byed pa'i rtsa ba can nyid kyis 'brel pa'i snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa nyid kyi snang ba las rnam par brtag par bya ba mi 'dra ba nyid ni khra bo las ser skya mi 'dra ba lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i 'du byed pa'i rtsa ba can nyid kyis 'brel pa'i snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa nyid kyi snang ba las rnam par brtag par bya ba mi 'dra ba nyid ni khra bo las ser skya mi 'dra ba lta bu yin gyi /
translated: The dissimilar object of conceptualization is produced from the appearance of connection, which is rooted in the appearance of conceptualization. The dissimilar object of conceptualization is like a variegated object being dissimilar to a tawny object.

original: khra bo dang bum pa mi 'dra ba lta bu ni ma yin no /
analyzed: khra bo dang bum pa mi 'dra ba lta bu ni ma yin no /
translated: It is not like a variegated object being dissimilar to a pot.

original: des na rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mthong ba'i 'du byed pa las skyes pa'i bag chags kyis byas pas na 'khrul pa 'di dngos po ji lta ba bzhin pa'i bslad pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: des na rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mthong ba'i 'du byed pa las skyes pa'i bag chags kyis byas pas na 'khrul pa 'di dngos po ji lta ba bzhin pa'i bslad pa yin par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, this error is said to be a distortion of things as they are, since it is produced by the latent impressions of the formative forces that are seen by intrinsic natures.

original: 'khrul pa gnyis ni dngos po'i khyad par srid pa dang mi srid pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbye ba ste /üîΩdper na zla ba la @241b zla ba gnyis su snang ba'am /
analyzed: 'khrul pa gnyis ni dngos po'i khyad par srid pa dang mi srid pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbye ba ste / dper na zla ba la @241b zla ba gnyis su snang ba'am /
translated: The two errors are distinguished by the presence or absence of the possibility of a particular entity.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the appearance of two moons in the moon or the appearance of a jewel in the light of a jewel.

original: zla ba gnyis dang nor bu'i rnam pa dag ni zla ba dang sgron ma la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis dang nor bu'i rnam pa dag ni zla ba dang sgron ma la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The forms of two moons and a jewel do not exist in the moon and the light of a jewel.

original: rang gi 'od 'khyims pa la nor bu'i 'od chen por nges pas nor bu'i 'od la nor bur nges pa ni srid pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi 'od 'khyims pa la nor bu'i 'od chen por nges pas nor bu'i 'od la nor bur nges pa ni srid pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The determination of a jewel in the light of a jewel is an error by the nature of the possibility of a jewel in the light of a jewel.

original: 'khyims pa'i tshad kyis nor bu chen por nges kyang der nor bu yod pa ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khyims pa'i tshad kyis nor bu chen por nges kyang der nor bu yod pa ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although the determination of a great jewel by the size of the light is not negated by the existence of a jewel there.

original: mig mi gsal bas gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis yongs su bskor ba'i sgron ma rtogs pa la de lta bu'i nor bu chen por nges pa ni dngos po dang mi ldan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mig mi gsal bas gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis yongs su bskor ba'i sgron ma rtogs pa la de lta bu'i nor bu chen por nges pa ni dngos po dang mi ldan pa kho na'o //
translated: The lamp that is completely surrounded by the ma·πá·∏çala of clarity, because the eyes are unclear, is ascertained as that great gem, which is only devoid of substance.

original: de'i phyir don ji lta ba bzhin du 'khrul pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don de dang 'brel pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir don ji lta ba bzhin du 'khrul pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don de dang 'brel pas /
translated: Therefore, the conceptual thought that is deluded just as it is in meaning is related to that meaning.

original: der mi 'khrul pas na rtogs pa de las 'jug pa de dmigs pa nyid med kyang /
analyzed: der mi 'khrul pas na rtogs pa de las 'jug pa de dmigs pa nyid med kyang /
translated: Since it is undeluded there, the engagement from that realization does not exist as an object.

original: de thob pa'i rtsa ba can des bsgrub pa'i don bya ba grub pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de thob pa'i rtsa ba can des bsgrub pa'i don bya ba grub pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: However, since it is the root of obtaining that, the activity of the object to be accomplished by that is not nonexistent.

original: du ba las me rtogs pa na de dang mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa yin yang mi rtogs pa nyid ma spangs pas na /
analyzed: du ba las me rtogs pa na de dang mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa yin yang mi rtogs pa nyid ma spangs pas na /
translated: When fire is realized from smoke, although the nature that is incompatible with that is realized, since nonrealization itself is not abandoned,

original: zhugs pas me thob pa na bsregs pa la sogs pa grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhugs pas me thob pa na bsregs pa la sogs pa grub pa bzhin no //
translated: when fire is obtained by the one who engages in that, the accomplishment of burning and so on is established.

original: tshul 'di rnam par rtog pa thams cad la ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul 'di rnam par rtog pa thams cad la ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This method does not exist for all conceptual thoughts.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams gtan med pa'i don rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams gtan med pa'i don rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conceptual thoughts of permanence, etc. are conceptual thoughts of a meaning that does not exist at all.

original: dngul la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni de'i yul dang dus na med pa rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: dngul la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni de'i yul dang dus na med pa rtog pa yin no //
translated: The conceptual thoughts of silver, etc. are conceptual thoughts of what does not exist at a particular place and time.

original: dngos po'i yul la mi slu ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i yul la mi slu ste /
translated: They are not mistaken with regard to the object that is a thing,

original: de'i don byed pa gnas par gyur pa'o //üîΩji ltar mthong ba'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'brang ba ni /
analyzed: de'i don byed pa gnas par gyur pa'o // ji ltar mthong ba'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'brang ba ni /
translated: because it is present as a causal process.üîΩThe conceptual thought that follows the specific characteristics as they are seen

original: mthong ba ji ltar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ji ltar rtogs pa'o //
translated: is the conceptual thought that arises from the specific characteristics as they are seen.

original: 'dra ba cung zad tsam bzung ba ni nya phyis la yogs pa la dngul la sogs pa dang ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba cung zad tsam bzung ba ni nya phyis la yogs pa la dngul la sogs pa dang ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The conceptual thought that apprehends a mere similarity is like the conceptual thought of silver, etc. with regard to a shell, as was previously explained.

original: mi rtag pa nyid rtag pa dang 'dra ba ni sngon po tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rtag pa dang 'dra ba ni sngon po tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis /
translated: Impermanence is similar to permanence because of the nature of mere blue.

original: dus gsum khyab pa ste /üîΩgcig ni mi 'jog pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dus gsum khyab pa ste / gcig ni mi 'jog pa'i phyir la /
translated: It pervades the three times

original: gzhan ni rgyun 'dra ba skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni rgyun 'dra ba skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is not posited and the other is the cause of the generation of a similar continuum.

original: 'dir dpe ni /
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni /
translated: The example here is

original: mar me'i 'od la nor bur rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mar me'i 'od la nor bur rtogs pa yin no //
translated: the conceptual thought of a jewel with regard to the light of a lamp.

original: des na yang na ni ji ltar gzhan gyi don byed ces gang brjod pa'i skyon med do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na yang na ni ji ltar gzhan gyi don byed ces gang brjod pa'i skyon med do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in saying that it is not known how the other‚Äôs purpose is accomplished.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù is the reason.

original: gal te 'di me ma yin par rig pa yin na mes bsgrub par bya ba 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di me ma yin par rig pa yin na mes bsgrub par bya ba 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not known that this is fire, there is no error in establishing fire.

original: yang na me rig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin @242a * //
analyzed: yang na me rig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin @242a * //
translated: Or, if the nature of the mere cognition of fire

original: las me'i yul can yin na ni dngos po med pa'i yul can me rig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las me'i yul can yin na ni dngos po med pa'i yul can me rig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is the object of fire, then the cognition of fire would not have a nonexistent object.

original: de lta na 'o na smig rgyu la chur rig pa yang chur rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na bden mod kyi chu ni med do //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na smig rgyu la chur rig pa yang chur rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na bden mod kyi chu ni med do //
translated: In that case, the cognition of a mirage as water would also be the cognition of water. Although that is true, there is no water.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pa ni don med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pa ni don med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, inference is not meaningless,

original: don la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not erroneous with respect to the object.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni don gyi bya ba med kyang don bya ba 'grub pa 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni don gyi bya ba med kyang don bya ba 'grub pa 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although the object of conceptual consciousness does not perform the function of an object, it is tenable that the function of the object is accomplished.

original: gzhan du na don yul du ma byas pa'i phyir dang / don grub par 'gyur ba des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid las yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na don yul du ma byas pa'i phyir dang / don grub par 'gyur ba des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid las yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because the object is not taken as an object, and because the object is accomplished, it would be said that it is from the object of conceptualization.

original: don nyid las yin na ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul de ltar thal ba med do //üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa yin pa'i phyir de mi byed pa las tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol pa rnam pa tha dad pa la rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa
analyzed: don nyid las yin na ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul de ltar thal ba med do // rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa yin pa'i phyir de mi byed pa las tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol pa rnam pa tha dad pa la rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa
translated: If it were from the object itself, then the consequence of the object of conceptualization would not arise.

original: ma yin nam zhes bya ba de nyid du bsal zin to //
analyzed: ma yin nam zhes bya ba de nyid du bsal zin to //
translated: As for what was said, ‚Äúbecause the object of conceptualization is different from the specific characteristic, it would not be different from that which does not perform the function,‚Äù that has already been refuted in the statement, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it the case that non-Buddhists do not engage in conceptualization of different aspects?‚Äù

original: sgra mi rtag pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'di lta bu'i bdag nyid spyi rang gi mtshan nyid mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang spang ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'di lta bu'i bdag nyid spyi rang gi mtshan nyid mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang spang ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la
translated: Because sound is not understood to be impermanent, it is not impermanent because a generality that is not similar to its own character is not of this nature.

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: In order to refute that, he says,üîΩ‚Äúby its own nature.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid la mi rtag pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid la mi rtag pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Impermanence exists by its own nature through its own character.

original: 'di ltar dngos po g-yo ba nyid 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i mi rtag pa nyid yin gyi mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i spyi dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po g-yo ba nyid 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i mi rtag pa nyid yin gyi mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i spyi dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, impermanence is called the ‚Äúdestructibility‚Äù of a thing that is moving. It is not that it is endowed with a generality called ‚Äúimpermanence.‚Äù

original: des na gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi spyis rang gi mtshan nyid mtshungs par rnam par mi rtog mod /
analyzed: des na gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi spyis rang gi mtshan nyid mtshungs par rnam par mi rtog mod /
translated: Therefore, if impermanence that appears to thought is not similar through a generality that is its nature, it is certainly not nonconceptual.

original: de tsam gyis ni de la mi rtag pa nyid med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni de la mi rtag pa nyid med pa ma yin te /
translated: But just because of that, it is not that it is not impermanent.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po sngon ma byung ba byung nas med par 'gyur ba de mi rtag pa ji ltar ma yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po sngon ma byung ba byung nas med par 'gyur ba de mi rtag pa ji ltar ma yin /
translated: Why is it not impermanent if a thing that did not exist previously comes into existence and then ceases to exist?

original: 'di ltar mi rtag par rtogs pas kyang dngos po de lta bur gyur pa nyid rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag par rtogs pas kyang dngos po de lta bur gyur pa nyid rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one determines that the thing is impermanent by understanding it to be impermanent.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: de de lta bu la skad cig mar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de de lta bu la skad cig mar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is that which endures for a moment in that way.‚Äù

original: des na skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du gnas pa'i phyir dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du 'dzin pa na 'di ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: des na skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du gnas pa'i phyir dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du 'dzin pa na 'di ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because it endures in accordance with the nature of momentary endurance, when a thing is apprehended in accordance with the nature of momentary endurance, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is impermanent.‚Äù

original: 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid do snyam du sems par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid do snyam du sems par 'gyur gyi /
translated: One thinks, ‚ÄúThis is impermanence.‚Äù

original: gang gis na sel ba'i bdag @242b nyid 'di gzhan gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir dngos po de lta bu mi 'gyur ba spyi 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa la ltos pa ni ma yin pa des na blo yang de yod pa la mi ltos so snyam du bsams pa'o
analyzed: gang gis na sel ba'i bdag @242b nyid 'di gzhan gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir dngos po de lta bu mi 'gyur ba spyi 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa la ltos pa ni ma yin pa des na blo yang de yod pa la mi ltos so snyam du bsams pa'o
translated: Since it is not a universal that possesses some other thing that is not impermanent, because it is the nature of a thing that is impermanent, the cognition of impermanence does not depend on the existence of impermanence.

original: // des na dngos po dang rtogs pa yang 'jig pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yod pa yin no zhes bsgrubs te de dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gzhan dang ldan pa yin yang rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: // des na dngos po dang rtogs pa yang 'jig pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yod pa yin no zhes bsgrubs te de dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gzhan dang ldan pa yin yang rnam par rtog pa
translated: Therefore, since the thing and the realization are also destroyed, impermanence exists for things, etc.üîΩThis is the proof. Even though it has a nature that is contrary to that, it is still the case that the nature appears in that way to thought.

original: la yang de lta bu'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni yod pa nyid du ston pa de'i chos nyid kho na la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: la yang de lta bu'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni yod pa nyid du ston pa de'i chos nyid kho na la 'jug pa ste /
translated: This is the engagement in the reality of that.

original: gzugs brnyan dang ldan pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par byed pa na'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang ldan pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par byed pa na'o //
translated: When one realizes the nature of the thing itself through the possession of the reflection,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du snang bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du snang bar gyur pa na /
translated: if the thought appears as impermanent,üîΩit would indicate multiplicity, such as variegated, cow, and large.

original: khra bo dang ba lang dang chen po zhes du ma nyid du ston par byed par 'gyur la ba lang zhes gcig bstan pa ni chos can bstan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: khra bo dang ba lang dang chen po zhes du ma nyid du ston par byed par 'gyur la ba lang zhes gcig bstan pa ni chos can bstan par 'gyur la /
translated: If it indicated oneness, it would indicate the property-possessor.

original: tha dad par bstan na ni chos bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par bstan na ni chos bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it indicated difference, it would indicate the property.

original: des na don la mi srid pa'i chos kyis rnam par bcad pa'i mi rtag pa nyid snang ba yang phyi rol snang ba na ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: des na don la mi srid pa'i chos kyis rnam par bcad pa'i mi rtag pa nyid snang ba yang phyi rol snang ba na ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of impermanence, which is the exclusion of a permanent thing that is impossible in reality, is not an external appearance.

original: de lta na yang mi rtag par snang ba ma spangs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa rtogs pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang mi rtag par snang ba ma spangs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa rtogs pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, because the appearance of impermanence is not abandoned, it is not the case that the realization of impermanence is absent.
