original: dngos po med pa la brten pa nyid kyis 'di dag ji ltar dngos po'i gzugs brnyan dang ldan pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la brten pa nyid kyis 'di dag ji ltar dngos po'i gzugs brnyan dang ldan pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How do these, which are based on non-things, possess the form of things?

original: dgos pa 'di la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dgos pa 'di la bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation for this purpose is:

original: de rnams rten med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams rten med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are not without a basis.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ma yin yang de rnams rten med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ma yin yang de rnams rten med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though they are not the cause of their own characteristics, they are not without a basis.

original: de'i chos nyid la 'jug pa na mthong ba'i bag chags kyis de lta bu'i gzugs brnyan nyid skye ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i chos nyid la 'jug pa na mthong ba'i bag chags kyis de lta bu'i gzugs brnyan nyid skye ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: When engaging with the reality of that, a form that is like a reflection arises due to the latent tendencies of seeing.

original: ; de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ; de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show that for this very reason, there is no fault of these becoming non-things, it is said:

original: dngos po med pa'i chos nyid kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i chos nyid kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Nor is it the dharmatƒÅ of non-entities.

original: gal te 'di dag dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba spangs nas snang ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba spangs nas snang ba yin na ni /
translated: If these [appearances] were to appear while abandoning the conformity with the nature of entities,

original: dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: they would not be the dharmatƒÅ of entities.

original: gang gi tshe nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas nye bar 'ongs pa dngos po'i chos su gyur pa dag kho na snang ba de'i tshe ji ltar dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas nye bar 'ongs pa dngos po'i chos su gyur pa dag kho na snang ba de'i tshe ji ltar dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: But when those that are experienced and thus present as entities appear, how could they not be the dharmatƒÅ of entities?

original: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin pa yin na /
translated: If they are the nature of entities,

original: 'o na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na /üîΩdngos po la @243a * //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na / dngos po la @243a * //
translated: then how are they mistaken conceptual thoughts?

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: [The answer is:]üîΩ[They are mistaken] because of the nature of entities.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyi sgo nas de ltar nye bar rtogs pa'i dngos po la tha dad pa la sogs par rtogs pa nyid 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyi sgo nas de ltar nye bar rtogs pa'i dngos po la tha dad pa la sogs par rtogs pa nyid 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: The realization of entities that are cognized in this way through the latent tendencies of experience as being different and so on is mistaken.

original: dngos po snang ba ni de'i sgo nas 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po snang ba ni de'i sgo nas 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that the appearance of an entity is an error in that regard.

original: gal te dngos por snang ba 'khrul pa yin na //
analyzed: gal te dngos por snang ba 'khrul pa yin na //
translated: If the appearance of an entity is an error,

original: de ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid rtog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid rtog pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be a conception of impermanence?

original: bden te dngos su ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang zhen pa las so //
analyzed: bden te dngos su ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang zhen pa las so //
translated: It is true that it is not directly, but rather from the attachment to it.

original: 'on te rtag pa nyid mi snang na /
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa nyid mi snang na /
translated: But if permanence does not appear,

original: lhag par zhen pas kyang dngos po yul du byed par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pas kyang dngos po yul du byed par ni mi nus so //
translated: then the attachment to it cannot make the object of the conception of permanence.

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa snang ba las ni de phyi rol dang mi mtshungs pas na dngos su de rig pa dang bral ba yin yang de'i dngos por lhag par zhen pa las rig pa de rig pa ma yin par brjod do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa snang ba las ni de phyi rol dang mi mtshungs pas na dngos su de rig pa dang bral ba yin yang de'i dngos por lhag par zhen pa las rig pa de rig pa ma yin par brjod do //
translated: But since the aspect of impermanence does appear, it is not the same as the external object. Therefore, even though it is not directly the cognition of that, still, from the attachment to it as an entity, it is said that the cognition is not the cognition of that.

original: 'di ltar de ni mi rtag pa yin la mi rtag pa rig pa 'di yang de ltar zhen pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pas na de las de rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba khas len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni mi rtag pa yin la mi rtag pa rig pa 'di yang de ltar zhen pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pas na de las de rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba khas len pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is impermanent, and the cognition of impermanence is conceived in that way. Therefore, there is no contradiction. Thus, we accept that it is a cognition of that.

original: de ltar rnam par gnas par grub pa la mngon par zhen pas mi 'thad kyang dngos po'i yul can nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gnas par grub pa la mngon par zhen pas mi 'thad kyang dngos po'i yul can nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the cognition is established as existing in that way, and it is not that it has a real object.

original: rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin par yang rung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin par yang rung ba kho na'o //
translated: It is suitable that the cognition is not one that has a real object.

original: de ltar rig pa ni de'i yul can ma yin pa'i dngos por ma rtogs pa yin la de yang rnam pa de ltar rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos su dngos po rig pa dang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rig pa ni de'i yul can ma yin pa'i dngos por ma rtogs pa yin la de yang rnam pa de ltar rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos su dngos po rig pa dang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition is not a cognition of that object, but it is not the case that it does not realize a real thing. Because it is to be cognized in that way, it is not different from a cognition that directly cognizes a real thing.

original: dngos su de lta bu la de ltar rtogs pa yang dngos po las mi 'khrul pa las rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po yod pa'i phyogs gzhan la yang bye brag med do //
analyzed: dngos su de lta bu la de ltar rtogs pa yang dngos po las mi 'khrul pa las rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po yod pa'i phyogs gzhan la yang bye brag med do //
translated: Also, the cognition that directly cognizes it in that way is not mistaken with respect to a real thing. There is no difference in the position that a cognition of that kind exists.

original: rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa tsam las de'i yul can ma yin yang de rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa tsam las de'i yul can ma yin yang de rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin na /
translated: Even though it is not a cognition of that object, it is a cognition of that object because it is merely in accordance with the realization.

original: dung ser por shes pa la sogs pa dag gis kyang rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dung ser por shes pa la sogs pa dag gis kyang rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and the cognition of a yellow conch, etc.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: are not valid cognitions,

original: mngon sum 'jug pa med pas mngon sum gyi chos dang bral ba'i phyir dang / de'i yul can ma yin par rtogs pas ni tshad ma gzhan dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum 'jug pa med pas mngon sum gyi chos dang bral ba'i phyir dang / de'i yul can ma yin par rtogs pas ni tshad ma gzhan dang bral ba yin no //
translated: because they are devoid of the property of direct perception, since direct perception does not operate, and because they are devoid of another valid cognition, since they are recognized as not being the object of that.

original: 'khrul pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are mistaken,

original: don gcig dang zhes smos so //üîΩ'bras bu gcig dang du ma byed pa las 'bras bu gcig dang du ma shes par 'dod na ngo bo de nyid bstan pa'i ched du gcig dang du ma nyid du byed pa nyid @243b du gzhag pa byas pa'i gcig dang du mar 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: don gcig dang zhes smos so // 'bras bu gcig dang du ma byed pa las 'bras bu gcig dang du ma shes par 'dod na ngo bo de nyid bstan pa'i ched du gcig dang du ma nyid du byed pa nyid @243b du gzhag pa byas pa'i gcig dang du mar 'dzin gyi /
translated: and because they have the same object.

original: dngos po gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is maintained that the cognition of a single or multiple effect is the cognition of a single or multiple object, then the apprehension of a single or multiple object is posited by the mere fact of its being the cause of a single or multiple effect, and not because the object has the nature of being single or multiple.

original: gal te dngos po la tha dad pa yod na 'di du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin zhing tha dad pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pas kyang dngos po gzhan dang gcig tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po la tha dad pa yod na 'di du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin zhing tha dad pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pas kyang dngos po gzhan dang gcig tu 'gyur la /
translated: If a thing has difference, it would have a multiple nature, and because it would be associated with the succession of differences, it would be one with another thing.

original: de lta na yang 'di ma 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ma 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: But even so, it would not be nonerroneous.

original: rgol ba'i yan lag gis 'di 'di ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgol ba'i yan lag gis 'di 'di ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not established in this way by the opponent‚Äôs position,

original: rang gi rgyu kho na las yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho na las yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it exists from its own cause alone.

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: rang gi rgyu nyid las da ltar 'gyur ba na dgos pa 'di 'grub pa'i phyir de ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu nyid las da ltar 'gyur ba na dgos pa 'di 'grub pa'i phyir de ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: but we say this because when it becomes present from its own cause, this purpose is accomplished.

original: dngos po de tha dad pa ma yin na ni chos tha dad pa la brten pa'i du ma nyid srid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po de tha dad pa ma yin na ni chos tha dad pa la brten pa'i du ma nyid srid pa ma yin la /
translated: If that thing is not different, it is not possible for multiplicity to depend on different attributes.

original: gang las spyi'i bdag nyid kyis gsal ba gzhan dang / gcig tu 'gyur ba spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las spyi'i bdag nyid kyis gsal ba gzhan dang / gcig tu 'gyur ba spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that the universal and the particular are one, because the universal is manifested by the other.

original: des na gcig dang du mar 'dzin pa ni 'khrul pa kho na'o //üîΩgang las chos tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: des na gcig dang du mar 'dzin pa ni 'khrul pa kho na'o // gang las chos tha dad pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of unity and plurality is only an error.üîΩHow can there be non-different entities,

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid med par 'gyur ba dngos po tha mi dad pa nyid ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid med par 'gyur ba dngos po tha mi dad pa nyid ji ltar zhe na /
translated: from which there would be neither a difference of attributes nor a nature consisting of universals and particulars?

original: gcig po de la zhes smos so //
analyzed: gcig po de la zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúin that unity.‚Äù

original: re zhig cig nyid kyi phyir dngos po'i bdag nyid la du ma mi rung ba'i phyir dngos po chos tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig cig nyid kyi phyir dngos po'i bdag nyid la du ma mi rung ba'i phyir dngos po chos tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: First, because of the unity itself, plurality is not possible in the nature of an entity, so an entity does not have a nature of non-different attributes.

original: don de dag ni du ma nyid du 'gyur gyi ;
analyzed: don de dag ni du ma nyid du 'gyur gyi ;
translated: Those objects would be many,

original: du ma'i bdag nyid gcig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ma'i bdag nyid gcig ni ma yin no //
translated: but a single nature of the many does not exist.

original: don gzhan dang gcig pa nyid kyang mi rung ste /
analyzed: don gzhan dang gcig pa nyid kyang mi rung ste /
translated: Also, being identical to another object is not possible,

original: du ma la yang gcig med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir dngos po ni chos tha dad pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin la /
analyzed: du ma la yang gcig med pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir dngos po ni chos tha dad pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin la /
translated: because even in the many, the one does not exist.üîΩTherefore, an entity does not have a nature consisting of different attributes,

original: de'i bdag nyid don gzhan dang gcig tu 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir spyi dang khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid don gzhan dang gcig tu 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir spyi dang khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid med do //
translated: and because it does not become identical to another object, it does not have a nature consisting of universals and particulars.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid la tha dad pa dang khyad par gzhan dang gcig tu gyur pa yang med mod //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid la tha dad pa dang khyad par gzhan dang gcig tu gyur pa yang med mod //
translated: Because of contradiction, there is no difference in their own nature, nor is there any other difference or oneness.

original: dngos po tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of things that is not different becomes different.

original: des na gcig du ma nyid ni ma yin la phan tshun tha dad pa rnams kyi ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i chos gzhan nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir du ma gcig pa yin no zhes dogs pa la tha dad pa yang bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes smos
analyzed: des na gcig du ma nyid ni ma yin la phan tshun tha dad pa rnams kyi ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i chos gzhan nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir du ma gcig pa yin no zhes dogs pa la tha dad pa yang bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes smos
translated: Therefore, there is neither one nor many. Because the otherness of the phenomena such as cowness of mutually different things is not different, there is the doubt that many are one. To that, ‚Äúbecause difference is also refuted‚Äù is stated.

original: so // rjes 'gro gzhan yang snang ba med ces tha dad pa ni bkag zin to //
analyzed: so // rjes 'gro gzhan yang snang ba med ces tha dad pa ni bkag zin to //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúwithout appearance‚Äù is the refutation of difference.

original: des na gcig dang du mar 'dzin pa ni 'khrul pa nyid du 'thad do //üîΩtha dad pa @244a * //
analyzed: des na gcig dang du mar 'dzin pa ni 'khrul pa nyid du 'thad do // tha dad pa @244a * //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of one and many is tenable as just error.

original: la nyes pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: la nyes pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
translated: The other fault of difference is explained:

original: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù means

original: tha dad pa rnams kyi gzhi mthun pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams kyi gzhi mthun pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a common locus of the different is not tenable.

original: ba lang nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rigs dang dkar po la sogs pa yon tan rnams ni rdzas las gzhan nyid yin pa des na /
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rigs dang dkar po la sogs pa yon tan rnams ni rdzas las gzhan nyid yin pa des na /
translated: The characteristics of a cow, such as its species and its qualities such as its whiteness, are different from the substance.

original: 'di gnyis gzhi mthun pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di gnyis gzhi mthun pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable for these two to be a common locus.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because they have different natures.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ba lang zhes bya bar btags pa ni dkar po'i rnam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ba lang zhes bya bar btags pa ni dkar po'i rnam pa ma yin te /
translated: This is what is being said: The designation ‚Äúcow‚Äù is not the form of whiteness,

original: de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different from that.

original: des na ji ltar de de'i rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid gzhi mthun par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ji ltar de de'i rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid gzhi mthun par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be a common locus that is the nature of the conception of that?

original: 'khrul pa la ltos nas 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa la ltos nas 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say it is because of dependence on error,üîΩit is not so.

original: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: sgra'i don don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin zhes smos so //
analyzed: sgra'i don don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin zhes smos so //
translated: the meaning of the word is just as the thing is.

original: don gyi rang bzhin ji lta ba de kho na ltar sgrar brjod do zhes khas len na dkar po zhes rtogs pa ba lang gi tshig gi don gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na de rtogs /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin ji lta ba de kho na ltar sgrar brjod do zhes khas len na dkar po zhes rtogs pa ba lang gi tshig gi don gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na de rtogs /
translated: If you accept that the word expresses the nature of the object just as it is, then since the word ‚Äúwhite‚Äù is not the nature of the object cow, how could it be understood?

original: de lta ma yin na snam bu dang bum pa zhes bya ba yang gzhi mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na snam bu dang bum pa zhes bya ba yang gzhi mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then ‚Äúcloth‚Äù and ‚Äúpot‚Äù would be synonymous.

original: gang zhig rang gi rang bzhin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa de rang gi tshig gi gzugs dang bral bas gzugs la re ba na /
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi rang bzhin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa de rang gi tshig gi gzugs dang bral bas gzugs la re ba na /
translated: If one understands ‚Äúthe nature of itself,‚Äù then since it is devoid of the form of its own words, when one hopes for form,

original: de'i ngo bor rung ba nye bar gnas pa de'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin na tha dad pa'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor rung ba nye bar gnas pa de'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin na tha dad pa'i phyogs la ni /
translated: if one understands it to be the nature of that which is present as suitable for its nature, then in the case of difference,

original: 'ga' yang 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir 'ga' la yang re ba med pas na 'ga' dang yang 'brel ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir 'ga' la yang re ba med pas na 'ga' dang yang 'brel ba ma yin no //
translated: since there is no understanding of anything as the nature of anything, since there is no hope for anything, it is not related to anything.

original: 'o na gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin du rtogs pa de rang gi tshig gis des stong bar rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir der yang de rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin du rtogs pa de rang gi tshig gis des stong bar rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir der yang de rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, if one understands that something is the nature of something else, then one cannot understand that it is empty of that by means of that expression. So how can one understand that?

original: ji ltar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not possible at all.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la yang sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du mi rung ba'i phyir te /üîΩde lta yin na dngos don rnams //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la yang sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du mi rung ba'i phyir te / de lta yin na dngos don rnams //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the referent of a word is an entity just as it is, in either of the two positions, that of difference or nondifference.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As it was explained in the statement, ‚ÄúIf that were the case, entities would be . . . ‚Äù

original: sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du khas blangs kyang /
analyzed: sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du khas blangs kyang /
translated: Even if one accepts that the referent of a word is an entity just as it is,

original: tha dad pa la gzhi mthun par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad pa la gzhi mthun par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could there be a common locus of difference?

original: 'di ltar dngos po gcig rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par du ma dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gcig rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par du ma dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one entity has many attributes, such as being a class.

original: des na 'di khyad par du ma dang ldan par dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ba lang zhes khyad par gcig gis bstan pas ni de dang ldan par rtogs par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan la re ba @244b dang bcas pa dkar po zhes de ltar bstan pas ni
analyzed: des na 'di khyad par du ma dang ldan par dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ba lang zhes khyad par gcig gis bstan pas ni de dang ldan par rtogs par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan la re ba @244b dang bcas pa dkar po zhes de ltar bstan pas ni
translated: But when it is indicated by the word ‚Äúwhite‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúwhite cow,‚Äù

original: de dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is understood to possess that.

original: de smras pa ni /
analyzed: de smras pa ni /
translated: He says this:

original: gal te khyad par de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te khyad par de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that distinction . . . ‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya bas ni skabs su bab pa'i tha snyad pa rnams bzung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ces bya bas ni skabs su bab pa'i tha snyad pa rnams bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose‚Äù refers to the conventional expressions that are relevant.

original: de zlog pa ni phan mi 'dogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de zlog pa ni phan mi 'dogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that do not benefit‚Äù is the negation of that.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba ni bdag la brten pa'i brjod pa dang rtogs pa dag gis don la tha snyad du byed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba ni bdag la brten pa'i brjod pa dang rtogs pa dag gis don la tha snyad du byed par byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdistinctions‚Äù refers to the expressions and thoughts that are based on the self, which cause one to engage in the conventional practice of designating objects.

original: gang gi tshe khyad par rnams de tsam gyi gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa de'i tshe med kyang yod pa'i phyir ji ltar des de ltar tha snyad byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyad par rnams de tsam gyi gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa de'i tshe med kyang yod pa'i phyir ji ltar des de ltar tha snyad byed pa'am /
translated: When the differences are not dependent on that much, then, even though they do not exist, they exist. How can they be conventionally designated by that?

original: de nye bar sgyur bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nye bar sgyur bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or how can they be transformed by that?

original: khyad par ni gdon mi za bar de'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur dogs na /
analyzed: khyad par ni gdon mi za bar de'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur dogs na /
translated: If you think that the differences must be dependent on that,

original: 'di ni de'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not tenable that they are dependent on that,

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not benefit it.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa ni khyad par la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa ni khyad par la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: That which possesses the differences does not benefit the differences.

original: de dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni /
translated: That which possesses the differences

original: bdag nyid nye bar bsgyur ba'am /
analyzed: bdag nyid nye bar bsgyur ba'am /
translated: is not transformed by the differences,

original: nye bar bsgyur ba'i shes pa de la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bsgyur ba'i shes pa de la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition that is transformed depends on that which possesses the differences.

original: khyad par la ni khyad par dang ldan pas bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par la ni khyad par dang ldan pas bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The differences do not exist as the activity of that which possesses the differences.

original: des na khyad par dang ldan pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par dang ldan pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which possesses the differences benefits it.

original: phan 'dogs pa yod na ni /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa yod na ni /
translated: If there is benefit,

original: de nyid la bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir de'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid la bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir de'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is obtained by itself, it is not dependent on another.

original: 'o na nye bar sgyur bar byed pa yin gyi phyir khyad par gyis de dang ldan pa la phan gdags par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nye bar sgyur bar byed pa yin gyi phyir khyad par gyis de dang ldan pa la phan gdags par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is the modifier, then the particular is to be benefited by it.

original: de ltar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi nus te /
translated: That is not possible,

original: de phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa'i phyir de med kyang yod pas na de la brten pa'i tha snyad kyis khyad par 'grub pa'i yan lag ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa'i phyir de med kyang yod pas na de la brten pa'i tha snyad kyis khyad par 'grub pa'i yan lag ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is not dependent on another, since it is the benefactor. Even if it does not exist, it exists. Therefore, it is not a part of the establishment of the particular by the convention based on it.

original: / des na khyad par nyid gzhan gyi dbang du 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: / des na khyad par nyid gzhan gyi dbang du 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the particular itself is dependent.

original: de ltar yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: But that is not correct,

original: ltos par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not to be relied on.

original: gal te rdzas dang khyad par 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: gal te rdzas dang khyad par 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin nam //
translated: But isn‚Äôt there a relation characterized by the connection of substance and particular?

original: de ni rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based on substance.

original: des na ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang ma yin zhe na /
translated: So how is it not dependent?

original: de dang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po las gzhan gyi dbang du 'du bas byas pa ni /
analyzed: de dang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po las gzhan gyi dbang du 'du bas byas pa ni /
translated: and it is included in the dependent because it is different from the entity of the support and the supported.

original: 'chad par 'du ba'i tshul gyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po las 'da' ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'du ba'i tshul gyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po las 'da' ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that it is not beyond the entity of the produced and the producer because it is included in the mode of explanation is the dependent itself.

original: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos @245a * //
analyzed: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos @245a * //
translated: If it is the entity of the produced and the producer,

original: po yin na tha dad pas lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgras gnyis brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: po yin na tha dad pas lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgras gnyis brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is not expressed by the word ‚Äúox‚Äù because it is different and does not simultaneously abide, and because it does not express two things.

original: ba lang nyid kyis nye bar bsgyur ba'i rdzas brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyis nye bar bsgyur ba'i rdzas brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The substance modified by oxness would not be expressed.

original: khyad par gyis ni rnam par gnas pa kho na la rang la brten pa'i shes pa nye bar sdud pa yin no ;
analyzed: khyad par gyis ni rnam par gnas pa kho na la rang la brten pa'i shes pa nye bar sdud pa yin no ;
translated: It is only in the case of a particular that a consciousness that is based on it is attracted to it.

original: ; rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid yin na ni khyad par gyi dus na khyad par can med pa nyid kyi phyir 'di gang zhig la shes pa nye bar sdud par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ; rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid yin na ni khyad par gyi dus na khyad par can med pa nyid kyi phyir 'di gang zhig la shes pa nye bar sdud par byed par 'gyur /
translated: If it were the nature of cause and effect, then at the time of the distinction, the distinguished would not exist. So what would the cognition be subsumed under?

original: rtogs pa'i byed pa'i dus na med pa'i don nyid ni byed pas yul du byas pa'i khyad par gyis de'i ngo bor 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i byed pa'i dus na med pa'i don nyid ni byed pas yul du byas pa'i khyad par gyis de'i ngo bor 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The object that does not exist at the time of the activity of understanding is not apprehended as its nature by the distinction of being taken as an object.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa log pa yang blo la snang ba yin te /
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa log pa yang blo la snang ba yin te /
translated: The negation of the possessor of the distinction also appears to the mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams nye ba nyid 'dzin par ma nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams nye ba nyid 'dzin par ma nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not certain that the apprehension of the distinction is the apprehension of the object,üîΩbecause memory and so on are also understood even though they are past.

original: dran pa la sogs pa 'das pa yang rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la blos gcig ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa 'das pa yang rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la blos gcig ces bya ba smos so //
translated: To anticipate this doubt, he says ‚Äúby the mind.‚Äù

original: blos sgro 'dogs pa'i yul du byed pa nyid kyis da lta bar byed pa nyid do ;
analyzed: blos sgro 'dogs pa'i yul du byed pa nyid kyis da lta bar byed pa nyid do ;
translated: The object of superimposition by the mind is made present by the mind itself.

original: ;'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ;'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang gi tshe 'di log pa blos yul du byed pa de'i tshe rang gi bdag nyid du gyur par snang bas de snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di log pa blos yul du byed pa de'i tshe rang gi bdag nyid du gyur par snang bas de snang ba ma yin no //
translated: When the mind makes an object of that which is unreal, it appears as if it were its own nature, but it does not appear as it is.

original: des na de'i yul can gyi blo dngos po'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de'i yul can gyi blo dngos po'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind that has that as its object does not have a real object,

original: de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear.

original: 'on te bdag gi rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te bdag gi rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But if you say that the nature of the self is not that,

original: 'on kyang don gyi shes pa snang bar brjod na /
analyzed: 'on kyang don gyi shes pa snang bar brjod na /
translated: but rather that the cognition of the object is said to appear,

original: de lta na blo'i snang bar khas blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na blo'i snang bar khas blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: then you should not accept that it appears to the mind,

original: gzhan du na de de'i snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de de'i snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because otherwise it would not appear to that.

original: de lta na yang de nyid khyad par gyi gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas khyad par de dang ldan pa bdag de ltar rtogs par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang de nyid khyad par gyi gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas khyad par de dang ldan pa bdag de ltar rtogs par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: But if you accept that it is the form of the particular that is cognized as the nature of that, then you should accept that the self is cognized as having that particular.

original: des na khyad par dang de dang ldan bdag gis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na khyad par dang de dang ldan bdag gis zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the particular and the self that possesses it are the objects of the mind.

original: blo la snang ba'i yul can nyid yin mod /
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i yul can nyid yin mod /
translated: But it is not the case that the mind is the subject that has as its object that which appears to it.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar khas blang par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar khas blang par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: That must be accepted without doubt.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: blo la snang ba'i yul can nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i yul can nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the object that appears to the mind is one.üîΩBecause it appears like that, it is taught:

original: de nyid de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /üîΩde lta bu yis zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: de nyid de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni / de lta bu yis zhes bya ba yin /
translated: By that.

original: 'brel pa tsam yod kyang dus tha dad na rang bzhin dang rang bzhin can nyid ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'brel pa tsam yod kyang dus tha dad na rang bzhin dang rang bzhin can nyid ma yin pas na /
translated: Even though there is merely a connection, if there is a difference in time, it is not the nature and the possessor of the nature.

original: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po skad cig 'jig pa la mi brten pas na /
analyzed: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po skad cig 'jig pa la mi brten pas na /
translated: Since the entity of the produced and the producer does not depend on momentary destruction,

original: rgyu sngar byung ba 'bras bu'i dus na yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir lhan cig pa nyid yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rgyu sngar byung ba 'bras bu'i dus na yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir lhan cig pa nyid yod pa kho na'o //
translated: because the previously arisen cause is not apprehended at the time of the effect, co-existence alone exists.

original: sa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the reason is:

original: gal te khyad par dang de dang ldan pa @245b dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te khyad par dang de dang ldan pa @245b dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: If the particular and that which possesses it.

original: des na de las skyes pa'i phyir ni de'i gzhan gyi dbang yin la /
analyzed: des na de las skyes pa'i phyir ni de'i gzhan gyi dbang yin la /
translated: Therefore, because it arises from that, it is the dependent.

original: de dang lhan cig gnas pas ni de nye bar sgyur bar byed pa nyid 'thad pa yin no zhes 'dogs pa la bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po yin kyang gzhan gyi dbang nyid bzlog pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig gnas pas ni de nye bar sgyur bar byed pa nyid 'thad pa yin no zhes 'dogs pa la bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po yin kyang gzhan gyi dbang nyid bzlog pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: Although the thing that is produced and the producer exist, it is not the case that the dependent nature is reversed.

original: grub pa yod pa ni rang gi ngo bo thob zin pas gzhan gyi dbang med la /
analyzed: grub pa yod pa ni rang gi ngo bo thob zin pas gzhan gyi dbang med la /
translated: That which exists does not have a dependent nature, because it has already obtained its own nature.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that it does not exist,

original: rang gi ngo bor ma reg pa'i phyir ro / des na yod pa dang med pa'i gnas skabs na gzhan gyi dbang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor ma reg pa'i phyir ro / des na yod pa dang med pa'i gnas skabs na gzhan gyi dbang med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not touch its own nature. Therefore, since the dependent nature does not exist in the states of existence and nonexistence,

original: rnam pa thams cad gzhan gyi dbang nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad gzhan gyi dbang nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: it does not exist in any way.

original: gnyi ga yang yod par khyad par med pas gang gis gzhan gyi dbang nyid du brjod cing gang zhig gzhan gyi dbang du brjod du med na yang cung zad med pa gang yin pa de ni 'ga' zhig yang zhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang yod par khyad par med pas gang gis gzhan gyi dbang nyid du brjod cing gang zhig gzhan gyi dbang du brjod du med na yang cung zad med pa gang yin pa de ni 'ga' zhig yang zhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Since both existence and nonexistence are not different, by what is it said to be the dependent nature? And if it is said that it is not the dependent nature, then whatever is nothing at all cannot be the dependent nature of something.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo gzhan las grub pa nyid de la rag las pa de gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba de 'bras bu nyid rgyu dang 'brel pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo gzhan las grub pa nyid de la rag las pa de gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba de 'bras bu nyid rgyu dang 'brel pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the establishment of its own nature in dependence on another were the dependent nature, then the effect itself would be related to the cause.

original: der yang skye ba nyid rag las par brjod kyi /
analyzed: der yang skye ba nyid rag las par brjod kyi /
translated: In that case, arising itself would be said to be dependent,

original: mi 'khrul pa'i sa bon du gyur pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa'i sa bon du gyur pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: but there is no other seed of non-error.

original: 'o na 'di khyad par la 'gyur ba yin no zhe na de ltar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: 'o na 'di khyad par la 'gyur ba yin no zhe na de ltar ni mi nus te /
translated: If you say that it is a distinction, that is not possible.

original: ngo bo gzhan gyi dbang du khas blangs pa med par khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan gyi dbang du khas blangs pa med par khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without accepting the dependent nature as another nature, there is no distinction.

original: 'di ltar yod pa'i dus nyid na de de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir khyad par nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa'i dus nyid na de de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir khyad par nyid do //
translated: Because at the time of existence, it is just that nature.

original: des na gzhan gyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid can gyi gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa de mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid can gyi gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa de mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, that which is of such a nature, the dependent nature, is impossible.

original: des na 'di 'dir rnam pa thams cad du med par brjod do //
analyzed: des na 'di 'dir rnam pa thams cad du med par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it does not exist here in any way.

original: gal te 'di'i rang bzhin ni 'di'i zhes gzhan gyi dbang nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i rang bzhin ni 'di'i zhes gzhan gyi dbang nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt the nature of this understood as the dependent nature?‚Äù

original: rtog pas sgro btags na zhes smos so //üîΩdes na dngos po la mi 'thad pas rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi dbang med pas rtogs pa la snang ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnam pa de lta bu'i rjes su byed pa spangs te /
analyzed: rtog pas sgro btags na zhes smos so // des na dngos po la mi 'thad pas rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi dbang med pas rtogs pa la snang ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnam pa de lta bu'i rjes su byed pa spangs te /
translated: [The root text] says, ‚ÄúIf it is imagined to be superimposed.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i tha snyad du blo kho na ci khas mi len /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tha snyad du blo kho na ci khas mi len /
translated: Therefore, since it is not tenable that [the dependent nature] is an entity, the dependent nature does not exist in any way. Therefore, since it appears to conceptual consciousness, it is not the case that we do not accept that consciousness alone is like that conventionally.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: cig khyad par du ma brjod na /
analyzed: cig khyad par du ma brjod na /
translated: If a distinction is not stated,

original: gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur te khyad par nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur te khyad par nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no common locus, because a distinction is not tenable.

original: dngos po la mi 'thad pa na /
analyzed: dngos po la mi 'thad pa na /
translated: If it is not tenable that [the dependent nature] is an entity,

original: gal te rtogs pa las yod do zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa las yod do zhes 'dod na /
translated: if you assert that it exists from the perspective of conceptual consciousness,

original: rtogs pa nyid kyi rjes su byed par @246a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid kyi rjes su byed par @246a * //
translated: it would follow that it is in keeping with conceptual consciousness,

original: 'gyur te / dngos po'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur te / dngos po'i ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not in keeping with entities.

original: dngos po'i yul can yin na ni /
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can yin na ni /
translated: If it had an entity as its object,

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas skyon du mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang de ltar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas skyon du mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang de ltar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not so, because of the fault stated in the line The one entity called 'object,' etc.

original: des na blo nyid de ltar khas blangs par rigs so //
analyzed: des na blo nyid de ltar khas blangs par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is proper to accept that the cognition itself is like that.

original: de ston pa ni sgra dang tshad ma gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa ni sgra dang tshad ma gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The demonstration of that is If the cognition is one, etc.

original: blos dngos po rtogs na ni /
analyzed: blos dngos po rtogs na ni /
translated: If the cognition cognizes the entity,

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa'i dngos po'i dbang gis byung ba'i nye bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa'i dngos po'i dbang gis byung ba'i nye bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: then it is just the transformation that occurs by the power of the entity, as was previously explained.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po'i rjes su byed pa spangs nas blo nyid la brten pa de'i tshe ni dngos po med pa'i blo'i snang ba la /üîΩgang gi ltar blo khyad par ni //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po'i rjes su byed pa spangs nas blo nyid la brten pa de'i tshe ni dngos po med pa'i blo'i snang ba la / gang gi ltar blo khyad par ni //
translated: But when one abandons the conformity to the entity and relies on the cognition itself, then the appearance of the cognition, which is devoid of the entity,

original: sna tshogs can don tha dad 'dzin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs can don tha dad 'dzin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is like the line The cognition, which has a variety of aspects, apprehends different objects, etc.

original: de bshad pa ni blo la snang ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni blo la snang ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is Because the appearance in the cognition is devoid of the entity.

original: blo'i rjes su byed pa la /
analyzed: blo'i rjes su byed pa la /
translated: The conformity to the cognition is like the line The cognition, which has a variety of aspects, apprehends different objects, etc.

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes par thal ba med mod /
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes par thal ba med mod /
translated: There is no fault of the consequence of the identity of the nature of the object, etc.

original: skabs kyi gzhi mthun pa med pa'i nyes par ni ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: skabs kyi gzhi mthun pa med pa'i nyes par ni ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how is there no fault of the absence of a common locus?

original: de tha mi dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs smos so //
analyzed: de tha mi dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs smos so //
translated: [The response is:] ‚ÄúThere is no difference, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhi mthun pa la sogs ji ltar shes pa bzhin mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa la sogs ji ltar shes pa bzhin mi 'gal lo //
translated: [The opponent‚Äôs position] is not contradictory, as it is understood in terms of a common locus, etc.

original: gcig po de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spyi med pa'i nyes pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig po de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spyi med pa'i nyes pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: [The response] ‚ÄúThat one, etc.‚Äù states the fault of the absence of universals.

original: gzhi mthun pa med pas na khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa med pas na khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po med pa yang ngo //
translated: Since there is no common locus, there is also no relation of qualifier and qualificand.

original: spyi la sogs pa de dag rtogs pa las ma 'das pa ni mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa de dag rtogs pa las ma 'das pa ni mi 'gal lo //
translated: It is not contradictory that they are not beyond being conceived as universals, etc.

original: dngos po la ni 'gal ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: dngos po la ni 'gal ba bshad zin to //
translated: But it is contradictory in terms of real things, as has been explained.

original: ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spyi tha mi dad pa blo la snang ba'i phyir spyi mi 'gal /
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spyi tha mi dad pa blo la snang ba'i phyir spyi mi 'gal /
translated: The universal ‚Äúcow,‚Äù etc. is not contradictory, because it appears to the mind as undifferentiated.

original: ba lang zhes rnam pa gcig yul du byas kyang ci 'dir dkar ram 'on te gnag ces dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan la ma nges pa dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan la re ba dang bcas pa'i blos gzung bar bya ba dang /üîΩdkar po la sogs pa sgra'i don tha dad pa sgrub pa dag kyang ba la dkar po zhes dkar po la sogs tha mi dad par blo la snang bas khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po dang gzhi mthun pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: ba lang zhes rnam pa gcig yul du byas kyang ci 'dir dkar ram 'on te gnag ces dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan la ma nges pa dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan la re ba dang bcas pa'i blos gzung bar bya ba dang / dkar po la sogs pa sgra'i don tha dad pa sgrub pa dag kyang ba la dkar po zhes dkar po la sogs tha mi dad par blo la snang bas khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po dang gzhi mthun pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Even though the aspect of a single cow is taken as the object, it is still held by a mind that is uncertain about other aspects, such as white, and that is expectant of other aspects, such as white.üîΩAnd the establishment of the different meanings of words, such as white, is not contradictory to the fact that the thing and its attribute appear to the mind as undifferentiated, as in ‚Äúwhite cow.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe gzung ba nyid la re ba na rung ba nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa de dang 'brel pa rtogs pa'i phyir brda'i dbang gis ba lang dkar po'i rang bzhin du nges pa ma @246b yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzung ba nyid la re ba na rung ba nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa de dang 'brel pa rtogs pa'i phyir brda'i dbang gis ba lang dkar po'i rang bzhin du nges pa ma @246b yin te /
translated: When it is appropriate to be expectant of the object, the mind is related to the object that is present, and because of the understanding of that, the mind is not ascertained as the nature of a white cow by the power of convention.

original: des na de'i yon tan des yon tan gzhan rnam par bcad pa gang yin pa de ni yon tan dang yon tan dag gi khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yin la /
analyzed: des na de'i yon tan des yon tan gzhan rnam par bcad pa gang yin pa de ni yon tan dang yon tan dag gi khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yin la /
translated: Therefore, the quality of that is the quality of the other, and that is the entity of the quality, the quality, the distinction, and the basis of distinction.

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni gzhi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni gzhi mthun pa yin te /
translated: That which is related to the other is a common locus.

original: des na de ltar gnyi ga nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: des na de ltar gnyi ga nye bar bkod do //
translated: Thus, both are presented in that way.

original: de ltar blo la snang ba gang yin pa 'di'i chos dang chos can gyi khyad par dag kyang rab tu ston te /
analyzed: de ltar blo la snang ba gang yin pa 'di'i chos dang chos can gyi khyad par dag kyang rab tu ston te /
translated: In that way, the distinction of the subject and the quality that appear to the mind are also taught.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bshad pa / de ltar snang ba'i dngos po de kho na chos zhes bya ba'i sgra khyad par gzhan spangs pas brjod nas de nyid las tha dad pa lta bu'i 'di'i ngo bo nyid chos nyid du rnam par bzhag nas te /
analyzed: bshad pa / de ltar snang ba'i dngos po de kho na chos zhes bya ba'i sgra khyad par gzhan spangs pas brjod nas de nyid las tha dad pa lta bu'i 'di'i ngo bo nyid chos nyid du rnam par bzhag nas te /
translated: It is said: The entity that appears in that way is called a quality, and the term quality is stated by excluding other distinctions. That is posited as the intrinsic reality of that, as if it were different from that.

original: 'dis ni chos su rab tu ston pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos su rab tu ston pa brjod do //
translated: This expresses the teaching of the quality.

original: chos can rab tu ston pa yang bshad pa /
analyzed: chos can rab tu ston pa yang bshad pa /
translated: The teaching of the subject is also explained.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par gzhan spang pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bye brag tu ma phye bar te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par gzhan spang pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bye brag tu ma phye bar te /
translated: Without distinguishing it by the other characteristics explained above,

original: khyad par gzhan ma spangs par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan ma spangs par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: without abandoning other characteristics, is the meaning.

original: dper na khra bo'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na khra bo'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba bzhin du /
translated: Just like the statement, ‚Äúa cow is variegated.‚Äù

original: 'di'i ngo bo nyid gzhan chos can nyid du rab tu bzhag nas so //
analyzed: 'di'i ngo bo nyid gzhan chos can nyid du rab tu bzhag nas so //
translated: Having posited its own nature as the subject,

original: ci'i phyir de ltar rnam par bzhag nas ston ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar rnam par bzhag nas ston ce na /
translated: why is it posited and taught in that way?

original: don du ma las tha dad pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: don du ma las tha dad pa zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúalthough it is different from many objects,‚Äù

original: don du ma las tha dad pa yin yang don gcig las tha dad pa de yod dang med pa shes par 'dod pa la de nyid chos nyid du rnam par gzhag ste ;üîΩ'di'i ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig chos can nyid du rnam par bzhag nas dgag pa'am /
analyzed: don du ma las tha dad pa yin yang don gcig las tha dad pa de yod dang med pa shes par 'dod pa la de nyid chos nyid du rnam par gzhag ste ; 'di'i ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig chos can nyid du rnam par bzhag nas dgag pa'am /
translated: although it is different from many objects, it is different from a single object. For one who wishes to know existence and nonexistence, it is posited as reality.üîΩHaving posited its own nature as the subject,

original: sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: it is either an affirmation or a negation.

original: dper na khra bo la ni ba lang nyid yod kyi /
analyzed: dper na khra bo la ni ba lang nyid yod kyi /
translated: For example, a cow is variegated.

original: rta nyid shes par 'dod pa na blo la de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bur ro //
analyzed: rta nyid shes par 'dod pa na blo la de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bur ro //
translated: When one wishes to know the horse, it is not like that in the mind.

original: ci dngos po de la de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa dngos su de lta nyid yin pa'i phyir ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci dngos po de la de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa dngos su de lta nyid yin pa'i phyir ram zhe na /
translated: Is it that the thing is so established in reality?

original: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: It is not so, as is explained by

original: blo la de ltar snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo la de ltar snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it appears in the mind in that way.

original: dngos po ci zhig ltar shes pa 'dod pa na blo la de ltar snang ba'i snang ba de bzhin du rtogs par byed do //üîΩkhyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba nyid kyis chos dang chos can tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po ci zhig ltar shes pa 'dod pa na blo la de ltar snang ba'i snang ba de bzhin du rtogs par byed do // khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba nyid kyis chos dang chos can tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: When one wishes to know a thing in a certain way, one understands it in accordance with the appearance in the mind.

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The difference is due to the exclusion or non-exclusion of other attributes, not to the difference of the thing itself.

original: blo la brten pa'i chos tha dad pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: blo la brten pa'i chos tha dad pa nyid kyis na /
translated: The difference of the thing is due to the difference of the attributes that are based on it.

original: tshig tha dad pa dang bcas pa ni sgrub par byed pa yin la mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed tha dad pa dngos po'i mthar thug pa nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni byed do zhes @247a * //
analyzed: tshig tha dad pa dang bcas pa ni sgrub par byed pa yin la mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed tha dad pa dngos po'i mthar thug pa nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni byed do zhes @247a * //
translated: The words ‚Äúwith a different word‚Äù are the proof, and ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù is the probandum. Thus, the difference between the probandum and the proof is the ultimate reality of things.

original: bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The ultimate reality of the action is the ultimate reality of the agent.

original: des ni de ltar shes pa la snang ba'i don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dam bcas pas dngos po 'dzin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad kyi yul can ma yin par nye bar bkod kyang /
analyzed: des ni de ltar shes pa la snang ba'i don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dam bcas pas dngos po 'dzin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad kyi yul can ma yin par nye bar bkod kyang /
translated: Thus, the statement ‚ÄúThe object that appears to the cognition in that way‚Äù and so on is a thesis. The statement ‚ÄúBecause it apprehends an entity‚Äù and so on presents the universal as the object of all cognitions.

original: dngos po la du ma dang gcig dang tha dad par 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung btsugs pa mjug sdud pas thams cad kyi yul can du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la du ma dang gcig dang tha dad par 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung btsugs pa mjug sdud pas thams cad kyi yul can du byas pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe apprehension of an entity as manifold, unitary, and different‚Äù and so on concludes the treatise and makes the universal the object of all cognitions.

original: yang spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs pa de nyid tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs pa de nyid tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis ston par byed do //
translated: Again, the verse ‚ÄúThe universal, etc.‚Äù and so on teaches the same thing as the statement ‚ÄúThe universal, etc.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na don 'di mdo la med pa'i phyir mdor ma tshang bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdngos po rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pas zhes bya ba nas nor pa'i don kho na la spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par bshad pa'i don gang yin pa de brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na don 'di mdo la med pa'i phyir mdor ma tshang bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro // dngos po rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pas zhes bya ba nas nor pa'i don kho na la spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par bshad pa'i don gang yin pa de brjod pa ni /
translated: Why? Because this meaning is not in the s≈´tra, in order to avoid the s≈´tra being incomplete.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas nor don rgyas byed ces bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas nor don rgyas byed ces bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: The meaning of the explanation from ‚Äúbecause it holds its own nature‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe meaning of error is the basis for the convention of universals and common locus‚Äù is stated from ‚Äúnature‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe basis of error.‚Äù

original: rnam rtog blo skye ba gang yin pa de la ngo bo snang ba'i ngo bo /
analyzed: rnam rtog blo skye ba gang yin pa de la ngo bo snang ba'i ngo bo /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe arising of conceptual cognition‚Äù is the appearance of an entity.

original: de la spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i spyod yul can gyi shes pa dang sgra dag gis tha snyad med pa'i don can rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: de la spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i spyod yul can gyi shes pa dang sgra dag gis tha snyad med pa'i don can rgyas par byed do //
translated: In that, cognition and terms that have universals and common loci as their objects make the meaning that is devoid of universals and common loci more extensive.

original: de'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i don gang yin pa de las tha dad pa de'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i don gang yin pa de las tha dad pa de'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The meaning that is the result of that is different from that, and it is the ultimate.

original: 'dis ni 'di'i yul brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di'i yul brjod do //
translated: This expresses its object.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan bshad pa'i phyir rang bzhin de 'dzin ces smos te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan bshad pa'i phyir rang bzhin de 'dzin ces smos te /
translated: In order to explain the reason for the expression ‚Äúhabit-energy of experience,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúthat nature is grasped.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las tha dad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the nondiscriminated nature.

original: tha dad pa can las tha dad pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa can nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa can las tha dad pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa can nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not different from the different, it is said to be the same as the different.

original: de 'dzin pa ni nyams su myong ba ste de'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i phyir de las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa ni nyams su myong ba ste de'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i phyir de las skye ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Grasped‚Äù means experienced, because it is produced from that habit-energy.

original: ngo bo de ni phyi rol lta bu dang / gcig pa lta bu dang / gzhan las log pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ngo bo de ni phyi rol lta bu dang / gcig pa lta bu dang / gzhan las log pa lta bu ste /
translated: That nature is like an external object, like a unity, and like the opposite of difference.

original: de lta bu ma yin yang de lta bur zhen pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin yang de lta bur zhen pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although it is not like that, it is the object of such a conception.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni /üîΩde nyid min zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni / de nyid min zhes bya ste /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: phyi rol la sogs pa de nyid las 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol la sogs pa de nyid las 'das pa nyid do //
translated: It is not that, because it transcends that nature of external objects, etc.

original: des na de skad brjod do //
analyzed: des na de skad brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be like that.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: brtag pa'i yan lag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag pa'i yan lag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it lacks the parts of discrimination.

original: brtag pa ni dgos pas rab tu sbyar ba yin na /
analyzed: brtag pa ni dgos pas rab tu sbyar ba yin na /
translated: If the investigation is applied because of the need,

original: 'di ni dgos pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dgos pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: this is not the means of establishing the need,

original: de sgrub pa dang mi mthun pa nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sgrub pa dang mi mthun pa nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is known to be contrary to the establishment of that.

original: @247b des na brtag pa'i yan lag ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: @247b des na brtag pa'i yan lag ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not a part of the investigation.

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa'i ngo bo can yin ba de'i phyir tha dad pa yin te des na ldog pa'i ngo bo can nyid kyis tha mi dad pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa'i ngo bo can yin ba de'i phyir tha dad pa yin te des na ldog pa'i ngo bo can nyid kyis tha mi dad pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because it has the nature of exclusion, therefore it is different. Thus, it is said that it is not different because it has the nature of exclusion.

original: des na de ltar de dag gi spyi'i tha snyad bshad do //
analyzed: des na de ltar de dag gi spyi'i tha snyad bshad do //
translated: Thus, the general convention of those is explained in that way.

original: gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the convention of common locus is:

original: de nyid gzhan las log par yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan las log par yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself is different from the other.‚Äù

original: da ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid la skyon spong ba'i gzhung sdud pa /
analyzed: da ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid la skyon spong ba'i gzhung sdud pa /
translated: Now, the summary of the text that refutes the error of not having a real object is:

original: dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya bas 'chad do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya bas 'chad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe convention of real things‚Äù is explained by ‚Äúof real things.‚Äù

original: de kun zhes bya ba spyi la sogs pa'i yul can gyi tha snyad ni don tha dad pa la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de kun zhes bya ba spyi la sogs pa'i yul can gyi tha snyad ni don tha dad pa la brten pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll of that‚Äù refers to the convention of the subject of universals, etc., which is based on different objects.

original: de nyams su myong ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has as its root the experience of that.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis po la dngos po'i yul ma yin yang dngos po rnyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis po la dngos po'i yul ma yin yang dngos po rnyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, although the two kinds of inference do not have an existent object, they are the reason for the discovery of an existent, but not otherwise.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni /
translated: The idea here is this:

original: 'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhung du bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhung du bshad zin to //
translated: All this has been explained in the treatise beginning with the line,üîΩ‚ÄúThis is the nature of convention.‚Äù

original: tha snyad 'di'i phan tshun med pa la brten pa nyid brten pa'i phyir de la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tha snyad 'di'i phan tshun med pa la brten pa nyid brten pa'i phyir de la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since this convention is based on mutual dependence, he says, ‚Äúin that case.‚ÄùüîΩEven though there are many variegated things, they have a single effect.

original: khra bo la sogs pa du ma'ang 'bras bu gcig pa can dag / gang dag de'i 'bras bu can min pa de las gzhan la brten pa'i brjod pa dang / shes pas tha snyad gcig tu nye bar byed la /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa du ma'ang 'bras bu gcig pa can dag / gang dag de'i 'bras bu can min pa de las gzhan la brten pa'i brjod pa dang / shes pas tha snyad gcig tu nye bar byed la /
translated: That which is not its effect is designated by the expression ‚Äúbased on something else,‚Äù and by the cognition it is brought into a single convention.

original: gcig kyang du ma byed pa la de'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa'i don las tha dad par sna tshogs su ston to //
analyzed: gcig kyang du ma byed pa la de'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa'i don las tha dad par sna tshogs su ston to //
translated: Even though there is a single thing, it is shown to be variegated, distinct from the object that is not the effect of its nature.

original: des ni de ltar gyur pa na /
analyzed: des ni de ltar gyur pa na /
translated: Thus, in that case,

original: de'i yul can nyid kyis tha snyad nyams su myong ba la brten pa yin yang nor ba'i don can nyid du gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can nyid kyis tha snyad nyams su myong ba la brten pa yin yang nor ba'i don can nyid du gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: Although the conventional is based on the experience of the subject itself, it is established as having a mistaken meaning.

original: da ni rang gi mtshan nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rang gi mtshan nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to state that impermanence, etc. do not exist in the own-character, etc.

original: sgra don 'di dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: sgra don 'di dang zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThis meaning of the word . . .‚Äù

original: sgra don 'di ni yod pa ma yin yang ji ltar grags pa bzhin du brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: sgra don 'di ni yod pa ma yin yang ji ltar grags pa bzhin du brjod pa yin la /
translated: Although this meaning of the word does not exist, it is stated as it is renowned.

original: de la de bzhin kho nar brten nas ni bsgrub bya sgrub pa kun du gzhag pa dam pa'i don la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la de bzhin kho nar brten nas ni bsgrub bya sgrub pa kun du gzhag pa dam pa'i don la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: In that regard, it is established in order to engage in the ultimate, in order to establish the probandum based on just that.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po nyid du rtogs kyang dngos por yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po nyid du rtogs kyang dngos por yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Although producedness, impermanence, etc. are realized as entities, they do not exist as entities.

original: shes pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they exist as consciousnesses.

original: des na de lta bur gyur pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don la brten nas byas pa nyid ni sgrub @248a * //
analyzed: des na de lta bur gyur pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don la brten nas byas pa nyid ni sgrub @248a * //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the term ‚Äúestablished‚Äù is based on the meaning of the term ‚Äúexpressed,‚Äù and the meaning of the term ‚Äúestablished‚Äù is based on the meaning of the term ‚Äúimpermanent.‚Äù

original: byed la mi rtag pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba zhes phyi rol nyid rtogs pa'i spyod yul du byed de sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byed la mi rtag pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba zhes phyi rol nyid rtogs pa'i spyod yul du byed de sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The object of the activity of understanding is made external, just as it was previously explained.

original: des na don la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na don la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù and so on is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it were not so, then the engagement with the ultimate would not be established, or it would not be understood.

original: de lta ma yin na don dam pa la 'jug pa nyid mi 'grub pa'am rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro / gzhi mthun pa yang sgra mi rtag ces bya ba lta bur bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa gnas pa'i yan lag tu gyur la ji ltar grags pa bzhin
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don dam pa la 'jug pa nyid mi 'grub pa'am rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro / gzhi mthun pa yang sgra mi rtag ces bya ba lta bur bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa gnas pa'i yan lag tu gyur la ji ltar grags pa bzhin
translated: The common locus is the branch that is the basis of the probandum and the proof, as in the statement ‚Äúsound is impermanent.‚Äù

original: nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation is just as it is known.

original: dngos la 'di ni mi srid do //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos la 'di ni mi srid do // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is impossible in reality.

original: 'dir res 'ga' ni gzhi tha dad par yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos po'i yan lag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir res 'ga' ni gzhi tha dad par yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos po'i yan lag tu 'gyur te /
translated: Here, sometimes the different bases become the branch of the entity of the property possessor and the property.

original: dper na 'di na me'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'di na me'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the word ‚Äúme‚Äù here.

original: de'i chos dang chos can gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du bshad pa ni chos dang chos can rnams gzhag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i chos dang chos can gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du bshad pa ni chos dang chos can rnams gzhag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the nature of the property and the property-possessor is called the ‚Äúestablishment of the property and the property-possessor.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid don ma brtags pa de ni de bzhin kho nar zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid don ma brtags pa de ni de bzhin kho nar zhes 'brel to //
translated: The meaning of thusness that is not examined is connected with ‚Äújust that.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du tha dad tha dad min pa ci 'dra ba zhig ldog pa'i sa bon yin pa de de bzhin kho nar zhes dngos po la gcig dang du mar 'dzin pa ni 'khrul pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs brjod pa ni dam pa'i don gyi
analyzed: de bzhin du tha dad tha dad min pa ci 'dra ba zhig ldog pa'i sa bon yin pa de de bzhin kho nar zhes dngos po la gcig dang du mar 'dzin pa ni 'khrul pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs brjod pa ni dam pa'i don gyi
translated: Similarly, the statement ‚ÄúThe apprehension of singularity and multiplicity with regard to entities is mistaken‚Äù and so on expresses the ultimate

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: meaning.

original: khra bo dang ser skya dag ni ba lang nyid kyis 'dre ba yin la /
analyzed: khra bo dang ser skya dag ni ba lang nyid kyis 'dre ba yin la /
translated: The variegated and the tawny are mixed by the universal of cow.

original: don gcig la yang khra bo dang ba lang ngo zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: don gcig la yang khra bo dang ba lang ngo zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa yin te /
translated: But with regard to the same object, the variegated and the cow are different.

original: de dag ni don rnams kyi rang gi bdag nyid la med do //
analyzed: de dag ni don rnams kyi rang gi bdag nyid la med do //
translated: These do not exist in the nature of the objects.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gtan tshigs kyi don la dang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don la dang gi sgra'o //
translated: The meaning of the reason is indicated by the word ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: da ni thams cad du blo de kho na ci ste mi sbyor zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni thams cad du blo de kho na ci ste mi sbyor zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to explain why the mind is not applied to thatness everywhere, he says:

original: des spyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des spyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThatness‚Äù is the universal.

original: spyi dang khyad par zhes bya ba'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par zhes bya ba'i bye brag ste /
translated: The distinction between the universal and the particular is

original: bye ba 'di ni blo'i don la yin no //
analyzed: bye ba 'di ni blo'i don la yin no //
translated: a distinction in the object of the mind.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de nyid la zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúin regard to that.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de nyid la chos kyi dbye ba kun brtags pa de'i phyir chos kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig ni rjes su 'jug la 'ga' zhig ni ldog pa'i phyir spyi dang khyad par sna tshogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid la chos kyi dbye ba kun brtags pa de'i phyir chos kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig ni rjes su 'jug la 'ga' zhig ni ldog pa'i phyir spyi dang khyad par sna tshogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because the division of phenomena is imagined in regard to thatness, therefore, because some particular phenomena are included and some are excluded, there are various universals and particulars.
