original: ji ltar don du zhen pa brtag par mi nus pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar don du zhen pa brtag par mi nus pa bzhin te /
translated: Just as the conception of an object cannot be analyzed.

original: don du zhen pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pas yul du byas pa'i don bzhin du snang ba ma grub pa'i phyir don gsal ba med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: don du zhen pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pas yul du byas pa'i don bzhin du snang ba ma grub pa'i phyir don gsal ba med pa'i phyir na /
translated: The conception of an object is not established as the appearance of an object that is not made into an object by nonconceptual cognition, because there is no object that is a clear appearance of an object.

original: yul du ma byas pa'i don la yang don gyi yul can gyi 'jug ba'i shugs kyis dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yul du ma byas pa'i don la yang don gyi yul can gyi 'jug ba'i shugs kyis dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even with respect to an object that is not made into an object, the existence of an object is to be inferred by the force of the engagement of the cognition that has an object.

original: de bzhin du don bya ba nus pa'i rtogs pa ni don bya ba dang 'brel pa rtogs pa la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don bya ba nus pa'i rtogs pa ni don bya ba dang 'brel pa rtogs pa la ltos pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the cognition of the object‚Äôs capacity to perform a function depends on the cognition of the object‚Äôs relation to the function.

original: de yod na 'bras bu skye bar dmigs pas 'brel pa ma rtogs par ni de ltar rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi de don du gnyer bas 'jug pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na 'bras bu skye bar dmigs pas 'brel pa ma rtogs par ni de ltar rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi de don du gnyer bas 'jug pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object exists, the effect is observed to arise. Therefore, without cognizing the relation, it is not established that the person who seeks the object engages in it, since that cognition precedes the engagement.

original: des na 'di ni de ltar rtogs la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni de ltar rtogs la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this cognition depends on the cognition of the object‚Äôs capacity to perform a function.

original: gcig la mthong ba ni 'brel pa ma mthong ba gzhan la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la mthong ba ni 'brel pa ma mthong ba gzhan la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: One who sees one instance of the object does not engage in another instance of the object without seeing the relation.

original: ba lang la don mthong ba dang ldan pa'i don du gnyer ba de la 'jug pa yin yang rta la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang la don mthong ba dang ldan pa'i don du gnyer ba de la 'jug pa yin yang rta la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though one who sees the object, a cow, and seeks the object engages in that object, one does not engage in a horse.

original: des na ba lang gi gsal ba gcig la ba lang gis bya ba'i don mthong ba dang ldan pa @260a * //
analyzed: des na ba lang gi gsal ba gcig la ba lang gis bya ba'i don mthong ba dang ldan pa @260a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that one who sees the object, the function of a cow, in one instance of a cow

original: ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir de don sgrub nyams su mi gsal ba gzhan la 'jug par mi rigs te /
analyzed: ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir de don sgrub nyams su mi gsal ba gzhan la 'jug par mi rigs te /
translated: engages in another instance of the object, the cow, without seeing the object‚Äôs capacity to perform a function.

original: 'brel ba mthong ba la ltos pa'i phyir dang / gzhan mthong bas gzhan la mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba mthong ba la ltos pa'i phyir dang / gzhan mthong bas gzhan la mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on seeing the connection, and because one thing is not established by seeing another.

original: de lta yin mod kyi ba lang gi gsal ba gzhan la don nyams su myong ba'i don du gnyer ba de nyid la gzhan du ma mthong ba'i gsal ba gzhan la yang phyis mthong ba la ltos pa med par 'jug pa ni mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi ba lang gi gsal ba gzhan la don nyams su myong ba'i don du gnyer ba de nyid la gzhan du ma mthong ba'i gsal ba gzhan la yang phyis mthong ba la ltos pa med par 'jug pa ni mthong ngo //
translated: Even though that is so, one sees that a person who seeks to experience the object of another instance of cow, without seeing another instance, later engages in seeing another instance without depending on seeing it.

original: rigs mthun par 'dod pa'i gsal ba gzhan nyid la yang mthong ba la ltos pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rigs mthun par 'dod pa'i gsal ba gzhan nyid la yang mthong ba la ltos pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: One does not depend on seeing another instance that is asserted to be of a similar type.

original: don de byed pa yin yang rigs mi mthun pa'i gsal ba gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don de byed pa yin yang rigs mi mthun pa'i gsal ba gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though it performs the function of that object, one does not depend on another instance that is of a different type.

original: dper na sha ri ba la rims zhi ba'i nus pa nyams su myong ba sha ri ba gzhan la 'khrul pa med par len gyi don de sgrub par khyad par med kyang pa ru sha ka la ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sha ri ba la rims zhi ba'i nus pa nyams su myong ba sha ri ba gzhan la 'khrul pa med par len gyi don de sgrub par khyad par med kyang pa ru sha ka la ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, one who has experienced the power to cure fever in one instance of myrobalan fruit unmistakenly takes another instance of myrobalan fruit, but not parushaka, even though there is no difference in their ability to accomplish that object.

original: de'i phyir ba lang gi gsal ba gzhan dag la gsal ba der zhen pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir ba lang gi gsal ba gzhan dag la gsal ba der zhen pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, although there is a fixation on the manifestation of the cow in other manifestations,

original: de ni de nyid 'di'o zhes 'am de la 'di'o zhes brtag par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni de nyid 'di'o zhes 'am de la 'di'o zhes brtag par ni mi nus so //
translated: it is not possible to investigate it as ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù or ‚Äúthis is in that.‚Äù

original: des na de ltar tha dad par sbyor bar byed pa'i ngo shes pa 'di lhag par zhen pa tsam gyis snying po can nyid kyis log pa'i rnam par rtog ba nyid nye bar bstan te /üîΩde ltas don la gcig bdag tu //
analyzed: des na de ltar tha dad par sbyor bar byed pa'i ngo shes pa 'di lhag par zhen pa tsam gyis snying po can nyid kyis log pa'i rnam par rtog ba nyid nye bar bstan te / de ltas don la gcig bdag tu //
translated: Thus, this recognition that connects in this way through difference is shown to be a false conception, because it is just a fixation on what is not real.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog 'di 'khrul ba //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog 'di 'khrul ba //
translated: Therefore, this conception that apprehends an object as a single self is a delusion,

original: zhes te / ji ltar don du lhag par zhen pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes te / ji ltar don du lhag par zhen pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it is a fixation on what is not real.

original: rtogs pa la ni ba lang gi rnam pa tha dad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa la ni ba lang gi rnam pa tha dad pa kho na ste /
translated: In the case of a cognition, the form of the cow is different,

original: 'di ni ba lang yin la 'di ni ba lang gzhan yin no zhes rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni ba lang yin la 'di ni ba lang gzhan yin no zhes rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is cognized as ‚Äúthis is a cow‚Äù and ‚Äúthat is another cow.‚Äù

original: gcig ba lang yin yang gzhan bum pa bzhin du ba lang du mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig ba lang yin yang gzhan bum pa bzhin du ba lang du mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that, although they are one, the cow is not a cow, like a pot,

original: gnyi ga ba lang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga ba lang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are cows.

original: 'on kyang de ba lang nyid gang yin pa de gzhan la med pa de'i ba lang gang yin ba de gzhan ma yin par zad kyi gzhan ni ba lang yin ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ba lang nyid gang yin pa de gzhan la med pa de'i ba lang gang yin ba de gzhan ma yin par zad kyi gzhan ni ba lang yin ba kho na'o //
translated: But the cow itself is not another, and that which is the cow is not another.

original: ba lang de nyid ba lang de yin no zhes rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang de nyid ba lang de yin no zhes rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not correct to say that the cow itself is the cow.

original: des na spyi ngo bo la rigs pa'i byed pa 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na spyi ngo bo la rigs pa'i byed pa 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the universal being the object of the activity of the intellect.

original: ba lang nyid dang ldan pas ba lang zhes khas len na gzhan la de med par mi 'gyur bas 'gal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang ldan pas ba lang zhes khas len na gzhan la de med par mi 'gyur bas 'gal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one accepts that the cow is so called because it possesses cowness, then it would not be another, and there would be a contradiction.

original: rang gi ngo bor de ltar 'gyur ba la ni ma yin te khra bo la sogs pa'i ba lang @260b mang po rnams nyid ba lang nyid du rtogs kyi rta ngang pa la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor de ltar 'gyur ba la ni ma yin te khra bo la sogs pa'i ba lang @260b mang po rnams nyid ba lang nyid du rtogs kyi rta ngang pa la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not so in the case of its own nature, because many cows, such as the variegated, are understood to be cowness, but not others, such as horses, camels, and so on.

original: khyad par sre ba'i ngo shes pa 'di'i rgyu mtshan yang dngos po nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyad par sre ba'i ngo shes pa 'di'i rgyu mtshan yang dngos po nyid yin no //
translated: The reason for the recognition of the particular is the thing itself.

original: 'brel pa ni 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya'o //
translated: The relation has already been explained.

original: dngos po da dag la shes pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa gcig mthong ba la dngos po rnams kyi chos nyid kho nas de nyid 'di yin no snyam ba'i log pa'i shes pa skyed par byed do /
analyzed: dngos po da dag la shes pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa gcig mthong ba la dngos po rnams kyi chos nyid kho nas de nyid 'di yin no snyam ba'i log pa'i shes pa skyed par byed do /
translated: In the case of these things, a wrong cognition arises, thinking that that very thing is this very thing, by the intrinsic reality of things alone, seeing one function, such as the cognition of that thing.

original: de nyid 'di'o zhes snyam pa ni rgyang mi ring zhing ma bskal bar lhag par zhan pa'i rang bzhin brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di'o zhes snyam pa ni rgyang mi ring zhing ma bskal bar lhag par zhan pa'i rang bzhin brjod pa'o //
translated: The thought ‚Äúthat very thing is this very thing‚Äù expresses the nature of a person who is not far away and who is not deaf.

original: dngos po rnams la dngos su rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i nus pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni rang nyams su myong ba ni de dag gi bdag nyid kyi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa de'i bag chags te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la dngos su rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i nus pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni rang nyams su myong ba ni de dag gi bdag nyid kyi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa de'i bag chags te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthey do not have the power to generate a conception of things directly‚Äù means that the power to generate a conception of things directly is not the power of the object itself, but rather the power of the latent impressions of the cognition of that object.

original: der rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: der rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: Because that is the cause of that.

original: de la 'dir re zhig log pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir re zhig log pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
translated: Here, in order to prove that it is wrong, the explanation is:

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste log pa nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste log pa nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were not so,‚Äù that is, if it were not wrong.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught by this:

original: rjes su 'gro ba 'ga' zhig med pas ngo shes pa mi 'thad pa na ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba 'ga' zhig med pas ngo shes pa mi 'thad pa na ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not tenable that recognition is possible when there is no commonality.

original: phyir la rjes su 'gro ba yod na mi 'thad do zhes so //
analyzed: phyir la rjes su 'gro ba yod na mi 'thad do zhes so //
translated: If there were commonality, it would not be tenable.

original: blo khyad par sre ba can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo khyad par sre ba can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who is engaged in distinguishing cognition‚Äù

original: ngo shes pa'i rnam pa can spyi'i shes pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i rnam pa can spyi'i shes pa bstan pa ste /
translated: refers to the cognition of the universal that has the aspect of recognition.

original: de ni khyad par sre ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khyad par sre ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of engaging in distinctions.

original: 'di ltar spyi smra ba rnams kyi spyi mtshams sbyor ba'i shes pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa yin du zin kyang khra bo la mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid ni ser skya la yang mthong ngo zhes tha dad pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin te
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi smra ba rnams kyi spyi mtshams sbyor ba'i shes pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa yin du zin kyang khra bo la mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid ni ser skya la yang mthong ngo zhes tha dad pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin te
translated: Thus, even though the universal is the object of the cognition that engages in universals of the proponents of universals, the cognition that sees a multicolored object does not engage in the distinction that ‚Äúwhat I see in the multicolored object I also see in the tawny object.‚Äù

original: / 'di ba lang zhes spyi dang gsal ba tha mi dad pa snang gi 'di ba lang zhes bya bar ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / 'di ba lang zhes spyi dang gsal ba tha mi dad pa snang gi 'di ba lang zhes bya bar ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal and the instance appear undifferentiated in the cognition ‚Äúcow,‚Äù but not as ‚Äúthis is the universal cow.‚Äù

original: khra bo ba lang ser skya la //
analyzed: khra bo ba lang ser skya la //
translated: A multicolored cow and a tawny cow

original: zhes gzhi mthun pa ni de'i rang bzhin med par rtogs pa mthar phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes gzhi mthun pa ni de'i rang bzhin med par rtogs pa mthar phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the common locus is not the culmination of the realization of their essencelessness.

original: 'brel pa'i phyir gzhan de la yod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i phyir gzhan de la yod pa yin na ni /
translated: If it were the case that the other exists in that, because of the relation,

original: lha sbyin gyi ba lang zhes bya ba bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: lha sbyin gyi ba lang zhes bya ba bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur te ;
translated: then it would be understood as ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs cow,‚Äù

original: de yang ba lang dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ba lang dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is related to the cow.

original: des na tha dad pa dang 'brel pa yin na ba lang dang ldan pa zhes rtogs par rigs kyi ba lang ngo zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa dang 'brel pa yin na ba lang dang ldan pa zhes rtogs par rigs kyi ba lang ngo zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if it were the case that the relation is to the different, it would be reasonable to understand it as ‚Äúrelated to the cow,‚Äù but not as ‚Äúthe cow.‚Äù

original: ba lang nyid nye bar gzhag pa las ba lang zhes tha mi dad par rdzas kyi mthar phyin par rtogs so zhe na /üîΩre zhig tha dad pa @261a * //
analyzed: ba lang nyid nye bar gzhag pa las ba lang zhes tha mi dad par rdzas kyi mthar phyin par rtogs so zhe na / re zhig tha dad pa @261a * //
translated: If it is the case that the cow is posited, then the cow is understood as the culmination of the substance without difference.

original: med par rtogs pa ni grub ste /
analyzed: med par rtogs pa ni grub ste /
translated: First, the understanding without difference is established,

original: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa'i don dang logs su thob pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa'i don dang logs su thob pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: because of that, it is said that ‚Äúthere is no separate attainment of the different object.‚Äù

original: des na tha dad pa tha mi dad pa sbyor ba'i bdag gi shes pa ni tha dad pa med pa sre ba'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa tha mi dad pa sbyor ba'i bdag gi shes pa ni tha dad pa med pa sre ba'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the self that is applied to the different and the non-different does not have the nature of applying to the non-different.

original: de dang tha mi dad par rtogs pa ni de spangs nas rjes su sbyar bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad par rtogs pa ni de spangs nas rjes su sbyar bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the cognition of the non-different is not able to be applied to the different after abandoning the different.

original: gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'brel pa de la de ma 'dres par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'brel pa de la de ma 'dres par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How can that which is related to something be unmixed with it?

original: de'i phyir spyi'i shes pa ni khyad par sre ba'i rnam pa can yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi'i shes pa ni khyad par sre ba'i rnam pa can yin la /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the universal has the aspect of applying to the particular.

original: de ni 'khrul pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is not without error.

original: de spyi tha dad pa'am tha mi dad la dmigs pa yin na ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spyi tha dad pa'am tha mi dad la dmigs pa yin na ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it has as its object a universal that is either different or non-different, it is not erroneous.

original: de la tha mi dad yin na tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de la tha mi dad yin na tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur mod /
translated: If it is non-different, it is not different.

original: 'di dag 'dres par go ji ltar 'gyur /üîΩtha dad na yang tha mi dad pa de tha dad pa rnams la rtogs par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'di dag 'dres par go ji ltar 'gyur / tha dad na yang tha mi dad pa de tha dad pa rnams la rtogs par 'gyur mod /
translated: How can it be understood that they are mixed?

original: 'di dag 'dres par ga la 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'di dag 'dres par ga la 'gyur te //
translated: If it is different, it is not non-different. How can it be understood that they are mixed?

original: dper na khar ba thogs pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khar ba thogs pa dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like those who hold staffs.

original: khar ba thogs pa rnams khar ba tha mi dad pa dang ldan du zin kyang rang gi ngo bo 'dres par snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: khar ba thogs pa rnams khar ba tha mi dad pa dang ldan du zin kyang rang gi ngo bo 'dres par snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Even though those who hold staffs are not different from the staffs, they do not appear to be mixed with their own nature.

original: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa de dag la khar ba gcig 'brel par ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa de dag la khar ba gcig 'brel par ro //
translated: However, they are not mixed, and they are related to a single staff.

original: des na de 'di la'o zhes rtogs par rigs so //
analyzed: des na de 'di la'o zhes rtogs par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to understand that this is like that.

original: khyad par sre ba ni rnam pa de lta bu ma yin gyi 'on kyang de nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: khyad par sre ba ni rnam pa de lta bu ma yin gyi 'on kyang de nyid 'di yin no //
translated: The application of a distinction is not like that. However, it is that itself.

original: gal te tha mi dad pa rnams las tha dad par rtogs na ngo shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad pa rnams las tha dad par rtogs na ngo shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one understands that it is different from what is not different, it would not be recognized.

original: dbyig pa thogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyig pa thogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like holding a staff.

original: tha mi dad par rtogs na go ji ltar gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tha mi dad par rtogs na go ji ltar gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one understands that it is not different, how could one understand it to be different?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: spyi dang de dang ldan pa dag tha dad na /
analyzed: spyi dang de dang ldan pa dag tha dad na /
translated: If universals and those that possess them are different,

original: tha mi dad par rtogs pa 'khrul pa med pa nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par rtogs pa 'khrul pa med pa nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the establishment of the nonerroneous understanding of them as not different would not be established.

original: der sgro btags nas rtogs pa'i phyir tha mi dad par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: der sgro btags nas rtogs pa'i phyir tha mi dad par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not different from the particulars because it is imagined to be so,

original: ji ltar ma 'khrul par gzhan la gzhan sgro 'dogs par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'khrul par gzhan la gzhan sgro 'dogs par byed /
translated: how can it be imagined to be something else without error?

original: 'khrul pa nyid yin na de ltar 'thad de /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid yin na de ltar 'thad de /
translated: If it is error, then it is tenable that it is imagined to be so,

original: 'di ni rdul yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rdul yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just like the notion that this is a particle.

original: dbyug pa gcig du ma dang 'brel pas kyang de dang ldan pa'i dbyug pa can ji ltar 'brel par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dbyug pa gcig du ma dang 'brel pas kyang de dang ldan pa'i dbyug pa can ji ltar 'brel par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can the possessor of the stick not be related to the stick, since it is related to one stick or many sticks?

original: de ni dbyug pa gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'i de dang ldan pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho nas de dag 'dres pa yin gyi /üîΩdbyug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dbyug pa gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'i de dang ldan pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho nas de dag 'dres pa yin gyi / dbyug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it possesses one stick, the possessor of the stick is related to it by the mere fact that it is imagined to be so, but not by the stick.

original: des na tha dad pa rnams dngos po gcig dang ldan @261b pas ni 'dre ba srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa rnams dngos po gcig dang ldan @261b pas ni 'dre ba srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible for things that are different to be related to one thing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin spyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin spyi ma yin te /
translated: For this very reason, the universal is not the nature of that which is different or not different.

original: 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa gnyi ga snang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur gyi tha mi dad par ro gcig pa ni ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa gnyi ga snang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur gyi tha mi dad par ro gcig pa ni ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the statement ‚ÄúThis is a cow,‚Äù it would follow that both difference and nondifference would appear, but they would not be nondifferent and one.

original: ba lang dang 'di'o zhes bya ba'i cha tha mi dad na gzhi mthun pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba lang dang 'di'o zhes bya ba'i cha tha mi dad na gzhi mthun pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the part ‚Äúcow‚Äù and the part ‚Äúthis‚Äù were not different, they would not be a common locus,

original: ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just as in the case of ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: des na de nyid tha dad pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na de nyid tha dad pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, that is a cognition of difference.üîΩIn this case, the thought of difference and nondifference is not a cognition of nondifference preceded by the appearance of difference.

original: 'di tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rtog par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'dir tha dad pa snang ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi tha mi dad pa'i rtogs pa ni med kyi 'on kyang ba lang zhes rtogs pa ni 'di'i zhes bya ba'i cha ma
analyzed: 'di tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rtog par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'dir tha dad pa snang ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi tha mi dad pa'i rtogs pa ni med kyi 'on kyang ba lang zhes rtogs pa ni 'di'i zhes bya ba'i cha ma
translated: However, the thought ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù is a cognition of the part ‚Äúthis‚Äù that is not a cognition of the part ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa rtogs par 'gyur ba yid la de yang tha mi dad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa rtogs par 'gyur ba yid la de yang tha mi dad pa kho na yin te /
translated: That is also nondifferent.

original: des na 'dir tha dad par rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi 'on kyang tha mi dad par ro gcig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir tha dad par rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi 'on kyang tha mi dad par ro gcig pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, here there is no realization of difference at all, but rather nondifference, that is, identity.

original: des na ji ltar tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa tha dad par snang ste /
analyzed: des na ji ltar tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa tha dad par snang ste /
translated: So how can difference and nondifference appear as different?

original: de'i tshe 'dis tha dad pa spangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dis tha dad pa spangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, this does not abandon difference.

original: yod kyang sgras ma brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: yod kyang sgras ma brjod do zhe na /
translated: If it exists, but is not expressed by the word?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: tha dad pa med na 'jug pa dang mi 'jug pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med na 'jug pa dang mi 'jug pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if there is no difference, engagement and nonengagement are not possible.

original: gal te tha mi dad pa las tha dad pa gzhan yin na ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i myong ba yod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad pa las tha dad pa gzhan yin na ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i myong ba yod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If difference is different from nondifference, then there would be the experience of engagement and disengagement.

original: tha mi dad pa gang yin pa de nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na 'dir 'ga' zhig blang ba dang gzhan ni dor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa gang yin pa de nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na 'dir 'ga' zhig blang ba dang gzhan ni dor bar 'gyur /
translated: But because that which is nondifference is itself difference, how could anything here be adopted or anything else rejected?

original: tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni 'ga' yang rtogs par byar yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni 'ga' yang rtogs par byar yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: There is no such thing as a phenomenon called ‚Äúdifference‚Äù or ‚Äúnondifference‚Äù that can be realized.

original: 'on kyang ba lang gi dkar po rang bzhin nyid du tha mi dad par rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid tha dad pa las rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs su rtogs zhes drug pa'am chos can gyi phyogs gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ba lang gi dkar po rang bzhin nyid du tha mi dad par rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid tha dad pa las rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs su rtogs zhes drug pa'am chos can gyi phyogs gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: But when the cow is realized as not different from its whiteness, which is its very nature, then it is the basis of the realization, and it becomes the sixth case, the dative, or one part of the entity.

original: 'di ba lang ngo zhes 'di'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba 'dren par rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ba lang ngo zhes 'di'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba 'dren par rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: But there is no realization of the cow as the cow‚Äôs cowness.

original: rtogs pas stong yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs khas blang bar yang ci 'gyur /
analyzed: rtogs pas stong yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs khas blang bar yang ci 'gyur /
translated: And even if the realization were empty, what would be the point of accepting the alternatives of difference and non-difference?

original: des na rtogs pa 'di ni rnam par dpyad na ma 'khrul par mi 'thad kyi 'khrul pa nyid yin na 'thad do //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa 'di ni rnam par dpyad na ma 'khrul par mi 'thad kyi 'khrul pa nyid yin na 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, this realization, when analyzed, is not tenable as non-erroneous, but it is tenable as just erroneous.

original: de bshad pa ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained by ‚Äúdue to the power of error.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa ni gsal ba'i cha la ni mi 'thad kyi 'on kyang zhen pa kho na la yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni gsal ba'i cha la ni mi 'thad kyi 'on kyang zhen pa kho na la yin no //
translated: Error is not tenable with respect to the aspect of manifestation, but rather it is just with respect to what is clung to.

original: gsal ba'i cha yang @262a * //
analyzed: gsal ba'i cha yang @262a * //
translated: The aspect of manifestation

original: 'khrul pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni ma yin te /
translated: is not error.

original: gzhan yang ba lang nyid yin pas na de lta bu kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang ba lang nyid yin pas na de lta bu kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, because of being cowness, it is understood just as that.

original: tha dad pa med par rtogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par rtogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the understanding of nondifference is not established.

original: ba lang zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the understanding of cow.

original: des de ltar log pa nyid du bsgrubs nas dngos po rnams kyis dngos po'i chos nyid kho nas skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des de ltar log pa nyid du bsgrubs nas dngos po rnams kyis dngos po'i chos nyid kho nas skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
translated: Having thus established the falsity of that, in order to establish the thesis that things are produced by the reality of things alone, he says:

original: gal te rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no reason,üîΩthen why do some things produce the understanding of that, and others not?

original: dngos po de dag nyid 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de yang thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de dag gi don bya ba de byed pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po de dag nyid 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de yang thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de dag gi don bya ba de byed pa ste /
translated: The reason for the error of those things is that they perform the function of that, but not everything.

original: dper na khra bo la sogs pas ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khra bo la sogs pas ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the understanding of cow in regard to a multicolored cow.

original: don ni bag chags kyi rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa ni nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ni bag chags kyi rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa ni nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe object is not the cause of the latent potentialities, but rather consciousness itself is‚Äù is ‚Äúin terms of experience.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid las rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yin la de dag kyang dngos po nyams su myong bas sad pa na de'i gnas skabs su nges pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid las rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yin la de dag kyang dngos po nyams su myong bas sad pa na de'i gnas skabs su nges pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The latent potentialities of conceptualization are due to conceptual consciousness itself. When those are activated by the experience of an object, they generate a certainty about the state of that object.

original: des na nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas don rnams rgyu yin no //
analyzed: des na nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas don rnams rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, in terms of experience, objects are the cause of conceptual consciousness.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bshad pa'i don 'khrul pa'i 'bras bu can gyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bshad pa'i don 'khrul pa'i 'bras bu can gyi zhes smos so //
translated: The latent potentialities of conceptualization are the cause of conceptual consciousness. The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe result of error‚Äù is that the cause of conceptual consciousness is not a real object.

original: gtan tshigs des na dngos po rnams rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na dngos po rnams rgyu nyid do //
translated: That is the reason why objects are the cause of conceptual consciousness.

original: des na de ltar rigs mthun par 'dod pa rnams kyi spyi'i shes pa'i rgyu ni gsal ba dag kho na yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes gzhung btsugs nas /
analyzed: des na de ltar rigs mthun par 'dod pa rnams kyi spyi'i shes pa'i rgyu ni gsal ba dag kho na yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes gzhung btsugs nas /
translated: Thus, the author of the treatise has established the position that the cause of a cognition of a universal for those who assert that universals exist is only the particulars, not the universal.

original: rigs mi mthun pa rnams la yang rang bzhin gzhan du mtshon pa'i 'khrul pas de'i rigs su gtogs pa nyi tshe'i spyi'i rgyu can yin no zhes gzhan gyi khas blangs pa dgag pa'i don du yang dag pa dang / log pa'i shes pa gnyi ga yang spyi'i rgyu mtshan can nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rnams la yang rang bzhin gzhan du mtshon pa'i 'khrul pas de'i rigs su gtogs pa nyi tshe'i spyi'i rgyu can yin no zhes gzhan gyi khas blangs pa dgag pa'i don du yang dag pa dang / log pa'i shes pa gnyi ga yang spyi'i rgyu mtshan can nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Also, in order to refute the assertion of others that dissimilar things are the causes of a limited universal that is characterized by a different nature, he says,

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa yang zhes smos so //üîΩchu dang rigs mi mthun pa smig rgyu dag la chu'i rtogs pa 'jug pa na chu dang rigs mthun par rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir gal te chu'i spyi'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin pa de lta na yang rnam pa thams cad du spyi la mi
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa yang zhes smos so // chu dang rigs mi mthun pa smig rgyu dag la chu'i rtogs pa 'jug pa na chu dang rigs mthun par rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir gal te chu'i spyi'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin pa de lta na yang rnam pa thams cad du spyi la mi
translated: ‚ÄúEven a mirage, etc.‚Äù

original: ltos par ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ltos par ni mi 'thad do //
translated: When the cognition of water occurs in regard to a mirage that is dissimilar to water, the cognition of something similar to water is mistaken. Therefore, even though it is not the cause of the universal of water, still, in every way, it is not tenable that it does not rely on a universal.

original: bum pa yang de ltar rtogs pa'i dbang gis de lta bu'i dngos por khas blangs par thal ba'i @262b phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa yang de ltar rtogs pa'i dbang gis de lta bu'i dngos por khas blangs par thal ba'i @262b phyir ro //
translated: Also, it follows that a pot is accepted as a thing by the power of that cognition.

original: des na smig rgyu dag kho na la chur shes pa dang / thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa dang / nya phyis la dngul du phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba 'di nges pa yin na de ni rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kho nas spyi las brten pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni gal te spyi med par don rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa skyed
analyzed: des na smig rgyu dag kho na la chur shes pa dang / thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa dang / nya phyis la dngul du phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba 'di nges pa yin na de ni rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kho nas spyi las brten pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni gal te spyi med par don rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa skyed
translated: Therefore, if it is certain that the cognition of water in a mirage, the error of a snake in a rope, and the mistake of silver in a shell are all just erroneous, then it is certain that they are based on universals by way of some nature.

original: par byed par mi grub na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par byed par mi grub na 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not established that objects produce a cognition with such an aspect in the absence of a universal, then it is so.

original: des na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i 'khrul pa nges pa'i rten du 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni chu dang smig rgyu dag gam thag pa dang sprul dag kho na'i rang bzhin yin te 'di la spyi gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: des na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i 'khrul pa nges pa'i rten du 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni chu dang smig rgyu dag gam thag pa dang sprul dag kho na'i rang bzhin yin te 'di la spyi gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: Therefore, the basis of the certainty of such an erroneous aspect is the nature of just water and a mirage, or a rope and a snake. What use is another universal in this case?

original: 'di nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir re zhig spyi ji ltar rtogs bzhin ba med par bshad pa ni de la gang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir re zhig spyi ji ltar rtogs bzhin ba med par bshad pa ni de la gang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to establish this very point, it is explained that a universal does not exist as it is conceived.

original: smig rgyu dag la chu nyid yod na ni phyin ci log ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smig rgyu dag la chu nyid yod na ni phyin ci log ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If water actually existed in a mirage, it would follow that it would not be a mistake.

original: 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang de spyi 'dzin par mi grub po zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang de spyi 'dzin par mi grub po zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Even if it were a mistake, it is not established that it apprehends a universal.

original: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par zhes brgal ba dang lan dag gis bstan te /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par zhes brgal ba dang lan dag gis bstan te /
translated: This is explained by the objection and response, ‚ÄúIf it is an unreal image‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other aspect.

original: sgro 'dogs pa ni gzhan la gzhan du 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa ni gzhan la gzhan du 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Superimposition is the imputation of one thing as another.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni de nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni de nyid yin te /
translated: Its object is that itself.

original: rig pa ni rig par 'gyur ba'i chos las lhag pa rig par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na chu'i shes pas smig rgyu dag la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chur sgro 'dogs pa ni chu nyid yul yin pa'i phyir 'di spyi'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa ni rig par 'gyur ba'i chos las lhag pa rig par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // des na chu'i shes pas smig rgyu dag la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chur sgro 'dogs pa ni chu nyid yul yin pa'i phyir 'di spyi'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
translated: Awareness does not make known a phenomenon that is beyond what is to be known.

original: de la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of water superimposes unreal water on a mirage because water itself is its object. It is not a universal because it does not exist in that.

original: med pa'i phyir chu nyid smig rgyu la chur shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin mod /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir chu nyid smig rgyu la chur shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin mod /
translated: Because it does not exist, water itself is not the reason for the cognition of water in a mirage.

original: 'on kyang chu dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i gsal ba'i rten can g-yo zhing gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i spyi gzhan gang yin pa de las sgro 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang chu dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i gsal ba'i rten can g-yo zhing gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i spyi gzhan gang yin pa de las sgro 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: However, there is a superimposition of error, which has the characteristic of superimposition, from any other universal, such as movement and clarity, which is the basis of the manifestation of water and a mirage, and so on.

original: de lta ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were not so, there would be an extreme fallacy.

original: gal te spyi 'dzin pa yod na //
analyzed: gal te spyi 'dzin pa yod na //
translated: If there were a universal that is apprehended,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa de bsu nas bzlog pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa de bsu nas bzlog pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa can zhes smos so //
translated: and so on, in order to anticipate and respond to that qualm, he says, ‚Äúhaving the same effect.‚Äù

original: ji ltar chu'i gsal ba don nges par byed pa rnams chu'i rtogs pa gcig byed pa de bzhin du chu dang smig rgyu dag la yang gang gi dbang gis rtogs pa gcig gi rten gyi dngos por gyur pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar chu'i gsal ba don nges par byed pa rnams chu'i rtogs pa gcig byed pa de bzhin du chu dang smig rgyu dag la yang gang gi dbang gis rtogs pa gcig gi rten gyi dngos por gyur pa na /
translated: Just as the particular water that is the cause of ascertaining the object produces a single cognition of water, in the same way, water and a mirage also become the basis of a single cognition by the power of that.

original: rmongs par gsal ba gzhan la @263a * //
analyzed: rmongs par gsal ba gzhan la @263a * //
translated: In that case, the manifestation of error is in relation to another.

original: de dang 'brel ba'i rnam pa la ltos nas rigs gzhan gyi gsal ba sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ba don gcig la nges pa 'ga' zhig yod ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i rnam pa la ltos nas rigs gzhan gyi gsal ba sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ba don gcig la nges pa 'ga' zhig yod ba ma yin no //
translated: In dependence on the aspect that is related to it, it is not the case that there is any ascertainment of the identity of the manifestation of another type.

original: gal te dngos po rang bzhin gyis smig rgyu rnams chur 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rang bzhin gyis smig rgyu rnams chur 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If things are the cause of the error of mistaking a mirage for water,

original: gtan du 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gtan du 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then would it not be the case that there would be an error forever?

original: brjod pa / 'di ni te bor chu ste /
analyzed: brjod pa / 'di ni te bor chu ste /
translated: We reply: This is water in a mirage.

original: khra bo la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo bo nyid kyis spyi'i rtogs pa skyed pa yin na /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo bo nyid kyis spyi'i rtogs pa skyed pa yin na /
translated: If multicolored things and so on are the cause of the generation of the conception of a universal,

original: rnal 'byor pa la yang de'i rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la yang de'i rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the yogi would also have the conception of a universal.

original: 'o na ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it?

original: brjod pa 'khrul pa rang gi rgyu las 'byung ba na /
analyzed: brjod pa 'khrul pa rang gi rgyu las 'byung ba na /
translated: We reply: When an error arises from its own cause,

original: yul nges par 'gyur ba de ni yul gyis 'khrul par brjod de /üîΩrab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis su 'khrul pa zla bas bskyed par bya ba rab rib med dam /
analyzed: yul nges par 'gyur ba de ni yul gyis 'khrul par brjod de / rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis su 'khrul pa zla bas bskyed par bya ba rab rib med dam /
translated: it is said that the object is an error.üîΩJust as when a person with an eye disease sees two moons, the moon is not the cause of the error, but the eye disease is.

original: zla ba med na mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba med na mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: If the eye disease is absent, or if there is no moon, the error will not occur.

original: 'dir yang rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las 'gyur ba yid kyi nyes pa las smig rgyu la sogs pa dag la 'gyur ba na rnam par rtog pa don nye bar sbyor ba yin gyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags 'jog par nus pa ni ma
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las 'gyur ba yid kyi nyes pa las smig rgyu la sogs pa dag la 'gyur ba na rnam par rtog pa don nye bar sbyor ba yin gyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags 'jog par nus pa ni ma
translated: Here, too, the transformation of the mind from the latent impressions of conceptualization is the transformation of such things as mirages from the fault of the mind. Conceptualization is applied to the object, but it is not possible to posit the latent impressions of conceptualization of the object,

original: yin te / rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of conceptualization.

original: des na de ltar smig rgyu la chur 'khrul pa dngos po'i rgyu can nyid du bsgrubs te skabs nyid kyi dbang du byas nas spyi'i 'dod pas kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na de ltar smig rgyu la chur 'khrul pa dngos po'i rgyu can nyid du bsgrubs te skabs nyid kyi dbang du byas nas spyi'i 'dod pas kyang zhes smos so //
translated: Thus, in this way, the error of a mirage as water is established as having a real cause. In the context of this, he says, ‚ÄúEven by the assertion of the general.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni log pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid dang / dngos po'i rgyu can nyid du bsgrubs pa na shes pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba gcig po de zhes bya ba gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni log pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid dang / dngos po'i rgyu can nyid du bsgrubs pa na shes pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba gcig po de zhes bya ba gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: This establishes the error as conceptualization and as having a real cause. The text is established by the statement, ‚ÄúThat one object of consciousness and so on.‚Äù

original: don gcig byed pa ni pha rol pos kyang 'dod pa yin la de nyid las spyi'i shes pa skye bas na spyi gzhan gyis ci bya /üîΩgal te log pa'i shes pa yod pa de'i so sor nges pa'i yul la brten nas skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: don gcig byed pa ni pha rol pos kyang 'dod pa yin la de nyid las spyi'i shes pa skye bas na spyi gzhan gyis ci bya / gal te log pa'i shes pa yod pa de'i so sor nges pa'i yul la brten nas skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin par 'gyur na /
translated: The opponent accepts that a single object is the cause of a single cognition, and that a single cognition is the result of a single object.üîΩIf the existence of a mistaken consciousness is based on the object of that consciousness, then how could it be ascertained that it is a mistaken consciousness?üîΩThe opponent argues that it is not the case that a conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot is a mistaken consciousness because it is a consciousness that does not apprehend the entity of the object of the pot just as it is.üîΩThe opponent argues that it is not the case that a conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot is a mistaken consciousness because it is a consciousness that does not apprehend the entity of the object of the pot just as it is.

original: 'di log pa'i shes pa nyid du nges pa ni ji ltar yin te dngos po rang bzhin ji lta ba nyid du ngo bo shes pa'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs la rag mod ces rtsod par byed pa niüîΩgal te dngos po ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di log pa'i shes pa nyid du nges pa ni ji ltar yin te dngos po rang bzhin ji lta ba nyid du ngo bo shes pa'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs la rag mod ces rtsod par byed pa ni gal te dngos po ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot would be a mistaken consciousness because it does not apprehend the entity of the pot just as it is.üîΩIf it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot would be a mistaken consciousness because it does not apprehend the entity of the pot just as it is.üîΩIf it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot would be a mistaken consciousness because it does not apprehend the entity of the pot just as it is.üîΩIf it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot would be a mistaken consciousness because it does not apprehend the entity of the pot just as it is.üîΩIf it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot would be a mistaken consciousness because it does not apprehend the entity of the pot just as it is.üîΩIf it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot would be a mistaken consciousness because it does not apprehend the entity of the pot just as it is.üîΩIf it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot would be a mistaken consciousness because it does not apprehend the entity of the pot just as it is.üîΩIf it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot would be a mistaken consciousness because it does not apprehend the entity of the pot just as it is.

original: rtogs pa kho na ste gcig pa nyid yin pa na gzhan yang ba lang nyid ba lang kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩkhyad par ma 'dres pa can zhes @263b smos te /
analyzed: rtogs pa kho na ste gcig pa nyid yin pa na gzhan yang ba lang nyid ba lang kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na / khyad par ma 'dres pa can zhes @263b smos te /
translated: If it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness apprehending a pot would be a mistaken consciousness because it does not apprehend the entity of the pot just as it is.

original: ngo shes pa'i bdag nyid spangs nas so //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i bdag nyid spangs nas so //
translated: If it were, then it would be the case that the conceptual consciousness

original: ma rig pa'i mthu las zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mthu las zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is ‚Äúdue to the power of ignorance.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags te de'i mthu las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags te de'i mthu las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ignorance is the latent impressions of conceptuality, because it arises due to their power.

original: de med na rnam par rtog pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa nyid yin pa des na spyir zhen par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na rnam par rtog pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa nyid yin pa des na spyir zhen par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If it did not exist, there would be no conceptuality. Therefore, since it is nonconceptual cognition, how could it be generally characterized?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags la brten pa yin na de ji lta ba bzhin rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags la brten pa yin na de ji lta ba bzhin rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were based on the latent imprints of conceptuality, it would be conceptual just like that.

original: gal te gang gis rig pa las rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba dmigs pa med kyang rnam par rtog pa snga ma 'jug pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa nas rgyu 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang du rtogs /
analyzed: gal te gang gis rig pa las rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba dmigs pa med kyang rnam par rtog pa snga ma 'jug pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa nas rgyu 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang du rtogs /
translated: If you think that although the object of cognition does not exist, conceptuality arises from cognition, and that the beginningless continuum of consciousness that conforms to the engagement of previous conceptuality is the cause, where is this imagined?

original: shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa la brten pa kho na yin mod kyi 'on kyang de la chos mthun pa la sogs pas 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa la brten pa kho na yin mod kyi 'on kyang de la chos mthun pa la sogs pas 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Although all cognitions are indeed based on objects, still, they may be mistaken due to similarity and so on,

original: chu la sogs par shes pa bzhin no zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: chu la sogs par shes pa bzhin no zhes dogs pa la /
translated: just as the cognition of water and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi don kho na la zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don kho na la zhes smos so //
translated: In response to this doubt, he says, ‚Äúonly external objects.‚Äù

original: dper na sgra la sogs par bslad pa rnams dmigs pa la brten pa'i khyad par med kyang nang gi rab rib la skye ba de bzhin du 'di dag mi rig pa'i mtshan nyid nang gi khyad par kho na las skye bar 'gyur na ci 'gal sgrub par byed
analyzed: dper na sgra la sogs par bslad pa rnams dmigs pa la brten pa'i khyad par med kyang nang gi rab rib la skye ba de bzhin du 'di dag mi rig pa'i mtshan nyid nang gi khyad par kho na las skye bar 'gyur na ci 'gal sgrub par byed
translated: For example, although there is no difference in the dependence on objects of those mistaken with respect to sound and so on, they arise from internal cataracts. In the same way, if these arise only from internal differences characterized by ignorance, what is the contradiction?

original: pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there no proof?

original: ji ltar med de bden pa'i dmigs pa bkag pa na rnam par rtog pa sngar gyi shes pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis skye ba 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar med de bden pa'i dmigs pa bkag pa na rnam par rtog pa sngar gyi shes pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis skye ba 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is there no proof? When the true object is refuted, the arising of conceptual consciousness is established by its conformity to the prior consciousness.

original: dmigs pa med kyang rnam par shes pa shes pa snga ma'i rjes su byed par skye ba srid na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med kyang rnam par shes pa shes pa snga ma'i rjes su byed par skye ba srid na /
translated: Even though there is no objective referent, it is possible for consciousness to arise in conformity with a previous consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa yang rnam pa 'di nyid du 'gyur mod /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa yang rnam pa 'di nyid du 'gyur mod /
translated: In that case, the consciousnesses of the eye, etc. would also be of this same type.

original: yul dang dbang po dang yid la byed pa las skyes pas ci bya zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang yid la byed pa las skyes pas ci bya zhes ston pa ni /
translated: What is the use of the arising of consciousness from objects, faculties, and mental attention?

original: ma rig pa las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it arises from nescience.‚Äù

original: de spong ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de spong ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not the abandonment of that.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi dmigs pa bkag pa rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rgyu nyid du rtog pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags nyid ma rig par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi dmigs pa bkag pa rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rgyu nyid du rtog pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags nyid ma rig par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The negation of the objective referent of conceptual differentiation is considered to be the cause of the latent impressions of conceptual differentiation. Thus, the latent impressions of conceptual differentiation are understood to be nescience.

original: des na dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las skye ba yin na /
analyzed: des na dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las skye ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the consciousness of the sense faculties arises from the latent impressions of conceptual differentiation,

original: de rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba kho na zhig na /
analyzed: de rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba kho na zhig na /
translated: then it would certainly be conceptual differentiation.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir 'di dag ma rig pa las byung ba ma @264a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir 'di dag ma rig pa las byung ba ma @264a * //
translated: But since it is not conceptual differentiation, it does not arise from nescience.

original: yin pa des na bslad pa nyid do //
analyzed: yin pa des na bslad pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is defiled.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid ma rig pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags nyid la rnam par rtog par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid ma rig pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags nyid la rnam par rtog par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Conceptualization is ignorance. Conceptualization is said to be the latent impressions of conceptualization.

original: 'o na ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rdul phra mo dang rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi zad pas dmigs pa med pas na bag chags la brten par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas yang na zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rdul phra mo dang rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi zad pas dmigs pa med pas na bag chags la brten par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas yang na zhes smos so //
translated: But then, since the sense consciousnesses also conceptualize subtle and gross particles, they would be without objects and would be based on latent impressions.

original: gal te dbang po'i shes pa rnams ma bslad pa'i bdag nyid yin na de'i tshe de dag la thal ba 'di skyon du 'gyur ba zhig na khas blangs na ni 'di thal ba ma yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i shes pa rnams ma bslad pa'i bdag nyid yin na de'i tshe de dag la thal ba 'di skyon du 'gyur ba zhig na khas blangs na ni 'di thal ba ma yin pas skyon med do //
translated: If the sense consciousnesses were of the nature of non-defilement, then this consequence would be a fault. But if you accept that, then this is not a consequence and there is no fault.

original: skyon med pa nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: skyon med pa nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the absence of fault is:

original: gnyis med pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis med pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the absence of duality.

original: dngos su na ni 'di shes pa tsam yin mod kyi 'khrul pa'i dbang gis sngon po shes pa'i rang bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: dngos su na ni 'di shes pa tsam yin mod kyi 'khrul pa'i dbang gis sngon po shes pa'i rang bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: In reality, it is just consciousness, but by the power of error it appears as the nature of the cognition of blue.

original: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa dag la sogs pa dag srid pa yin na ni dngos po kho na la 'di dag sngon po shes pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas gnyis med pa ma yin te sngon po'i rnam pa yang de la don dam yin pa'i
analyzed: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa dag la sogs pa dag srid pa yin na ni dngos po kho na la 'di dag sngon po shes pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas gnyis med pa ma yin te sngon po'i rnam pa yang de la don dam yin pa'i
translated: If blue and non-blue, etc. were possible, then these would be the nature of the cognition of blue, so it would not be non-dual, because the aspect of blue would be the ultimate object in it.

original: phyir ro // de med na ni gnyis med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyir ro // de med na ni gnyis med pa nyid do //
translated: If that does not exist, then it is non-dual.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams bslad pa nyid ni ji ltar tshad ma'i nang du bgrang bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams bslad pa nyid ni ji ltar tshad ma'i nang du bgrang bar byed ce na /
translated: If the cognitions of eye, etc. are just erroneous, how can they be counted among the valid cognitions?

original: thams cad bslad pa nyid yin yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: thams cad bslad pa nyid yin yang zhes smos so //
translated: He says, Even though all are erroneous.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam par bslad pa kho na yin pa de lta na yang tshad ma dang der snang ba'i rnam par gzhag pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam par bslad pa kho na yin pa de lta na yang tshad ma dang der snang ba'i rnam par gzhag pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Even though all consciousnesses are just erroneous, still the establishment of valid cognition and the appearance of that exist.

original: des na 'di dag tshad ma'i nang du bgrang bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di dag tshad ma'i nang du bgrang bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to include these in the category of valid cognition.

original: ji ltar rnam par bslad pa nyid la tshad ma dang der snang ba rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par bslad pa nyid la tshad ma dang der snang ba rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How can one posit valid cognition and its appearance in the case of error?

original: bshad pa ji srid gnas te bag chags zhes bya ba gnyis su snang ba'i rgyur gyur pa log pa'i mthar thug par don bya bar rung bar mngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa ji srid gnas te bag chags zhes bya ba gnyis su snang ba'i rgyur gyur pa log pa'i mthar thug par don bya bar rung bar mngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba'i phyir te /
translated: The answer is: as long as the cause of the appearance of duality, the so-called residual impressions, has not ceased, one is not freed from the ultimate of error, because one is not deceived with regard to the object that one desires to appropriate.

original: don bya ba gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bya ba gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object to be appropriated remains.

original: 'di ltar gal te rnam par shes pa thams cad bslang ba nyid yin pa de lta na yang ji srid gnyis kyi bag chags las ma 'das pa de srid du rung bar mngon par 'dod pa me'i don bya ba btso ba dang / sreg pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rnam par shes pa thams cad bslang ba nyid yin pa de lta na yang ji srid gnyis kyi bag chags las ma 'das pa de srid du rung bar mngon par 'dod pa me'i don bya ba btso ba dang / sreg pa dang /
translated: Thus, even if all consciousnesses are erroneous, as long as one has not transcended the residual impressions of duality, one is not freed from the ultimate of error, because the object that one desires to appropriate, such as the object of fire, has the function of burning and cooking,

original: zas zos pas skyed pa bru bas gdungs pa nye bar zhi ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: zas zos pas skyed pa bru bas gdungs pa nye bar zhi ba yod pa yin no //
translated: and the object of food, the alleviation of the pain of hunger, exists.

original: des na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rnam par shes @264b pa ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rnam par shes @264b pa ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, consciousness that has this kind of appearance is valid.

original: 'di ltar me la sogs pa'i shes pa rgyun du 'byung ba na bkres pa'i sdug bsngal log pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rig pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar me la sogs pa'i shes pa rgyun du 'byung ba na bkres pa'i sdug bsngal log pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rig pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, when the cognition of fire, etc. occurs in a continuum, the cognition of the form of the cessation of the suffering of hunger occurs.

original: tshad ma las gzhan ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can tshad ma yin pa na /
analyzed: tshad ma las gzhan ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can tshad ma yin pa na /
translated: Since it is not a means of valid cognition, it is not a means of valid cognition that has such a characteristic.

original: gang du me la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi rgyun rnam pa 'di ltar kun du spyod pa med pa de las gzhan ni bzlog pa tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du me la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi rgyun rnam pa 'di ltar kun du spyod pa med pa de las gzhan ni bzlog pa tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Where the continuum of the cognition of fire, etc. does not operate in this way, it is the opposite of that, and is not a means of valid cognition.

original: des na 'di na 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa'i thun mong gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di na 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa'i thun mong gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the common characteristic of worldly direct perception and non-direct perception.

original: yang ci'i don du 'di rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i don du 'di rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Again, for what purpose is this established?

original: log pa nyid yin yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: log pa nyid yin yang zhes smos so //
translated: It is said, Even though it is false.

original: log pas byas pa yang 'ga' zhig tu yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: log pas byas pa yang 'ga' zhig tu yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Even that which is falsely produced becomes a limb in some cases.

original: dper na bud med kyi khyad par mar 'du shes pa'i yul can rab tu zhi ba'i yan lag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bud med kyi khyad par mar 'du shes pa'i yul can rab tu zhi ba'i yan lag bzhin no //
translated: For example, the subject that perceives a woman as a mother is a limb of pacification.

original: de bzhin du tshad ma dang der snang ba rnam par gzhag pa 'di dmigs pa med pa yin yang tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i dgos pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad ma dang der snang ba rnam par gzhag pa 'di dmigs pa med pa yin yang tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i dgos pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, although this presentation of valid cognition and its appearance is not an object, it becomes a limb of the need to establish valid cognition and invalid cognition.

original: ma la ngo bo nyid kyi sgrub pa'i rab tu zhi ba gang yin pa de ni de ltar mngon bar zhen pa byas pas gzhan la yang 'grub pa de kho na'o //
analyzed: ma la ngo bo nyid kyi sgrub pa'i rab tu zhi ba gang yin pa de ni de ltar mngon bar zhen pa byas pas gzhan la yang 'grub pa de kho na'o //
translated: The pacification that is the establishment of the nature of the mother is accomplished for others in just that way by the one who has made such ascertainment.

original: de bzhin du tshad ma ma yin yang de ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni tshad mas byas pa'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad ma ma yin yang de ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni tshad mas byas pa'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, although it is not valid cognition, such a presentation becomes a limb of what is accomplished by valid cognition.

original: gcig la ni bag chags brtan pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la ni bag chags brtan pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in one case there is a stable latent tendency, and in the other there is not.

original: rnam par rig par smra ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma dang / tshad ma ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dpyad pa na /
analyzed: rnam par rig par smra ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma dang / tshad ma ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dpyad pa na /
translated: When the Proponents of Cognition analyze the nature of worldly valid cognition and invalid cognition,

original: bag chags brtan pa dang mi brtan pa tsam rgyu mtshan du nye bar len to //
analyzed: bag chags brtan pa dang mi brtan pa tsam rgyu mtshan du nye bar len to //
translated: The reason is merely the stability or instability of the latent impressions.

original: rang nyid rnam par rig pa tsam dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam par 'jog pa ni dngos po yul can rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'jog la /
analyzed: rang nyid rnam par rig pa tsam dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam par 'jog pa ni dngos po yul can rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'jog la /
translated: The establishment of the entity of mere representation, selflessness, and so on is established by the valid knowledge of inference that has an entity as its object.

original: chos can ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: chos can ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis so //
translated: The subject is established by the direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: smig rgyu la chur zhen pa 'khrul par khyad par med kyang mi 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur zhen pa 'khrul par khyad par med kyang mi 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that although there is no difference in error in the misapprehension of a mirage as water, there is a difference in the way they are taught,

original: smig rgyu dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: smig rgyu dang zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúa mirage,‚Äù and so on.

original: smig rgyu chu las log pa yin na /
analyzed: smig rgyu chu las log pa yin na /
translated: If a mirage is the opposite of water,

original: chu chu gzhan las log pa yin no //
analyzed: chu chu gzhan las log pa yin no //
translated: water is the opposite of another water.

original: des smig rgyu dang chu la chur zhen pa ni chu las tha dad pa'i dngos po la 'byung ba yin pa des na dngos po tha dad pa las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: des smig rgyu dang chu la chur zhen pa ni chu las tha dad pa'i dngos po la 'byung ba yin pa des na dngos po tha dad pa las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Since the misapprehension of a mirage as water occurs in relation to an entity that is different from water, it arises from a different entity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir @265a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir @265a * //
translated: For that very reason,

original: 'di ni 'khrul par khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul par khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: there is no difference in error.

original: de lta mod kyi chu las skyes pa'i chur shes pa ni mi bslu la gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi chu las skyes pa'i chur shes pa ni mi bslu la gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But the cognition of water in water born of water is non-erroneous, not the other.

original: chu nyid la chur shes pa skyes pa na ji ltar 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: chu nyid la chur shes pa skyes pa na ji ltar 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How can the cognition of water in water be erroneous, when it arises?

original: gzhan yin yang chu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yin yang chu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained as water, even though it is different.

original: gal te chu'i rnam par rtog pa chu'i 'bras bur rung bas bskyed bya yin na mi rung ba las ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te chu'i rnam par rtog pa chu'i 'bras bur rung bas bskyed bya yin na mi rung ba las ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the conceptual cognition of water is fit to be produced as the effect of water, how can it arise from what is unfit?

original: de ste mi rung bas bskyed par bya ba yin na rung ba la mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ste mi rung bas bskyed par bya ba yin na rung ba la mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is produced from what is unfit, it will not be from what is fit.

original: gcig nyid rigs mthun pa dag las skye ba nges par khas blang ba ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba de smos pa ni /
analyzed: gcig nyid rigs mthun pa dag las skye ba nges par khas blang ba ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba de smos pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not possible to accept that a single thing is produced from homogeneous things‚Äù is this:

original: gal te mi rung ba las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mi rung ba las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is from what is unfit. . . ‚Äù

original: rung ba las skye ba la ltos nas mi rung ba las skye ba la brtsad pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rung ba las skye ba la ltos nas mi rung ba las skye ba la brtsad pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The objection to the production of what is fit in dependence on what is unfit is illustrated by the statement,

original: de bzhin du mi rung ba la brten nas kyang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rung ba la brten nas kyang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is from what is unfit. . . ‚Äù It should be understood in the same way in the case of what is fit.

original: dogs pa 'di bsu nas bshad pa ni rnam par rtog pa rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa 'di bsu nas bshad pa ni rnam par rtog pa rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The conceptual thoughts are not born from a real object.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what he means.

original: gal te 'di dag rung ba'am mi rung ba las skye ba yin na 'di gnyi ga ltar nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa zhig na 'di dag ni don las skye ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag rung ba'am mi rung ba las skye ba yin na 'di gnyi ga ltar nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa zhig na 'di dag ni don las skye ba med pa nyid do //
translated: If they were born from a real or unreal object, then neither of these two would be certain. This is true, but they are not born from an object.

original: ji lta zhe na rnam par rtog pa rnams ni don ji lta ba bzhin zhes smos te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na rnam par rtog pa rnams ni don ji lta ba bzhin zhes smos te /
translated: How so? He says: The conceptual thoughts are not born from a real object.

original: gal te 'di dag don dang 'brel pa yin na don ji lta ba bzhin kho nar 'gyur te mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag don dang 'brel pa yin na don ji lta ba bzhin kho nar 'gyur te mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: If they were connected with an object, they would be just like a real object, just as perception is.

original: de ni don gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis na don dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni don gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis na don dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: That is, perception is connected with an object by the nature of its clarity of the object.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But conceptual thoughts are not like that.

original: des na 'di ni don dang 'brel pas nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni don dang 'brel pas nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not certain because they are connected with an object.

original: 'o na ji ltar rung ba dang mi rung ba las skye zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rung ba dang mi rung ba las skye zhes bshad ce na /
translated: Well then, how can it be said that they are born from a real or unreal object?

original: phyir bshad pa ni smig rgyu mthong ba yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir bshad pa ni smig rgyu mthong ba yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúWhen there is the seeing of a mirage.‚Äù

original: smig rgyu mthong ba las chur 'khrul pa'i phyir smig rgyu las skyes zhes bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni chu ma yin pa dang bral ba'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu mthong ba las chur 'khrul pa'i phyir smig rgyu las skyes zhes bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni chu ma yin pa dang bral ba'i don ces bya'o //
translated: It is not that the meaning of ‚Äúarisen from a mirage‚Äù is related to the meaning of ‚Äúfree from non-water,‚Äù because the meaning of ‚Äúfree from non-water‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúwater.‚Äù

original: don dang 'brel pa yin na don gsal ba'i rang bzhin du don las skye bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang chu ma yin pa las log pa'i don gyis rang gi rnam par gzhag pas don gsal bar 'gyur ba don gyis bskyed par 'gyur na de ni yodüîΩpa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa yin na don gsal ba'i rang bzhin du don las skye bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang chu ma yin pa las log pa'i don gyis rang gi rnam par gzhag pas don gsal bar 'gyur ba don gyis bskyed par 'gyur na de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the meaning were related, the meaning would be produced from the object, which has the nature of the manifestation of the meaning. Even so, the meaning of ‚Äúfree from non-water‚Äù is established by the meaning itself, and the manifestation of the meaning would be produced by the meaning. But that does not exist.

original: gal te 'khrul pa nyid kyis chu las ma @265b skyes par grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
