original: gnyug ma ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ltos par bya ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: gnyug ma ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ltos par bya ba nyid yin la /
translated: The intrinsic nature is the dependent nature of the support and the supported.

original: gang cung zad gsal ba byed pa la sogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de thams cad kyang bskyed par bya ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gang cung zad gsal ba byed pa la sogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de thams cad kyang bskyed par bya ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Whatever is other than that, such as manifestation, is all that is to be produced.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The conclusion of the reason, ‚Äúthe nature of other.‚Äù

original: des na de ltar bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi mjug bsdus nas skabs nyid mjug sdud pa ni /
analyzed: des na de ltar bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi mjug bsdus nas skabs nyid mjug sdud pa ni /
translated: Thus, having concluded the probandum and the proof, the section itself is concluded.

original: de'i phyir gsal bas zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal bas zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause of manifestation‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di de rnams kyi 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: 'di de rnams kyi 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: It is established that this is the result of those.

original: gsal ba la mi ltos na yang gsal ba rnams rnam par shes pa de'i gzung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba la mi ltos na yang gsal ba rnams rnam par shes pa de'i gzung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú Even if they do not depend on manifestation, the manifestations are not the apprehended objects of that consciousness‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú By themselves‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar ni mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni bstan zin to //
translated: It has been explained that this is not tenable.

original: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i @271b rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i @271b rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is a universal because it is concomitant with and without distinction from the particulars.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang spyi la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba rnams nus pa mad par bsgrubs pa na pha rol po dag ji skad du brjod pa'i tshul dor nas nus par smras pa ni gal te rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang spyi la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba rnams nus pa mad par bsgrubs pa na pha rol po dag ji skad du brjod pa'i tshul dor nas nus par smras pa ni gal te rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the opponent is refuted in the proof that the particulars are not capable, he abandons the method of expression that he previously used and says that they are capable, saying, ‚ÄúIf it is because of appearing to consciousness.‚Äù

original: dngos po gcig dang lhan cig pa'i gsal ba rnams tha mi dad pa'i shes pa'i gzhir 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di tsam nyid /üîΩde la 'di rnams kyi nus pa yin gyi gang gis na de mi srid pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po gcig dang lhan cig pa'i gsal ba rnams tha mi dad pa'i shes pa'i gzhir 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di tsam nyid / de la 'di rnams kyi nus pa yin gyi gang gis na de mi srid pa'am /
translated: The mere fact that the particulars that exist simultaneously with one thing are the basis of a nondistinct cognition is just this:üîΩThis is their capability, and it is not that they are not capable because of the nonexistence of that capability.

original: mi srid pas na nus pa med par 'gyur ba de yod na yod pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi srid pas na nus pa med par 'gyur ba de yod na yod pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it that they are not capable because of the nonexistence of that capability.

original: yul gyi rnam par shes pa la nus pa ni yul du 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam par shes pa la nus pa ni yul du 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: The response to this is as follows: The object is only the potential for the consciousness of the object, not anything else.

original: gzhan 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.üîΩThe response to this is as follows:

original: de ma yin no zhes 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de ma yin no zhes 'chad pa ni /
translated: The response to this is as follows:üîΩThe object is not established as being helpful.

original: phan 'dogs par ma grub pa can rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par ma grub pa can rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object is not established as being helpful.

original: gang gis yul nyid nus pa yin par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa ni don shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis yul nyid nus pa yin par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa ni don shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: That which does not generate consciousness, which is the potential for the object, is not the object of the consciousness of the object.

original: ji ltar zhe na 'di ltar zhes smos te gal te don skyed par byed pa ma yin bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na 'di ltar zhes smos te gal te don skyed par byed pa ma yin bzhin du /
translated: How is this so?

original: shes pa nyid grub pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i nus pas 'dzin par byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: shes pa nyid grub pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i nus pas 'dzin par byed pa yin na ni /
translated: If the object were to apprehend the object by the power of consciousness, which is established as the apprehender, even though it does not generate consciousness,

original: thams cad 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad kyis thams cad shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad kyis thams cad shes par 'gyur te /
translated: then everything would be apprehended by everything, because everything would be the apprehender of everything.

original: des na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This would be a preposterous consequence.

original: des na phan par byed pa ma yin pa ni yul ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phan par byed pa ma yin pa ni yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is not helpful is not the object.

original: gal te yul ma yin no zhe na ni mi snang bas na de ji ltar snang ba'i phyir nus so zhes ji ltar brjod /
analyzed: gal te yul ma yin no zhe na ni mi snang bas na de ji ltar snang ba'i phyir nus so zhes ji ltar brjod /
translated: If you say that it is not the object, then since it does not appear, how can you say that it is the cause of the appearance of consciousness?

original: gal te yul ni rig par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te yul ni rig par bya ba yin la /
translated: If you say that the object is that which is to be cognized,

original: de yang phan 'dogs par byed pa kho na yin pa'i phyir dran pa dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i rtogs pa dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams la rig pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi yul 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: de yang phan 'dogs par byed pa kho na yin pa'i phyir dran pa dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i rtogs pa dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams la rig pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi yul 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
translated: then since it is only that which benefits, there would be no object at all that is cognized in the same way in the case of memory, cognition of the past and future, and the consciousness of the horn of a rabbit, etc.

original: gal te phan pa med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te phan pa med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If you say that it is that which does not benefit,

original: de la shes pa de ni yul med pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa de ni yul med pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: then it is explained that the consciousness of that is only without an object.

original: de dag gi shes pa rnams yul med du zad mod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi shes pa rnams yul med du zad mod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said that the consciousness of those is only without an object.

original: yul gyis byas pa'i yul gsal ba nyid dang ldan pa yin na ni /
analyzed: yul gyis byas pa'i yul gsal ba nyid dang ldan pa yin na ni /
translated: If the object is that which possesses the clarity that is produced by the object,

original: yul gyis phan ma btags pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams su yul gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyis phan ma btags pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams su yul gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the consciousnesses that are not benefited by the object would not be clear with respect to the object.

original: rang nyid kyis grub pa'i de la gsal ba yod pa'i rnam @272a * //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis grub pa'i de la gsal ba yod pa'i rnam @272a * //
translated: It is clear that it is established as itself.

original: par shes pa rnams ni de'i phan pa la ltos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: par shes pa rnams ni de'i phan pa la ltos pa med pa ste /
translated: The consciousnesses that have the form of the manifestation of that which is established by itself do not depend on the benefit of that.

original: dper na thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: gal te yul med pa can yin na 'on te de dag gis ci rig ce na /
analyzed: gal te yul med pa can yin na 'on te de dag gis ci rig ce na /
translated: If they are without an object, then what do they know?

original: yul med du zin kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: yul med du zin kyang zhes smos so //
translated: Even though they are without an object, it is said.

original: de lta bu'i rgyu mtshan gyis bskyed pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i snang ba dang ldan pa na 'dir 'ga' zhig snang ba bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rgyu mtshan gyis bskyed pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i snang ba dang ldan pa na 'dir 'ga' zhig snang ba bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: When there is the appearance that is generated by such a cause and is of the nature of itself, it is understood that something appears here, just as it is.

original: 'di la phyi rol gyi rig par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la phyi rol gyi rig par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the object of external knowledge does not exist.

original: 'on kyang rang gi rig pa rang bzhin du gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi rig pa rang bzhin du gyur pa na'o //
translated: However, it is when there is self-knowledge that is natural.

original: shes pa'i snang ba de ni de'i dus nyid yin mod kyi lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yul du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i snang ba de ni de'i dus nyid yin mod kyi lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yul du nges pa yin no //
translated: That appearance of consciousness is indeed at that time, but by the power of excessive attachment, it is ascertained as an object that is past, future, or like the horn of a rabbit and so forth.

original: gang gis na snang ba'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyi nus pa yin no zhes brjod pa snang ba zhes bya ba nus pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gang gis na snang ba'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyi nus pa yin no zhes brjod pa snang ba zhes bya ba nus pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: But the reason for the potency is not the appearance, as is said in the verse,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence and non-existence of the appearance.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang yod na yod pa dang / gang med na ni med pa der nus pa yin no zhes nus pa'i de kho na nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod na yod pa dang / gang med na ni med pa der nus pa yin no zhes nus pa'i de kho na nyid yin gyi /
translated: The reality of potency is that if something exists when something else exists, and does not exist when it does not exist, then the latter is the potency of the former.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But the appearance is not the potency.

original: nus pa nyid rgyu nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa nyid rgyu nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Potency is said to be the cause.

original: de la de snang ba tsam gyis mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de la de snang ba tsam gyis mi nus pa yin no //
translated: It is not potent merely by the appearance of that.

original: gal te yul rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gal te yul rgyu yin na /
translated: If the object is the cause,

original: snang ba yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: snang ba yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa kho na'o //
translated: then the existence and non-existence of the appearance would be just the same.

original: rgyu ma yin pa nyid yin na yang snang ba cam kho nar zad kyi nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa nyid yin na yang snang ba cam kho nar zad kyi nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is not the cause, then it is just the appearance, and not the potency.

original: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish that very point,üîΩhe says,

original: mi snang yang nus pa dang snang yang mi nus pa ston pa ni gsal ba las ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi snang yang nus pa dang snang yang mi nus pa ston pa ni gsal ba las ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúEven though it does not appear, it is still capable of producing a cognition, and even though it does appear, it is not capable of producing a cognition‚Äù is the response to the question, ‚ÄúHow can one understand that the cognition is produced from the object?‚Äù

original: spyi'i blo khra bor snang bar khas blangs pa'i phyir spyi rang bzhin gzhan gyis dben par mi snang ba kho na'o //
analyzed: spyi'i blo khra bor snang bar khas blangs pa'i phyir spyi rang bzhin gzhan gyis dben par mi snang ba kho na'o //
translated: Since you accept that the cognition of a multicolored object is a cognition of a universal, the universal does not appear as something that is devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: de lta na yang de ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de ni yod pa kho na yin te /

translated: The addition of the word ‚Äúgrasp‚Äù means that things become different due to the superimposition of the imagination of that kind of nature.

analyzed: @274a * // spyi khyad par las tha mi dad pa'i phyir khyad par bzhin du spyi yang khyad par gzhan la mi 'jug pas na rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin gcig gis ston pa'i gsal ba rnams tha dad pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa'i blo mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the universal is not different from the particular, like the particular, the universal does not pervade another particular. Therefore, because the manifestations that are taught by the single universal would be different, it is impossible for there to be a cognition of them as not different.

original: de ltar / gal te tha dad mi snang ble //
analyzed: de ltar / gal te tha dad mi snang ble //
translated: Thus, if it is not different, it does not appear.

original: zhes rtsod pa 'di rnam par gzhag pa'i grub mtha' la ltos te 'jug pa med pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: zhes rtsod pa 'di rnam par gzhag pa'i grub mtha' la ltos te 'jug pa med pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: This argument is presented in terms of the tenets of the opponent.

original: gang gis 'di nye bar bkod pa de nyid nye bar ston pas tha mi dad par snang ba nyid snang ba spangs pa'i phyir yang na zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang gis 'di nye bar bkod pa de nyid nye bar ston pas tha mi dad par snang ba nyid snang ba spangs pa'i phyir yang na zhes smos so //
translated: Since the cognition that is produced by the arrangement of the parts is not different from the cognition that perceives the whole, the word ‚Äúor‚Äù is used to eliminate the appearance of difference.

original: tha mi dad par snang ba'i blo tha dad pa rnams la mi 'thad do zhas smras pa na tha mi dad par snang ba'i blo ni tha dad pa rnams la med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad par snang ba'i blo tha dad pa rnams la mi 'thad do zhas smras pa na tha mi dad par snang ba'i blo ni tha dad pa rnams la med pa kho na ste /
translated: When it is said that the cognition of the appearance of nondifference is not tenable for different things, the response is that the cognition of the appearance of nondifference does not exist for different things.

original: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes mdos ma zin pa nyid kyis lan btab po //
analyzed: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes mdos ma zin pa nyid kyis lan btab po //
translated: Because it is not a cognition that has a particular as its object.

original: de khas blangs kyang mdos lan 'debs pa ni blo de'i tha dad pa rnams yin du zad de tha dad par snang ba nyid 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de khas blangs kyang mdos lan 'debs pa ni blo de'i tha dad pa rnams yin du zad de tha dad par snang ba nyid 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Even if one accepts that, the response is that the cognition of the whole is just different things, because there is no appearance of difference at all.

original: ji ltar snang ba tha dad ce na bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba tha dad ce na bshad pa /
translated: How is it that the appearance is different?üîΩIt is said:

original: tha dad pa de dag mtshungs zhes 'dzin phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa de dag mtshungs zhes 'dzin phyir ro //
translated: Because it apprehends those differences as the same.

original: tha mi dad par snang ba gcig tu snang ba yin gcig nyid snang ba ni mtshungs so zhes bya bar snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad par snang ba gcig tu snang ba yin gcig nyid snang ba ni mtshungs so zhes bya bar snang ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the cognition ‚ÄúThey are the same‚Äù appears,

original: phan tshun tha dad pa gnyis snang ba na 'dir ni 'di dang mtshungs so zhes rtogs par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa gnyis snang ba na 'dir ni 'di dang mtshungs so zhes rtogs par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when two different things appear, it is established that the cognition ‚ÄúThis is like that‚Äù occurs.

original: tha mi dad pa la ni de ltar rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa la ni de ltar rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case with nondifferent things.

original: nang par dmigs pa'i bum pa dgongs ka dmigs pa na /
analyzed: nang par dmigs pa'i bum pa dgongs ka dmigs pa na /
translated: When a pot is observed in the morning and again in the evening,

original: de dang mtshungs so zhes rtogs pa ni med kyi 'on kyang de nyid do zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs so zhes rtogs pa ni med kyi 'on kyang de nyid do zhes bya bar ro //
translated: the cognition ‚ÄúIt is the same‚Äù does not occur, but rather the cognition ‚ÄúIt is that very same pot‚Äù occurs.

original: des na mtshungs so snyam pas 'jug pa'i blo la ni tha dad par snang ba nyid med pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i yul can nyid du mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na mtshungs so snyam pas 'jug pa'i blo la ni tha dad par snang ba nyid med pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i yul can nyid du mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, since the cognition that engages the thought ‚ÄúThey are the same‚Äù does not perceive them as different, it is not contradictory for it to have a nondifferent object.

original: gal te 'di ba lang yin la 'di yang ba lang yin no snyam du rtogs pa skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'di ba lang yin la 'di yang ba lang yin no snyam du rtogs pa skye ba yin gyi /
translated: But if the cognition ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù and the cognition ‚ÄúThat is a cow‚Äù arise,

original: mtshungs so zhes bya bar ni ma yin par ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mtshungs so zhes bya bar ni ma yin par ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: isn‚Äôt it the case that the cognition ‚ÄúThey are the same‚Äù does not occur?

original: bden te / 'on kyang 'di nyid spyi'i rtogs par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang 'di nyid spyi'i rtogs par brjod pa yin te /
translated: True, but this is a general statement,

original: pha rol pos spyi gzhan dang ldan pa las mtshungs par byas pa'i dngos po rnams kho na la rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol pos spyi gzhan dang ldan pa las mtshungs par byas pa'i dngos po rnams kho na la rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the opponent accepts that consciousness of this kind occurs only in regard to things that possess a universal that is different from them.

original: der yang tha mi dad par snang ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: der yang tha mi dad par snang ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And even in that case, there is no appearance of nondifference,

original: 'di ba lang 'di 'dra ba la de zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ba lang 'di 'dra ba la de zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one understands that this cow is like that cow.

original: tha mi dad par snang na ni ba lang de nyid 'di'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par snang na ni ba lang de nyid 'di'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were an appearance of nondifference, one would say that that cow is this cow.

original: des 'di tha mi dad par snang ba ma @274b yin pas tha dad pa'i yul can nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des 'di tha mi dad par snang ba ma @274b yin pas tha dad pa'i yul can nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Since it does not appear to him as nondifferent, it is not inconsistent that it has a different object.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni de dag la tha mi dad par snang ba ni med pa kho na ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni de dag la tha mi dad par snang ba ni med pa kho na ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained by the words, ‚ÄúThere is no appearance of nondifference in them at all.‚Äù

original: 'dir pha rol po dag tha mi dad par snang ba nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'i don du phyir zlog pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag tha mi dad par snang ba nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'i don du phyir zlog pa ni /
translated: Here the opponent argues that the appearance of nondifference is the basis of the treatise.

original: gal te gnyi ga zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If both are seen,

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: the idea is as follows:

original: gang du dngos po gcig snang ba der ni bum pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du dngos po gcig snang ba der ni bum pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Where one thing is seen, there is the understanding that this is the same pot.

original: gang du tha dad pa dag kho na gnyi ga rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis stong bar snang ba der ni ba lang rta dang skyes bu dang glang po zhes mi 'dra ba nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: gang du tha dad pa dag kho na gnyi ga rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis stong bar snang ba der ni ba lang rta dang skyes bu dang glang po zhes mi 'dra ba nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Where different things are seen, empty of each other in some way, there is the understanding of their dissimilarity, as in ‚Äúcow, horse, man, elephant.‚Äù

original: gang zhig tha mi dad kyang rang bzhin gcig dang ldan pa der gsal ba so so la yongs su rdzogs pa'i spyi'i dbang gis mtshungs par gyur pa rnams la 'di ba lang 'di 'ang ba lang ngo zhes rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig tha mi dad kyang rang bzhin gcig dang ldan pa der gsal ba so so la yongs su rdzogs pa'i spyi'i dbang gis mtshungs par gyur pa rnams la 'di ba lang 'di 'ang ba lang ngo zhes rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Where there is no difference, but a single nature, there is the understanding of the individual manifestations as complete in the universal, as in ‚ÄúThis is a cow, that is a cow.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, since there is the apprehension of similarity, how can it be said that there is the appearance of difference?

original: des na mtshungs so zhes 'dzin pa'i phyir tha dad par snang ba yin no zhes ji ltar brjod ce na de ma yin no zhes 'chad pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na mtshungs so zhes 'dzin pa'i phyir tha dad par snang ba yin no zhes ji ltar brjod ce na de ma yin no zhes 'chad pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that this is not so is ‚ÄúHowever‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gsal ba rnams la spyi yod pa dang / rtogs pa de gnyi ga 'dzin pa yin pas gsal ba mi 'dra ba rnams ni tha dad pa'i dngos po gcig yod kyang rang rang gi ngo bor mtshungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams la spyi yod pa dang / rtogs pa de gnyi ga 'dzin pa yin pas gsal ba mi 'dra ba rnams ni tha dad pa'i dngos po gcig yod kyang rang rang gi ngo bor mtshungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And since both the apprehension of the universal and the apprehension of the particular are apprehensions, the different particulars are not the same in their individual natures, even though they are the same in the existence of a single thing.

original: de gnyi ga bzung yang mtshungs so zhes bya bar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga bzung yang mtshungs so zhes bya bar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be that both are apprehended and yet are the same?

original: 'on kyang gsal ba 'di la yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'di la yang yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal ba 'di la yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'di la yang yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But rather, one understands that what exists in this particular is also present in that one.

original: 'di ba lang 'di 'ang ba lang snyam du rtogs pa ni gnyi ga 'dzin pa la srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ba lang 'di 'ang ba lang snyam du rtogs pa ni gnyi ga 'dzin pa la srid pa ma yin te /
translated: The understanding that this cow is a cow is not possible in the apprehension of both,

original: 'on kyang 'di la ba lang nyid 'di la yang ba lang nyid ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di la ba lang nyid 'di la yang ba lang nyid ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but rather, it is that cowness which is in this one is also in that one.

original: ba lang ngo zhes rang gi rten las tha mi dad par rtogs pa ni spyi de dang ldan pa gnyis rtogs par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ba lang ngo zhes rang gi rten las tha mi dad par rtogs pa ni spyi de dang ldan pa gnyis rtogs par mi 'thad de /
translated: The understanding of the particular as not different from its basis is not tenable as the understanding of both that particular and the universal that possesses it,

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it was explained earlier.

original: gal te mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi dngos po mtshungs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi dngos po mtshungs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the nature of the similar is not the same as the thing,

original: mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin yang ji ltar tha mi dad pa yin pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin yang ji ltar tha mi dad pa yin pa de bzhin no //
translated: then how is the nature of the similar not different?

original: tha dad pa yang 'brel pa las gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang 'brel pa las gyur pa yin no //
translated: And if it is different, it is related.

original: gal te 'dir mtshungs par tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni rdzas gcig tu thal ba'i phyir gsal ba'i dbye ba med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir mtshungs par tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni rdzas gcig tu thal ba'i phyir gsal ba'i dbye ba med par 'gyur na /
translated: If the nature of the similar is not different from the thing, then the difference of the manifestation would not exist, because it would follow that there would be only one substance.

original: de ni tshad mas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshad mas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: But that is known by valid cognition.

original: tha dad yin na yang 'di dag la mtshungs pa ni yod /
analyzed: tha dad yin na yang 'di dag la mtshungs pa ni yod /
translated: And if it is different, then there is similarity among these.

original: de'i phyir gsal pa rnams kyi mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin de ni tha dad pa kho na yin @275a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal pa rnams kyi mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin de ni tha dad pa kho na yin @275a * //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the similar of the manifestations is only different,

original: la ; de yang spyi yin no //
analyzed: la ; de yang spyi yin no //
translated: and that is the universal.

original: de ltar dogs pa de gal te de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas bsu nas ji ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar dogs pa de gal te de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas bsu nas ji ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that is doubted, then he says, ‚ÄúIf it is that itself,‚Äù etc.

original: don gzhan ni mtshungs pa zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: don gzhan ni mtshungs pa zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable to say that another object is similar.

original: gcig can gzhan la yod kyang de ni de dag gi mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig can gzhan la yod kyang de ni de dag gi mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Although the other has oneness, that is not the same as the other.

original: rang gi ngo bos mi 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni tha dad pa gzhan du ldan yang mtshungs par 'gyur ba ma yin te rang gi ngo bo mi 'dra ba dag tha dad pa gcig dang ldan pas kyang mtshungs na ni gcig mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungsüîΩpa gnyis su thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos mi 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni tha dad pa gzhan du ldan yang mtshungs par 'gyur ba ma yin te rang gi ngo bo mi 'dra ba dag tha dad pa gcig dang ldan pas kyang mtshungs na ni gcig mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa gnyis su thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is different in its own nature, even if it is associated with a different thing, is not the same, because if things that are different in their own nature were the same even if they were associated with one thing, then it would follow, absurdly, that one thing would be both the same and different.

original: des na tha dad pa'i ba lang nyid gcig yod kyang gcig ba lang yin ba na gzhan yang ba lang du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa'i ba lang nyid gcig yod kyang gcig ba lang yin ba na gzhan yang ba lang du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though the existence of one cowhood is different, when one is a cow, the other is not a cow.

original: rang gi bdag nyid ba lang ma yin na gzhan yod kyang ba lang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ba lang ma yin na gzhan yod kyang ba lang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not a cow by its own nature, then even if it existed, it would not be a cow.

original: ba lang nyid yin na yang gzhan don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang nyid yin na yang gzhan don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it were a cow, then the other would be pointless.

original: des na ba lang nyid gzhan yod kyang ba lang ma yin pa la ba lang ngo snyam du shes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na ba lang nyid gzhan yod kyang ba lang ma yin pa la ba lang ngo snyam du shes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, even though cowhood exists in the other, one does not cognize the other as a cow.

original: ba lang nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya bar ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya bar ni 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be called ‚Äúendowed with cowness.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa byas pas gzhan mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa gsal ba'i phyir gal te de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba dogs pa de nyid bsu nas bzlog pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa byas pas gzhan mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa gsal ba'i phyir gal te de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba dogs pa de nyid bsu nas bzlog pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you say that the reason is because of the similarity to that, then in response to that doubt, he says, ‚ÄúNo, because of the production of a different nature.‚Äù

original: rag las pas nyid ni 'thad kyi /
analyzed: rag las pas nyid ni 'thad kyi /
translated: It is tenable that it depends on that,

original: 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not tenable that it is related to that.

original: ha cang thal ba yang grangs la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan zin to //üîΩmtshungs so zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams las blo tha mi dad pa ni med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni pha rol po dag phyin ci log tu sgrub par bsams nas slar zlog pa ni /
analyzed: ha cang thal ba yang grangs la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan zin to // mtshungs so zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams las blo tha mi dad pa ni med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni pha rol po dag phyin ci log tu sgrub par bsams nas slar zlog pa ni /
translated: The absurd consequence that it would be related to number and so on has already been explained.

original: gal te de dag mtshungs na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag mtshungs na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The response to the opponent‚Äôs argument, thinking that the opponent‚Äôs argument is mistaken, is ‚ÄúIf they are similar . . .‚Äù

original: gal te gsal ba rnams mtshungs na ji ltar tha dad pa'i blos gzung ba yin te gsal ba dag ni mtshungs pa dang / tha dad pa'i blos gzung bar brjod de /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba rnams mtshungs na ji ltar tha dad pa'i blos gzung ba yin te gsal ba dag ni mtshungs pa dang / tha dad pa'i blos gzung bar brjod de /
translated: If the cognitions of the individual things are the same, how can they be apprehended by a different cognition?üîΩFor it is said that the cognitions of the individual things are the same, and that they are apprehended by a different cognition.

original: des na mtshungs pa'i blo nyid 'di dag ni tha mi dad pa'i blo yin no zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mtshungs pa'i blo nyid 'di dag ni tha mi dad pa'i blo yin no zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of sameness is a non-different cognition.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: gal te gsal ba rnams mtshungs pa'i blos gzung ba yin na ji ltar 'di dag tha mi dad pa'i blos gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba rnams mtshungs pa'i blos gzung ba yin na ji ltar 'di dag tha mi dad pa'i blos gzung ba yin no //
translated: If the cognitions of the individual things are apprehended by a cognition of sameness, how can they be apprehended by a non-different cognition?

original: de nyid smras pa ni mtshungs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa ni mtshungs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: That very thing is said to be sameness.

original: 'di lta ste mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par shes pa gal te de tha dad pa'i shes pa yin na @275b ni ba lang dang rta dag la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par shes pa gal te de tha dad pa'i shes pa yin na @275b ni ba lang dang rta dag la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If that cognition of sameness is a different cognition, then it would also be the case for a cow and a horse.

original: des na 'di tha dad dag nyid las ldog pa na tha mi dad par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di tha dad dag nyid las ldog pa na tha mi dad par shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when it is turned away from those differences, it is a cognition of non-difference.

original: 'di tha mi dad pa'i shes pa nyid bzlog pa'i phyir 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di tha mi dad pa'i shes pa nyid bzlog pa'i phyir 'chad pa ni /
translated: In order to refute the cognition that is not different from that, he explains:

original: de mthong ba la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were seen, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te tha dad la brten pa ni tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin snang ba na mtshungs so zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin na ni 'di tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad par shes par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes
analyzed: gal te tha dad la brten pa ni tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin snang ba na mtshungs so zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin na ni 'di tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad par shes par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes
translated: If it is understood that when the different is based on the appearance of the nature of the non-different, it is similar, then it would be the case that the different would be cognized as non-different. But that is not the case, as has been

original: bstan zin to //
analyzed: bstan zin to //
translated: demonstrated.

original: tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad pa yod kyang mtshungs pa me de pas de ltar rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad pa yod kyang mtshungs pa me de pas de ltar rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the different does exist as non-different, it is not cognized in that way, because of the similarity.

original: da ni gang rtogs na mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs pa'i mtshungs pa nyid gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gang rtogs na mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs pa'i mtshungs pa nyid gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that similarity which is cognized as similarity, he says:

original: 'o na ci zhe na zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBut what is it?‚Äù

original: de de ltar 'grel pa nyid du byas nas mdos 'bras bu gcig 'dra zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de de ltar 'grel pa nyid du byas nas mdos 'bras bu gcig 'dra zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having made that very commentary, he says in the treatise: ‚ÄúThe effect is similar.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te tha dad pa rnams kyis mtshungs pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dag gi rang gi ngo bo kho nas mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te tha dad pa rnams kyis mtshungs pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dag gi rang gi ngo bo kho nas mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The reply is: It is not that the different are the same, but rather that they are the same in their own natures.

original: 'di ltar khra bo yang bzho ba dang dgal bar nus pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar khra bo yang bzho ba dang dgal bar nus pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Thus, the variegated is capable of being milked and of eating grass,

original: ser skya yang yin no //
analyzed: ser skya yang yin no //
translated: and so is the tawny.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid ni nye bar mtshon pa ste khra bo yang ba lang yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid ni nye bar mtshon pa ste khra bo yang ba lang yin la /
translated: The fact that they have the same effect is merely an illustration: the variegated is a cow,

original: ser skya yang ba lang yin no //
analyzed: ser skya yang ba lang yin no //
translated: and the tawny is a cow.

original: gal te de lta na ni spyi tha mi dad par khas blang par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni spyi tha mi dad par khas blang par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then is not the difference of the universal admitted?

original: 'di'i 'di ltar brtsad pa 'di ni byis pa'i yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i 'di ltar brtsad pa 'di ni byis pa'i yin gyi /
translated: This dispute is childish.

original: gang gi spyi tha mi dad par 'gyur ba khra bo'i bzho ba dang dag la ba nus pa gang yin pa de nyid ser skya la yang yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi spyi tha mi dad par 'gyur ba khra bo'i bzho ba dang dag la ba nus pa gang yin pa de nyid ser skya la yang yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The capacity of the variegated to be milked and to eat grass is not the same as that of the tawny.

original: rang bzhin gcig nyid yin na ni mtshungs pa nyid du mi 'thad la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig nyid yin na ni mtshungs pa nyid du mi 'thad la /
translated: If they were the same in nature, it would not be tenable that they are the same.

original: tha dad pa gzhan dang ldan pas ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'ga' zhig ba lang yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa gzhan dang ldan pas ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'ga' zhig ba lang yin la /
translated: But it is not that it is endowed with something else that is different from it.

original: de las tha dad pa yin yang gzhan ba lang nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mtshungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa yin yang gzhan ba lang nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mtshungs pa yin gyi /
translated: However, in virtue of its own nature, something is a cow, and although it is different from that, it is cowhood. Therefore, it is the same in virtue of its own nature.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin la /
translated: But it is not the same in virtue of another‚Äôs nature.

original: tha dad pa kho na yin gyi tha mi dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa kho na yin gyi tha mi dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is different, but it is not non-different.

original: des na spyi med pa bzhin du mtshungs pa nyid dang ba lang ba lang zhes bya bar rtogs pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na spyi med pa bzhin du mtshungs pa nyid dang ba lang ba lang zhes bya bar rtogs pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as there is no universal, it is not tenable that there is the cognition ‚ÄúIt is the same‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is a cow.‚Äù

original: des na ba lang zhes rtogs pas tha dad pa'am tha mi dad par dpag pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na ba lang zhes rtogs pas tha dad pa'am tha mi dad par dpag pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the cognition ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù does not infer that it is different or non-different.

original: 'on kyang tha dad du zin kyang 'di yang ba lang yin 'di yang yin no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa de'i dmigs pa ni so so rang gi rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa de tsam zhig yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad du zin kyang 'di yang ba lang yin 'di yang yin no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa de'i dmigs pa ni so so rang gi rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa de tsam zhig yin no //
translated: However, even though it is different, the object of the cognition ‚ÄúThis is a cow, and that is a cow‚Äù is just that which is the ultimate nature of each individual.

original: des na 'di @276a * //
analyzed: des na 'di @276a * //
translated: Therefore, this is not a universal.

original: ba lang zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni khra bo la sogs pa la rtogs pa 'khrul pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni khra bo la sogs pa la rtogs pa 'khrul pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The nature of the cognition of the so-called cow is not mistaken with respect to the variegated cow, etc.

original: 'on kyang de mthong ba la ltos pa la sgra la sogs pa rtogs pa na gcig la de ltar gyur pas mthong ba bzhin du rtogs pa na tha dad pa 'khrul par gyur pa'i rgyu brjod du med pa'i rtogs pa 'ga' zhig rjes su dpog par byed pa
analyzed: 'on kyang de mthong ba la ltos pa la sgra la sogs pa rtogs pa na gcig la de ltar gyur pas mthong ba bzhin du rtogs pa na tha dad pa 'khrul par gyur pa'i rgyu brjod du med pa'i rtogs pa 'ga' zhig rjes su dpog par byed pa
translated: However, when one cognizes sound, etc., in dependence on seeing that cow, one cognizes it as it is, and one infers some inexpressible cognition that is the cause of the error of difference.

original: ni des na 'dir spyi smra ba'am de med par mngon par zhen pa gang rtogs pa la mkhas pa yin zhes ltos /
analyzed: ni des na 'dir spyi smra ba'am de med par mngon par zhen pa gang rtogs pa la mkhas pa yin zhes ltos /
translated: Therefore, in this regard, it is the one who is skilled in the cognition of the so-called universal or who is skilled in the cognition of the nonexistence of that who is the expert.

original: rtogs pa'i rjes su rtog ge 'brang ba dang / rtog ge'i rjes su yang rtogs pa 'brang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di khyed kyis ma brjod cig /'brel pa ni kho bos ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rjes su rtog ge 'brang ba dang / rtog ge'i rjes su yang rtogs pa 'brang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di khyed kyis ma brjod cig /'brel pa ni kho bos ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Do not say that ‚Äúinference follows cognition‚Äù and ‚Äúcognition follows inference,‚Äù because the connection is ‚ÄúI say that . . .‚Äù

original: don gyi shes pa la zhes bya ba ni spyi'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: don gyi shes pa la zhes bya ba ni spyi'i shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWith respect to the cognition of the object‚Äù means with respect to the cognition of the universal.

original: 'dis 'khrul pas de ltar sre bar byed do zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i dbang gis brjod pa yin gyi ba lang ngo ba lang ngo snyam pa 'di la ni 'dres par 'gyur pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'dis 'khrul pas de ltar sre bar byed do zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i dbang gis brjod pa yin gyi ba lang ngo ba lang ngo snyam pa 'di la ni 'dres par 'gyur pa ci yang med de /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is due to error that one posits it in that way‚Äù is made on the basis of the nondifference of the cognition as it has been explained, but there is no mixing at all of the thought ‚Äúthis is a cow‚Äù and ‚Äúthat is a cow.‚Äù

original: phyi la de yod na de ltar rtogs pa mi rung ngo zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: phyi la de yod na de ltar rtogs pa mi rung ngo zhes bshad zin to //
translated: If there were, it would be impossible to have a cognition of that kind, as has already been explained.

original: 'bras bu gcig 'bras zhes brjod pa la /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig 'bras zhes brjod pa la /
translated: The statement ‚Äúhaving a single effect‚Äù is madeüîΩwith regard to the cognition of a single effect.

original: gzhan dag de nyid kyis mi srid par bsams nas phyir bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag de nyid kyis mi srid par bsams nas phyir bzlog pa ni /
translated: Thinking that this is impossible, the opponent rejects it, saying,

original: de dag gi 'bras blo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras blo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of that effect.‚Äù

original: blo zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tsam nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tsam nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúcognition‚Äù merely illustrates the effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bum pa la sogs pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bum pa la sogs pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is why it will be explained that ‚Äúa pot, etc.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig la tha mi dad pa yang 'ga' zhig las tha dad par pha rol po dag gis khas blangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la tha mi dad pa yang 'ga' zhig las tha dad par pha rol po dag gis khas blangs pa nyid de /
translated: The opponent himself accepts that something that is not different from something else is different from it.

original: ba lang nyid khra bo la sogs pa dang rta las bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid khra bo la sogs pa dang rta las bzhin no //
translated: Cows are different from horses, etc., and from the variegated, etc.

original: de bzhin du tha dad pa'i blo khra bo la sogs pa la tha mi dad par 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu nas dngos po re re la zhes gong nas byung ba dang bcas pa'i mdo sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tha dad pa'i blo khra bo la sogs pa la tha mi dad par 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu nas dngos po re re la zhes gong nas byung ba dang bcas pa'i mdo sbyor ro //
translated: The sutra is applied with the addition of ‚Äúto each thing‚Äù from above.

original: blo gang zhig gang las skye ba de ni dngos po gzhan las tha dad pa dang 'dra bar de 'dzin pa'i blo las tha dad pa'i phyir khra bo la sogs pa dag blo gcig gi 'bras bu can ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gang zhig gang las skye ba de ni dngos po gzhan las tha dad pa dang 'dra bar de 'dzin pa'i blo las tha dad pa'i phyir khra bo la sogs pa dag blo gcig gi 'bras bu can ma yin no //
translated: That cognition which arises from that is different from other things, and like that, it is different from the cognition apprehending that. Therefore variegated things and so on are not the effects of a single cognition.

original: tshogs pa la ni de dag 'dzin pa gcig par 'gyur ro ;üîΩ; shes pa gang la snang ba de ni de la snang ba gang yin pa de dang 'dra bar tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar de dag 'bras bu gcig pa can yin /
analyzed: tshogs pa la ni de dag 'dzin pa gcig par 'gyur ro ; ; shes pa gang la snang ba de ni de la snang ba gang yin pa de dang 'dra bar tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar de dag 'bras bu gcig pa can yin /
translated: In the case of a collection, they would be apprehended as one.üîΩThat which appears to a consciousness is different from that which appears to it, since it is like that. How could they be the same effect?

original: snang bzhin pa ltar de yang sdang ba'i shes pa yang tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar shes pa don rnams kyis tha mi dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa ltar de yang sdang ba'i shes pa yang tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar shes pa don rnams kyis tha mi dad pa yin gyi /
translated: Since the appearing object and the consciousness apprehending it are different, how could the consciousness be non-different from the objects?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gi @276b 'bras bu ni de yin na zhes smras so //
analyzed: de dag gi @276b 'bras bu ni de yin na zhes smras so //
translated: If their effect is that, then it is said:üîΩIf their effect is that, then it is said:üîΩIf their effect is that, then it is said:üîΩIf their effect is that, then it is said:üîΩIf their effect is that, then it is said:
